original: rang bzhin de mtha' dag rtogs shing de kho na bzhin rjes su brtags pa yin yang ji ltar don skad cig nyid la sogs pa'i chos su gyur pa de bzhin du rtogs pa po dag gis rtogs par ni mi nus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de mtha' dag rtogs shing de kho na bzhin rjes su brtags pa yin yang ji ltar don skad cig nyid la sogs pa'i chos su gyur pa de bzhin du rtogs pa po dag gis rtogs par ni mi nus te /
translated: Although the nature of all things is realized and examined in that way, it is not possible for the cognizers to realize the objects just as they are, as momentary phenomena and so forth.

original: des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa de la rtogs pa po'i 'du byed med pa'i phyir dngos su na mngon sum yin yang rtogs pa po de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa de la rtogs pa po'i 'du byed med pa'i phyir dngos su na mngon sum yin yang rtogs pa po de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, although it is direct perception in actuality, it is not direct perception because the cognizers do not realize it in that way, due to the absence of the formative mental factors of the cognizers who possess the reasons for error.

original: de @98b las rnam par mi gnas pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @98b las rnam par mi gnas pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it is not direct perception because it does not abide in that.

original: tshig rnams khyad par dang ldan pa nyid la ni rigs pa 'di mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshig rnams khyad par dang ldan pa nyid la ni rigs pa 'di mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show that this reasoning is not possible for words that possess distinctions, it says, because there is no reason for error.

original: gang gis na snang ba de shes pa gzhan gyis rjes su rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba skyes bus ma byas pa'i dag rnams la khyad par yod kyang skad cig ma nyid bzhin du mngon sum ma yin par ni mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gis na snang ba de shes pa gzhan gyis rjes su rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ba skyes bus ma byas pa'i dag rnams la khyad par yod kyang skad cig ma nyid bzhin du mngon sum ma yin par ni mi srid de /
translated: But how could the appearance be understood by another cognition? It is not possible that there is no direct perception of the difference, as in the case of momentariness, even though there is a difference in the unfabricated appearances.

original: de dang rang bzhin gcig pa yin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pas mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi srid de /
analyzed: de dang rang bzhin gcig pa yin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pas mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya bar ni mi srid de /
translated: Even if it is of the same nature as that, it is not direct perception because it possesses a reason for error.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te 'di'o zhes bya ba nyid du snang ba 'di la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med do re zhig khyad par med par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te 'di'o zhes bya ba nyid du snang ba 'di la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med do re zhig khyad par med par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: There is no reason for error in this appearance as it is, saying ‚Äúthis is it.‚Äù First, there is indeed error with the characteristic of superimposition without distinction.

original: de nyid las rgyu mtshan brtags par bya ba yin no zhe na 'khrul pa mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid las rgyu mtshan brtags par bya ba yin no zhe na 'khrul pa mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: If it is said that the reason should be examined in that very case, it is said because error would not occur.

original: khyad par med par ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes ma grub bo //
analyzed: khyad par med par ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes ma grub bo //
translated: It is not established that there is error without distinction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gnod par byed pa med pas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gnod par byed pa med pas so //
translated: Why? Because there is no harm in it.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa las khyad par med pa ni don bya ba med pa nyid skad cig ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du dag gi khyad par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa rtag pa las khyad par med pa ni don bya ba med pa nyid skad cig ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du dag gi khyad par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni med do //
translated: Just as it is understood that a pot, etc., which is not different from the permanent is mistaken, because it is the nature of a moment, which is devoid of purpose, in the same way, there is no valid cognition that establishes the difference of the pot.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /üîΩgang du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i don la mngon sum de dang mi 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis chos gzhan sgrub par srid pa der khyad par med par rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar 'thad kyi mngon sum gyis khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te / gang du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i don la mngon sum de dang mi 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis chos gzhan sgrub par srid pa der khyad par med par rtogs pa 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar 'thad kyi mngon sum gyis khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin
translated: This is what is said:

original: du grub pa'i ngag dag la ni de ltar khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du grub pa'i ngag dag la ni de ltar khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is possible that in a case where a fact is established by perception, another valid cognition, without contradicting that perception, establishes another fact. In that case, it is tenable to say that the understanding of non-difference is mistaken. But in the case of statements where the nature of non-difference is established by perception, there is no other valid cognition that establishes a difference.

original: de'i phyir 'dir mngon sum gyis grub pa'i don la de dang mi 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis khyad par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir mngon sum gyis grub pa'i don la de dang mi 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis khyad par sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, it is not possible for another valid cognition to establish a distinction in regard to an object that is established by direct perception, without contradicting that [direct perception].

original: khyad par rtogs pa med par myong ba de la byed pa med pa'i phyir khyad par rtog pa nyid ma spangs par grub pa de la tshad ma gzhan gyis khyad par grub na rnam par rtog pa khyad par med par rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med par myong ba de la byed pa med pa'i phyir khyad par rtog pa nyid ma spangs par grub pa de la tshad ma gzhan gyis khyad par grub na rnam par rtog pa khyad par med par rtogs pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no
translated: Because the experience [of the object] without the realization of a distinction is without activity, if a distinction is established by another valid cognition in regard to that [object] which is established without the abandonment of the very conceptualization of a distinction, then the realization of the object without a distinction would be mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir bzhed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa med pas na 'khrul pa med pa nyid do @99a * //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir bzhed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa med pas na 'khrul pa med pa nyid do @99a * // zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the meaning that is intended here, but it is not that [the object] is without error because there is no fault.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis khyad par med par grub pa la khyad par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis khyad par med par grub pa la khyad par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid do //
translated: However, in regard to that which is established without a distinction by direct perception, there is no valid cognition that establishes a distinction.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa ni nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa ni nges par mi nus te /
translated: That there is no fault cannot be ascertained.

original: da ltar gyi dus na de med par rtogs kyi dus gzhan du ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na de med par rtogs kyi dus gzhan du ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is realized that it does not exist at the present time, not at another time.

original: dus gzhan du gnod pa byed pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin te lan cig gnod pa mthong bas phyis gnod pa mthong ba don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnod pa byed pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin pa ma yin te lan cig gnod pa mthong bas phyis gnod pa mthong ba don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not the case that what is harmful at another time is not harmful, because if one sees harm once, one would not see harm later on, and it would not be as it really is.

original: shes par byed pa tsam med pas shes bya med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa tsam med pas shes bya med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the object of knowledge does not exist because the means of knowledge does not exist.

original: gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i shes par byed pa yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i shes par byed pa yin gyi skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And the means of knowledge is not a producer, but a harm-doer.

original: de lta yin na ni rjes su dpag pa gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid du nges pa kho nar 'gyur bas de la slob dpon sun 'byin ba brjod pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rjes su dpag pa gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid du nges pa kho nar 'gyur bas de la slob dpon sun 'byin ba brjod pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then inference would be ascertained as having an object that is not harmed, and it would not be tenable for the master to state refutations regarding that.

original: des na ji skad bshad pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: des na ji skad bshad pa nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, what was explained is reasonable.

original: skyes bu dag la ni khyad par mthong ba nyid khyad par med par rtogs pa'i gnod par byed pa yin te gang gi phyir skyes bu dag gi yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba de'i phyir rig byed kyi tshad ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub
analyzed: skyes bu dag la ni khyad par mthong ba nyid khyad par med par rtogs pa'i gnod par byed pa yin te gang gi phyir skyes bu dag gi yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba de'i phyir rig byed kyi tshad ma dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub
translated: For the person who sees the difference in the qualities of persons, the non-difference is invalidated.

original: byed mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the qualities of persons are seen to be different, the proof of the validity of the Vedas and of omniscience are not similar.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin med mod /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin med mod /
translated: If there is no non-perceptual nature that is not different from the perceptual entity,

original: tha dad pa gang yin pa de go mngon sum ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa gang yin pa de go mngon sum ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could that which is different not be non-perceptual?

original: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa zhes smras so //
translated: The difference in words is called a different nature.

original: tshig gi khyad par tha dad pa ni tshig gi khyad par ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par tha dad pa ni tshig gi khyad par ma yin gyi /
translated: A difference in words is not a difference in words,

original: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan nyid du zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po gzhan nyid du zad do //
translated: but rather it is just a different entity.

original: des na gal te 'di dag de'i phyir 'brel par gyur pa de lta na yang dngos po dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa zhes pa tsam gyis ni de dang 'brel pa las ma rtogs par 'di'i rang bzhin rang bzhin gzhan las khyad par 'gyur ba ma yin no
analyzed: des na gal te 'di dag de'i phyir 'brel par gyur pa de lta na yang dngos po dngos po gzhan dang 'brel pa zhes pa tsam gyis ni de dang 'brel pa las ma rtogs par 'di'i rang bzhin rang bzhin gzhan las khyad par 'gyur ba ma yin no
translated: Therefore, even if these are related to that, by the mere fact that a thing is related to another thing, its nature is not distinguished from another nature, without understanding its relation to that.

original: // de'i phyir mdun na gnas pa'i me la mchod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngag thams cad skyes bus byed do //
analyzed: // de'i phyir mdun na gnas pa'i me la mchod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngag thams cad skyes bus byed do //
translated: Therefore, all statements with a nature that is not distinguished, such as ‚ÄúI worship the fire in front,‚Äù are produced by a person.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin te /
translated: Or else, it is not produced by anything at all.

original: byang phyogs yul na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byang phyogs yul na zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that, such as ‚Äúin the northern country.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar gang zhig rnam pa ji lta bu'i rgyus bskyed pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i @99b rgyu las skyes pa las mi 'da' la /
analyzed: des na de ltar gang zhig rnam pa ji lta bu'i rgyus bskyed pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i @99b rgyu las skyes pa las mi 'da' la /
translated: Therefore, in that way, whatever is produced by a cause of some kind does not go beyond being produced from a cause of that kind.

original: de'i khyad par ni tshogs pa'i khyad par las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni tshogs pa'i khyad par las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Its distinction arises from the distinction of the collection.

original: des na skyu ru ra la sogs pa dang skyes bu dag la khyad par yang ma yin la /
analyzed: des na skyu ru ra la sogs pa dang skyes bu dag la khyad par yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the sour fruit and the person.

original: dag ni mthong ba'i rgyu can las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dag ni mthong ba'i rgyu can las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the existence of the other world ascertained on the basis of the seen.

original: des na de ltar gcig la mthong ba'i rang bzhin thams cad du de ltar nges pa bsal nas skyon gzhan yang ston pas pha rol po rang gi khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de ltar gcig la mthong ba'i rang bzhin thams cad du de ltar nges pa bsal nas skyon gzhan yang ston pas pha rol po rang gi khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having refuted the essential nature of seeing in one thing as being the same in all, the master now demonstrates another error, namely, that the opponent‚Äôs position contradicts his own beliefs.

original: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe self and the world are not perceived, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra ba dag gis 'dod pa'i bdag kyang mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag gis 'dod pa'i bdag kyang mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The self that is asserted by the proponents of the self is not perceived.

original: ma dmigs kyang med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma dmigs kyang med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But even though it is not perceived, it is not ascertained as nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dgag pa'i don du khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams nyid sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba mngon par grub pa yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni 'jig rten pha rol yod pa dgag pa'i don du khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams nyid sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba mngon par grub pa yin par rtogs so //
translated: Similarly, others, in order to refute the existence of the other world, conceive that the elements such as semen and blood are established as the self that has the nature of consciousness.

original: lus zhes bya bar mngon par brjod pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid ni sems pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bor snang ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa yod pa yin na med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus zhes bya bar mngon par brjod pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid ni sems pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bor snang ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa yod pa yin na med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The elements that are designated as the body are not the appearance of the nature of the mind. Therefore, the non-observation of that exists, but it is not non-existent.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúearth‚Äù illustrates the elements.

original: stsogs pa'i sgra'i don ni rang nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgra'i don ni rang nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù will be shown.

original: mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na'o //
translated: That is the non-observation.

original: gtan tshigs med sgrub yin na ma ci /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med sgrub yin na ma ci /
translated: If it is a proof without a reason, what is it?

original: ci'i phyir yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yin /
translated: Why is it?

original: rang gi ngo bo khyad par med pa'i phyir de tshad ma yin na /üîΩthams cad tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo khyad par med pa'i phyir de tshad ma yin na / thams cad tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
translated: If it is a valid cognition because of the absence of a specific nature,üîΩthen all are not valid cognitions.

original: yin na yang thams cad tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin na yang thams cad tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if it is a valid cognition, then all are valid cognitions.

original: des na mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not assert that ‚Äúbecause of non-observation, the reason is understood to be absent in the discordant class,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag la mi dmigs kyang med par ma grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de dag la mi dmigs kyang med par ma grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: If they are not established as nonexistent, even though they are not observed, then they are not established as nonexistent.

original: 'grel pa ni mi dmigs pa tshad mar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni mi dmigs pa tshad mar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Commentary states, ‚ÄúNonobservation is a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa smra ba 'brel ba mi 'dod par mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag tu smra ba yang gzhe  med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa smra ba 'brel ba mi 'dod par mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag tu smra ba yang gzhe  med par 'gyur te /
translated: For those who advocate nonobservation but do not accept a relation, this nonobservation would not be a valid cognition.

original: rten yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i rten bdag mi dmigs pas med par grub pas na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro // de'i rten bdag mi dmigs pas med par grub pas na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self would not exist because its basis would not exist.üîΩSince the basis of the self is not observed, it is established as nonexistent.

original: rten med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ston pas bdag tu smra ba'i rten la dmigs pa med @100a * //üîΩpar 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: rten med pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ston pas bdag tu smra ba'i rten la dmigs pa med @100a * // par 'chad pa ni /
translated: The Commentary explains that the reason for the absence of a basis is that the basis of the self is not observed.

original: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The Commentary states, ‚ÄúBecause the self is not directly perceived.‚Äù

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus las ma gtogs pa bdag rang nyid myong ba ni med de de las ma gtogs pa 'ga' yang gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus las ma gtogs pa bdag rang nyid myong ba ni med de de las ma gtogs pa 'ga' yang gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from the bodies of self and others, there is no self that experiences itself. This is because apart from them, there is no self that is manifest.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: There is no realization apart from the aggregates of form, etc.üîΩBut isn‚Äôt the self the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù?

original: gal te nga'o snyam du rtogs pas rig par bya ba bdag ma yin nam /üîΩrig bya tha dad pa la rig par byed pa 'di'o zhes tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur te rig par bya ba tha dad pa kho na la de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te nga'o snyam du rtogs pas rig par bya ba bdag ma yin nam / rig bya tha dad pa la rig par byed pa 'di'o zhes tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur te rig par bya ba tha dad pa kho na la de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù were the self, then the self would be different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩBut the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the self is the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rig par byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe 'di la 'jal bar byed ba gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jal ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid tha dad pa med par nga'o zhes tha dad paüîΩmed par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rig par byed pa'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe 'di la 'jal bar byed ba gzhan dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jal ba po'i rang gi bdag nyid tha dad pa med par nga'o zhes tha dad pa med par gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'o zhes rtogs pa dang ma 'dres pa nga'o snyam pa'i bzung ba ni bdag go zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'o zhes rtogs pa dang ma 'dres pa nga'o snyam pa'i bzung ba ni bdag go zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not different from the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the self is not different from

original: lus la sogs pa ni nga skye ma mo snyam du nga'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin yang 'di ni nga'i lus so snyam du 'di'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni nga skye ma mo snyam du nga'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin yang 'di ni nga'i lus so snyam du 'di'o snyam pa'i rtogs pa dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and so on are also the self, because the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is present, but the thought ‚ÄúThis is mine‚Äù is also present.

original: de bzhin du shes pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
translated: In the same way, consciousness and so on are also the self.

original: 'di la brjod pa gal te 'jal bar byed pa po nyid grub na tha dad pa med pa'i 'jal ba po la ni nga'o snyam du rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa gal te 'jal bar byed pa po nyid grub na tha dad pa med pa'i 'jal ba po la ni nga'o snyam du rtogs la /
translated: We reply: If the experiencer itself were established, then the experiencer, which is not different from the self, would be the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de las tha dad pa'i phyir ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i phyir ni 'di'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But because it is different from that, it would be the thought ‚ÄúThis is.‚Äù

original: yul gsal ba ni yul mngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: yul gsal ba ni yul mngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: The object that is clear is the nature of the object that is manifest.üîΩTherefore, if it is different from that, it is not the nature of the object that is manifest. How could it be the experiencer of the object that is hidden?

original: des na gal te de las bdag gzhan nyid yin na de'i yul mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yul lkog tu gyur pa na rang nyid 'ba' zhig 'jal ba por 'gyur te 'on te yul mngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid gsal ba
analyzed: des na gal te de las bdag gzhan nyid yin na de'i yul mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yul lkog tu gyur pa na rang nyid 'ba' zhig 'jal ba por 'gyur te 'on te yul mngon du byed pa'i bdag nyid gsal ba
translated: If the object that is clear is the nature of the object that is manifest,

original: de nyid 'jal ba po yin na de ltar rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin la ltos te nga'o snyam du rtogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de nyid 'jal ba po yin na de ltar rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin la ltos te nga'o snyam du rtogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: If it were the experiencer of that, then it would be the self, in dependence on the nature of its own awareness.

original: 'on kyang de la yang 'di'o snyam du rtogs par yod pas na gang la nga'o snyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na bdag yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la yang 'di'o snyam du rtogs par yod pas na gang la nga'o snyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na bdag yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since it is also the case that it is realized as ‚Äúthis,‚Äù then that which is the self in the sense of ‚ÄúI am‚Äù would be the self.

original: gang la rnam pa 'dir 'gyur ba gsal bar bya ba la sogs su gsal ba snang ba ni med do zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam pa 'dir 'gyur ba gsal bar bya ba la sogs su gsal ba snang ba ni med do zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: But it is not the case that there is a manifestation of that in the form of ‚Äúthis,‚Äù such as the manifestation of clarity.

original: mngon du byed pa @100b de dang 'brel pa'i phyir don de'i mngon sum nyid do zhe na ma yin te 'brel kyang tha dad pa mi ldog pa'i phyir yul ni gsal ba nyid kyi mngon sum yin gyi de dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa @100b de dang 'brel pa'i phyir don de'i mngon sum nyid do zhe na ma yin te 'brel kyang tha dad pa mi ldog pa'i phyir yul ni gsal ba nyid kyi mngon sum yin gyi de dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that it is the direct perception of that object because it is related to the manifestation, that is not so, because even if there is a relation, the difference is not eliminated. The object is the direct perception of clarity, but it is not related to that.

original: 'brel par ni gzhal bya yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel par ni gzhal bya yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the object of comprehension different in the relation.

original: yul mngon du byed pa po nyid kyis 'jal bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul mngon du byed pa po nyid kyis 'jal bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the agent of the manifestation of the object that is the comprehender.

original: yul mngon sum du byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul mngon sum du byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not by the nature of the object being perceived.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i byed pa po la yang don lkog tu gyur pa kho na ra 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i byed pa po la yang don lkog tu gyur pa kho na ra 'gyur te /
translated: But if the agent is not a direct perceiver, then the object would be hidden,

original: don mngon sum gyi rgyu'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don mngon sum gyi rgyu'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and it would not be a direct perceiver of the cause of the object.

original: byed pa po yang rgyu las khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po yang rgyu las khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And the agent would not be different from the cause,

original: bya ba dang ldan yang khyad par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan yang khyad par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be established as different from the action.

original: bdag kho na 'jal bar byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba yang ga las 'jal ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bdag kho na 'jal bar byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba yang ga las 'jal ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And it is also not the case that the self alone is the agent, because it is the one who possesses the action of perceiving.

original: 'di la yang tshad ma ci yod ngas shes so snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshad ma ci yod ngas shes so snyam du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And if you think that it is because of the thought ‚ÄúI know,‚Äù then what is the valid knowledge in that?

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin nga'o snyam du rtogs pa 'di bdag nyid kyi yin na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin nga'o snyam du rtogs pa 'di bdag nyid kyi yin na /
translated: If the nature of the thought ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is the self,

original: bya ba de ni rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang 'brel pa'i bya ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba de ni rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir rang dang 'brel pa'i bya ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action is different from the nature of the self, the self is not perceived as related to the action.

original: des na byed pa po nyid du ga la rtogs te bya ba rtogs pa med par der mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: des na byed pa po nyid du ga la rtogs te bya ba rtogs pa med par der mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: How then could the self be perceived as the agent? Because it is not perceived as the action, it is not established as the agent.

original: / bdag dang yid 'brel pa las de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi bde ba la sogs pa bzhin 'jal ba dang ldan par 'dzin to zhe na ma yin te yid dang 'brel kyang bdag la gsal bzhin pa nyid ma skyes na yin gyi mngon sum yin parüîΩmi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di la gsal bzhin pa yang gzhan yod pa ma yin te rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bdag dang yid 'brel pa las de'i yul can gyi mngon sum gyi bde ba la sogs pa bzhin 'jal ba dang ldan par 'dzin to zhe na ma yin te yid dang 'brel kyang bdag la gsal bzhin pa nyid ma skyes na yin gyi mngon sum yin par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro // 'di la gsal bzhin pa yang gzhan yod pa ma yin te rang nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the self is perceived as the experiencer of pleasure and so on, which is related to the mind, the object of the direct perception, we say it is not so, because even though the self is related to the mind, if the self is not clearly manifest, it is not established as the object of direct perception.üîΩHere, the self is not clearly manifest to another, because it is by nature self-cognizing.

original: gsal bzhin ba nyid la ni gsal bzhin ba gzhan dang gzhan 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal bzhin ba nyid la ni gsal bzhin ba gzhan dang gzhan 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: And the self is not clearly manifest to itself, because it is not established as another.

original: min na yang snga na med pa'i bya ba skyed pas mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: min na yang snga na med pa'i bya ba skyed pas mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If not, then it follows that it is impermanent because it produces an action that did not exist previously.

original: bya ba dang byed pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Since neither action nor agent exists, this is not a relationship.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa las ma rtogs par gzugs la sogs pa ltar snang na bdag gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa las ma rtogs par gzugs la sogs pa ltar snang na bdag gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not manifest in the same way that form and so on are manifest from form and so on.

original: gal te re zhig nga'o snyam du rtogs pa nyams su myong bas grub pa ni yod pa @101a * //
analyzed: gal te re zhig nga'o snyam du rtogs pa nyams su myong bas grub pa ni yod pa @101a * //
translated: If you say that the self is manifest from form and so on, because the cognition ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is experienced and established,

original: nyid la gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag gsal ba yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyid la gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag gsal ba yang de nyid yin no //
translated: then that very self, which is distinct from form and so on, is manifest.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa yin no zhe 'am /
translated: If you say that is a misconception,

original: de lta bu'i myong ba nyid rtsa ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i myong ba nyid rtsa ba yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then that very experience is the root.

original: 'dir yang brjod de de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba rang nyid gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: 'dir yang brjod de de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba rang nyid gsal ba yin na /
translated: Here we say: If the self were manifest in that way,

original: bya ba la sogs pa dang ldan par ma rtogs pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa dang ldan par ma rtogs pa'i phyir bdag ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: then it would not be the self because it is not cognized as possessing action and so on.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyi yul yin na ni ngo bo zhes bya bar mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyi yul yin na ni ngo bo zhes bya bar mi 'grub bo //
translated: If it is the object of another, it is not established as an entity.

original: bdag nyid kyis nga'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis nga'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is of such a nature that it is ‚ÄúI‚Äù by itself.

original: rnal 'byor pas gzhan gyi bdag mngon sum du byas pa na yang de ltar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gzhan gyi bdag mngon sum du byas pa na yang de ltar rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, it would follow, absurdly, that when a yogi directly perceives the self of another, he would realize it in that way.

original: rang nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin la yang gsal bar bya ba med par ni gsal ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin la yang gsal bar bya ba med par ni gsal ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: Nor is it the case that a clarity that is not to be clarified is established as clarity.

original: de ltar yin par gyur na gsal bar bya ba las gsal bar byed pa tha dad par grub pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin par gyur na gsal bar bya ba las gsal bar byed pa tha dad par grub pa'i phyir mi 'dra bar rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then since the clarifier would be established as different from the clarified, it would not be realized as being similar.

original: de'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa 'brel pa med par de ltar snang bzhin pa nyid lnga'o snyam par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba la sogs pa 'brel pa med par de ltar snang bzhin pa nyid lnga'o snyam par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since action and so on are not related, it is realized that they are merely appearing in that way.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i phyir na bdag mngon sum ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i phyir na bdag mngon sum ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, since it is not beyond the nature of conceptualization, the self is only not directly perceptible.

original: yang na khas blangs pa'i bdag ma dmigs kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir med par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i khas blangs pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma ma yin pas na gtan tshigs med par yang mi 'grub po zhes brjod
analyzed: yang na khas blangs pa'i bdag ma dmigs kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir med par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i khas blangs pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma ma yin pas na gtan tshigs med par yang mi 'grub po zhes brjod
translated: Or, if you do not assert that the self does not exist because it is not perceived, even though you do not perceive the self that you accept, then because of your acceptance of it, it is not a valid cognition of nonperception. Therefore, it is not established even without a reason.

original: pa na / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i mngon sum yin pa nyid 'bras bu grub pa'i yan lag tu nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa na / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i mngon sum yin pa nyid 'bras bu grub pa'i yan lag tu nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: When this is said, the other party posits the mere existence of direct perception that is accepted by the other party as a part of the proof of the thesis.

original: gang dag mngon sum du smra ba de la ni mngon sum ma yin par yang sgrub pas de med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag mngon sum du smra ba de la ni mngon sum ma yin par yang sgrub pas de med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who propound direct perception, it is established as not being direct perception, so it would not exist at all.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyang 'dis grub pas yang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa nyid du brjod pa don ci yod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyang 'dis grub pas yang rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa nyid du brjod pa don ci yod /
translated: Since this establishes that it is not an object of inference, what is the point of saying that it is an object of inference?

original: ci ste yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi dmigs pa mtha' dag ldog pa'i phyir de la de med pa ni 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi dmigs pa mtha' dag ldog pa'i phyir de la de med pa ni 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: But if you say that it is only tenable that it does not exist there because the entire observation of the reason in the discordant case is reversed,

original: bdag ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so for the self.

original: des na de med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su @101b dpag par yang nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su @101b dpag par yang nus pa yin te /
translated: For, the reason can also be inferred in the dissimilar instance,

original: gzhan du dmigs na rjes su dpag pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du dmigs na rjes su dpag pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the other is perceived, the inference arises.

original: 'di ni nam yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtogs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni nam yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtogs par ma gyur te /
translated: This [reason] has never been understood in the dissimilar instance.

original: des na rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is an inference.

original: bdag la ni rjes su dpog pa yod pa de'i phyir de ni mngon sum ma yin yang med par ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la ni rjes su dpog pa yod pa de'i phyir de ni mngon sum ma yin yang med par ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Since there is an inference for the self, it is not tenable that it is nonexistent, even though it is not perceived.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: bdag rjes su dpag par bya bar 'dod pas kyang rjes su dpag pa med par de khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rjes su dpag par bya bar 'dod pas kyang rjes su dpag pa med par de khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the self is asserted to be an object of inference, it is not accepted without an inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa med kyang gal te yod na skyon ci yod ces de ltar ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med kyang gal te yod na skyon ci yod ces de ltar ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis bdag 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The proponents of the self do not assert the self in this way, thinking, ‚ÄúIf it exists, what is the problem, even without an inference?‚Äù

original: tshad ma med par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med par khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not accept it without a valid means of knowledge.

original: de tshad ma ltar snang ba zhes bya bar go 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de tshad ma ltar snang ba zhes bya bar go 'gyur mod /
translated: It is indeed understood that it is called a ‚Äúseeming valid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig lung gis grub pa nyid du yang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lung gis grub pa nyid du yang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But some assert that it is established by scripture.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa bsal ba ni don med do //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa bsal ba ni don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to refute inference.

original: bsal du zin kyang bdag yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bsal du zin kyang bdag yod par khas len pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Even if it is refuted, you still accept the existence of a self.

original: / ma bsal ba na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis grub bo //
analyzed: / ma bsal ba na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs yod pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis grub bo //
translated: Even if it is not refuted, it is established by inference itself because it is not similar to the existence of a reason in the discordant side.üîΩTherefore, this should be stated.

original: de'i phyir 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na brjod par bya ba bden pas de brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na brjod par bya ba bden pas de brjod do //
translated: Since it is true that it should be stated, I will state it.

original: mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag tu smra pa yang gzhi dmigs pa med pas 'gyur te zhes gsungs ba 'di'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag tu smra pa yang gzhi dmigs pa med pas 'gyur te zhes gsungs ba 'di'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The purpose of the statement ‚ÄúThis proponent of a self is also a nonobservation of a perceptible object‚Äù is this.

original: mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin na bdag tu smra ba pha rol po dbang du byas nas bdag sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba de rten med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin na bdag tu smra ba pha rol po dbang du byas nas bdag sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa sbyor ba de rten med par 'gyur te /
translated: If non-apprehension is a valid cognition, then the syllogism that proves the self in dependence on the opponent who advocates the self would be without a basis.

original: gzhi ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be without a ground.

original: bdag tu smra ba'i bdag sgrub par byed pa tshul gsum brjod pa las gzhan dag tsam gyis rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang med de //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i bdag sgrub par byed pa tshul gsum brjod pa las gzhan dag tsam gyis rang bzhin ni 'ga' yang med de //
translated: There is no nature whatsoever that is established by mere statements of the trimodal criterion in the proof of the self by the advocates of the self.

original: gang gi tshe gang ma dmigs pa de med do zhes khas len pa de'i tshe bdag ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir de nyid ni chos can du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang ma dmigs pa de med do zhes khas len pa de'i tshe bdag ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir de nyid ni chos can du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: When one accepts that whatever is not apprehended does not exist, then, because the self does not exist like the horn of an ass, it cannot be posited as the subject.

original: chos can lus bdag dang bcas par sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos tshad mas gnod pas na phyogs kyi skyon bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can lus bdag dang bcas par sgrub pa gang yin pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos tshad mas gnod pas na phyogs kyi skyon bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the proof of the body as the subject together with the self would also be a fault of the position, because the property to be proven is undermined by valid cognitions.

original: des na gal te mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin la mngon sum gyis bsal pa yin la /
analyzed: des na gal te mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin la mngon sum gyis bsal pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, if non-apprehension is a valid cognition of direct perception and is refuted by direct perception,

original: de ste @102a * //
analyzed: de ste @102a * //
translated: then,

original: rjes su dpag pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pas bsal pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pas bsal pa yin no //
translated: If it is an inference, then it is refuted by inference.

original: des na bdag tu smra brten med pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na bdag tu smra brten med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the doctrine of self is groundless,

original: de sgrub pa la phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub pa la phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no position to establish it.üîΩIf that is so, then there would be a fault in the inference of fire, etc.

original: gal te de lta na me la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhen mi 'gyur ro zhes zer /
analyzed: gal te de lta na me la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhen mi 'gyur ro zhes zer /
translated: No, it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdor stsogs kyi sgra smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdor stsogs kyi sgra smos so //
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äúin brief‚Äù are stated.

original: 'grel ba'i 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel ba'i 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The inference of curd, etc. from milk, etc. is an illustration.

original: gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir yang dam bca' ba 'di sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir yang dam bca' ba 'di sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, this thesis cannot be established because there is no reason.

original: des na 'di las kyang bdag tu smra brten med do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'di las kyang bdag tu smra brten med do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that this also is groundless.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is supplied.

original: gang gi phyir 'di mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ma grub ste /
translated: Since it is not perception, therefore it is not established.

original: des na 'bras bu la rjes su dpag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu la rjes su dpag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be inferred from its effect.

original: de ni pha rol po dag srog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid las rjes su dpag par 'dod pas de bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni pha rol po dag srog la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid las rjes su dpag par 'dod pas de bkag pa yin no //
translated: This is because the opponent wishes to infer the existence of the effect, life force, etc., and this is being refuted.

original: gang gi phyir de las rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba de yod na sngon ma byung ba'i srog la sogs pa'am gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba de yod na sngon ma byung ba'i srog la sogs pa'am gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: If it were to be inferred from that, then when it exists, it would not be understood that a previously nonexistent life force, etc., or something else exists.

original: gal te gang yod par dmigs na sngon ma rtogs pa gang zhig yod par dmigs pa de de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bdag gi 'bras bu ma grub na 'o na ji ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las shes pa skye
analyzed: gal te gang yod par dmigs na sngon ma rtogs pa gang zhig yod par dmigs pa de de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bdag gi 'bras bu ma grub na 'o na ji ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las shes pa skye
translated: If it is observed that something exists, then that which exists and is not previously understood is its effect. Therefore, if the effect of the self is not established, how can it be said that consciousness arises from the eye, form, light, and attention?

original: bar brjod / mig mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar brjod / mig mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye is not directly perceived.

original: gzugs dang snang ba dag ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin yang de dmigs pas shes pa dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dag ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin yang de dmigs pas shes pa dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Although form and light are apprehended by the direct perception of the sense faculty, the consciousness that observes them is not observed.

original: de dag ni de shes pa nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis de skyes pa'i sngar de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de shes pa nyid kyis dmigs par bya ba nyid kyis de skyes pa'i sngar de ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are objects of that cognition, they are not established prior to the arising of that cognition.

original: de yod pa las mngon sum nyid yin yang de las shes pa de skyes so zhes bya ba go ga las yid la byed pa yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin yang de las shes pa skyes so zhes bya bar ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: de yod pa las mngon sum nyid yin yang de las shes pa de skyes so zhes bya ba go ga las yid la byed pa yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin yang de las shes pa skyes so zhes bya bar ni ma grub bo //
translated: Even though they are direct perception in the sense of existing, it is not established that cognition arises from them, nor is it established that mental activity arises from them, even though it is established by reflexive awareness.

original: des na 'di dag mngon sum nyid yin yang de 'bras bu grub pa'i yan lag ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes de ltar dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na 'di dag mngon sum nyid yin yang de 'bras bu grub pa'i yan lag ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes de ltar dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Therefore, even though these are direct perception, they are not at all a part of the establishment of the effect.

original: dbang po la sogs pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThe sense faculties and so on . . .‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs dang snang ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes form, light, and so on.

original: rnam par @102b shes pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par @102b shes pa nyid 'bras bu yin pas na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Since consciousness itself is the effect, it is the effect, consciousness.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa grub pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i grub pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa grub pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of that which is dependent is dependent establishment.

original: des na 'di ltar 'brel te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'brel te /
translated: Thus, the connection is as follows.

original: dbang po la sogs pa ltos pa dang bcas par grub pas zhes bya bar te dbang po la ltos nas grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa ltos pa dang bcas par grub pas zhes bya bar te dbang po la ltos nas grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: Since the sense faculties, etc. are established as dependent, i.e., they are established in dependence on the sense faculties, etc.

original: dbang po la sogs pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The sense faculties, etc. are not established as dependent.

original: 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa de yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //üîΩdes na 'di chos can la ltos pa na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa de yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o // des na 'di chos can la ltos pa na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: However, the meaning is that they are connected with that.üîΩThus, when the effect is dependent on the subject, it is connected with the effect consciousness.

original: de'i don 'di yin te gal te 'bras bu rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas rab tu grub pa brjod na /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te gal te 'bras bu rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas rab tu grub pa brjod na /
translated: This is the meaning: If the effect consciousness is established as dependent, i.e., it is well established as dependent,

original: rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par shes pa de la ltos pas grub po //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rnam par shes pa de la ltos pas grub po //
translated: then consciousness is the effect of the sense faculties, etc. It is established in dependence on that consciousness.

original: ji ltar na ji srid de yod na yod par ma rtogs par rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa la ltos par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ji srid de yod na yod par ma rtogs par rnam par shes pa dbang po la sogs pa la ltos par rtogs she na /
translated: How is it that consciousness is understood to depend on the sense faculties, etc. without understanding that it exists as long as they exist?

original: res 'ga' yin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: res 'ga' yin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: because it is sometimes the case.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rnam par shes pa ni res 'ga' ba'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni res 'ga' ba'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: consciousness has a nature that is sometimes the case.

original: res 'ga' ba ma yin na ni gtan du yod pa'i phyir gzugs med kyang 'gyur bas na gzugs rgyu yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba ma yin na ni gtan du yod pa'i phyir gzugs med kyang 'gyur bas na gzugs rgyu yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not sometimes the case, it would exist permanently and therefore, even in the absence of form, it would not be the cause of form.

original: gzugs med na med pa'i phyir na gzugs dang rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong yang gzugs la ltos pa ni gzugs kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med na med pa'i phyir na gzugs dang rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong yang gzugs la ltos pa ni gzugs kyi 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: Even though one does not see form as a universal concomitant of consciousness, because it does not exist in the formless realm, it is the effect of form because it does not exist in the absence of form.

original: de bzhin du yid la byed pa la yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid la byed pa la yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for mental activity.

original: don gzhan la chags pas mi mthun par byas nas rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan la chags pas mi mthun par byas nas rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness does not arise when mental activity is obstructed by attachment to another object.

original: mig med na med pa ni ma grub ste de mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig med na med pa ni ma grub ste de mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fact that consciousness does not exist in the absence of the eye is not established, because the eye is not directly perceived.

original: gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams yod na yod pa ma grub kyang med na med pa grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams yod na yod pa ma grub kyang med na med pa grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though the fact that it exists in the presence of form, light, and mental activity is not established, the fact that it does not exist in their absence is certainly established.

original: dbang po la ni gnyi ga yang ma grub po //
analyzed: dbang po la ni gnyi ga yang ma grub po //
translated: But in the case of the sense faculty, neither is established.

original: 'on kyang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa yod kyang rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid kyis gzhan la ltos pa dang ldan par rtogs la de yang dbang po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa yod kyang rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nyid kyis gzhan la ltos pa dang ldan par rtogs la de yang dbang po zhes brjod do //
translated: Even though form, light, and attention are present, consciousness is intermittent, and so it is understood to be dependent on something else, and that is called the sense faculty.

original: de bstan pa ni 'di las rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde ltar rab tu grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni lung las rtogs pa yin gyi der yang rjes su @103a * //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni 'di las rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba yin no // de ltar rab tu grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni lung las rtogs pa yin gyi der yang rjes su @103a * //
translated: What is the point of teaching that?

original: dpag pa nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpag pa nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The specific nature of the sense faculty is understood from scripture, and inference is not capable of understanding it.

original: mig 'bras phye na rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir de yod na yod pa yang rtogs pa po rang nyid kyi mngon sum ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mig 'bras phye na rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir de yod na yod pa yang rtogs pa po rang nyid kyi mngon sum ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the sense faculty is present, consciousness arises when the eyes are open, so how is it not directly perceived by the perceiver himself?

original: gal te nang gi rig pa tsam gyis rang bzhin cha shas gzhan las dbang po'i 'bras bu khyad par can du rtogs na mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nang gi rig pa tsam gyis rang bzhin cha shas gzhan las dbang po'i 'bras bu khyad par can du rtogs na mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: If the specific nature of the sense faculty were understood from mere internal cognition as a special effect of the sense faculty from another part, it would be direct perception.

original: me dang du ba bzhin du dngos po gzhan las log pa'i dngos po yod na yod par khyad par nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: me dang du ba bzhin du dngos po gzhan las log pa'i dngos po yod na yod par khyad par nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If an entity that is different from another entity exists, it is understood as existing, like fire and smoke, because of the difference.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu ni reg bya gzhan las khyad par du rtogs pa ma yin par yul tha dad pas tha dad par sgrub pa'am reg bya gcig gi bdag nyid lus kyi phyogs gcig nyid kyis rgyu nyid du rtogs so zhe na ma yin te de yang
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu ni reg bya gzhan las khyad par du rtogs pa ma yin par yul tha dad pas tha dad par sgrub pa'am reg bya gcig gi bdag nyid lus kyi phyogs gcig nyid kyis rgyu nyid du rtogs so zhe na ma yin te de yang
translated: In the same way, a result is not understood as different from another tangible object, but is established as different by a different object, or it is understood as a cause by the very same tangible object itself in one part of the body.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan las rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba rgyu dang mi 'dra ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan las rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba rgyu dang mi 'dra ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because a cause is not understood as not being different from another reason, and a cause is not understood as not being different from another reason.

original: des na mngon sum gyis rgyu dang rgyu ma yin par mi rtogs te /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis rgyu dang rgyu ma yin par mi rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, a cause and a non-cause are not understood by direct perception.

original: de ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is always understood by the existence and non-existence of consciousness.

original: de lta na 'o na sngags la sogs pas nus pa'i gegs byas pa'i 'bar ba'i rang bzhin nus pa gegs ma byas pa las mi mthun par mi rtogs pa'i phyir de yang mngon sum gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde ni med de 'bras bu sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sngags la sogs pas nus pa'i gegs byas pa'i 'bar ba'i rang bzhin nus pa gegs ma byas pa las mi mthun par mi rtogs pa'i phyir de yang mngon sum gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na / de ni med de 'bras bu sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa /
translated: If that were so, then since one does not understand that the nature of fire is obstructed from being hot by the obstruction of the power of mantras and so on, one would not understand the nature of cause and effect by direct perception.üîΩThat is not so, because the power of the effect is the branch that establishes it.

original: gzhan du gyur pa nyid gnas bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa nyid gnas bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of the effect is the basis of the transformation.

original: me'i sreg par nus pa ni dro ba'i nus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: me'i sreg par nus pa ni dro ba'i nus pa nyid yin la /
translated: The power of burning fire is the power of heat.

original: de med na ni mngon sum nyid kyis mi 'dra bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na ni mngon sum nyid kyis mi 'dra bar grub pa yin no //
translated: If that does not exist, it is established as different by direct perception itself.

original: dro ba'i nus pa yod kyang sreg par byed pa ma yin na ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dro ba'i nus pa yod kyang sreg par byed pa ma yin na ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: If heat exists but does not burn, it would be a noncause.

original: gal te 'bras bu las dbang po don gzhan yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las dbang po don gzhan yin na /
translated: If the sense faculty is different from the effect,

original: de la mi ltos pa kho nar rnam par shes pa skyed par thal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la mi ltos pa kho nar rnam par shes pa skyed par thal ba ma yin nam /
translated: wouldn‚Äôt it follow that consciousness would arise without depending on it?

original: gnyis ka yang rgyu yin na yang ltos pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang rgyu yin na yang ltos pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Although both are causes, the difference in their dependence must be shown.

original: tha dad pa med na yang 'bras bu shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid dbang po yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med na yang 'bras bu shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid dbang po yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if there is no difference, the sense faculty is the producer of the effect, the arising of consciousness.

original: brjod pa lam 'di srid du ni rjes su dpag pa 'gro bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa lam 'di srid du ni rjes su dpag pa 'gro bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: We reply: Inference cannot proceed this far along the path.

original: de 'bras bu ldog pa las 'bras bu gcig gam rang nyid rdul phra rab kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang lhan cig tu gyur @103b pas du ma yang rung ste ltos par bya ba lhag par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'bras bu ldog pa las 'bras bu gcig gam rang nyid rdul phra rab kyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir dbang po dang lhan cig tu gyur @103b pas du ma yang rung ste ltos par bya ba lhag par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The effect is either one or a collection of subtle particles, and it is the effect that is dependent, since it is the effect of the sense faculty.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ni gcig dang du ma las mi ldog go //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa ni gcig dang du ma las mi ldog go //
translated: Difference and non-difference are not excluded from one and many.

original: ci zhig cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ci zhig cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: What, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra'i don nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la yang 'gyur mod kyi dbang po'i yul can nyid do ;
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra'i don nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la yang 'gyur mod kyi dbang po'i yul can nyid do ;
translated: Although the meaning of the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes form, etc., they are the objects of the sense faculties.

original: / de nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba grub pas rab tu grub par zhes bya ba yang dbang po'i yul can kho na'o //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba grub pas rab tu grub par zhes bya ba yang dbang po'i yul can kho na'o //
translated: The result of that is the establishment of consciousness, which is sometimes established, and is also the object of the sense faculties.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can tsam kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can tsam kho nar brjod do //
translated: Form and so on are said to be the mere results of consciousness.

original: shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i 'bras bur grub pa na mngon sum du gyur pa nyid yin gyis sgrub byed gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzugs la sogs pa'i 'bras bur grub pa na mngon sum du gyur pa nyid yin gyis sgrub byed gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When consciousness is established as the result of form and so on, it is manifest itself, and does not depend on another proof.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa las dbang po rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni de tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin pa'i phyir de yod pa las dbang po rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Since that consciousness is not the cause of that, the sense faculty is inferred from its existence.

original: des na de ltar 'di la mngon sum sgrub par byed pa ma yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang rjes su dpag pa yod pa kho na'i /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'di la mngon sum sgrub par byed pa ma yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang rjes su dpag pa yod pa kho na'i /
translated: Thus, although it is not a proof of direct perception in this way, there is a causal relationship and inference.

original: bdag la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: But it is not for the self.

original: ci ste bdag mngon sum ma yin pa la yang rigs pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bdag mngon sum ma yin pa la yang rigs pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If this reasoning applies even to what is not directly perceived,

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can rab tu bsgrub pas ni zhes smos so ;
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni / bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can rab tu bsgrub pas ni zhes smos so ;
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúNo.‚ÄùüîΩThe result of pleasure, etc. is established by the proof.

original: / bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa de rab tu bsgrub pas ni de ltar de dbang po bzhin du'o //
analyzed: / bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa de rab tu bsgrub pas ni de ltar de dbang po bzhin du'o //
translated: That which has the result of pleasure, etc. is established by the proof, just like the sense faculties.

original: 'di ltar shes pa res 'ga' bas dbang po bsgrub pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs res 'ga' ba nyid kyis 'bras bu dang ldan pa bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po bsgrub pas ni don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa res 'ga' bas dbang po bsgrub pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs res 'ga' ba nyid kyis 'bras bu dang ldan pa bdag gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po bsgrub pas ni don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed do //
translated: Since consciousness is sometimes not present, the sense faculties are established by the proof. In the same way, since pleasure, etc. are sometimes not present, the result is not established by the proof. The thing that has the characteristic of self does not increase in the least.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dbang po bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par sgrub par nus pa tsam gyis khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po tsam ni pha rol po bdag gi dngos po khas ma blangs kyi /
analyzed: dbang po bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par sgrub par nus pa tsam gyis khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po tsam ni pha rol po bdag gi dngos po khas ma blangs kyi /
translated: Just as the sense faculties are distinguished by the mere capacity to establish the result, the thing that is distinguished by that mere capacity is not accepted by the opponent as the thing that is self.

original: 'on kyang longs spyod pa po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang longs spyod pa po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa nyid do //
translated: However, it is distinguished by the special qualities of the experiencer, etc.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni de ltar grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni de ltar grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not established in that way.

original: tshad ma gzhan las de'i rang bzhin rab tu sgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan las de'i rang bzhin rab tu sgrub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that its nature is established by another means of valid knowledge,

original: gang yang rung ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhes smos so //
translated: then it is said that it is ‚Äúany one of them.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di dang lhan cig gzhi gcig par mi 'grub ste /üîΩbde ba la @104a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di dang lhan cig gzhi gcig par mi 'grub ste / bde ba la @104a * //
translated: But that is not established as a single basis together with this,

original: sogs pa'i rgyu byed pa po la sogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyu byed pa po la sogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established as the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu de gzhan du grub par bya nus so zhes bshad pa ni gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu de gzhan du grub par bya nus so zhes bshad pa ni gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that the cause of pleasure, etc. can be established as something else, which is ‚Äúany one of them.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang bdag mi dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub byed du sngar brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bdag mi dmigs pa med pa'i sgrub byed du sngar brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid lus pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then the previously stated argument that the self is not perceived would still stand.

original: khas blangs nas kyang rjes su dpag pa sgrub par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang rjes su dpag pa sgrub par mi nus so zhes bstan pa ni de lta yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Even if you accept that, you cannot establish the inference, as is explained in the line ‚ÄúIf that were the case . . .‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa yang tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Nonperception is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa des bdag de sel ba na mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes rnam pa 'di ci ste bsal te bsal bar mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa des bdag de sel ba na mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa yin no zhes rnam pa 'di ci ste bsal te bsal bar mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when that non-apprehension eliminates that self, it is the establishment of non-apprehension. Why is this aspect to be eliminated? It should not be eliminated at all.

original: mi dmigs pa sgrub pa ma yin na 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa sgrub pa ma yin na 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If non-apprehension is not an establishment, then this would be the case.

original: gal te de sgrub pa ma yin na ni ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de sgrub pa ma yin na ni ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: If it is not an establishment, then how does the negation establish? This is an illustration of emergence.

original: lus zhes brjod pa 'byung ba chen po'i tshogs pa la shes pa yod par te /
analyzed: lus zhes brjod pa 'byung ba chen po'i tshogs pa la shes pa yod par te /
translated: The body is the collection of the great elements. The consciousness of that is the self.

original: sems pa nyid du lus kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par shes par ma dmigs kyang 'dod bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sems pa nyid du lus kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par shes par ma dmigs kyang 'dod bzhin du'o //
translated: Even though the nature of the body is not apprehended as consciousness, it is so desired.

original: lus kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rig par dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: lus kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rig par dmigs pa med de /
translated: The nature of the body is not apprehended as awareness.

original: gzhan gyi lus rig kyang gzhan gyi lus bzhin du gzhan gyi rig pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus rig kyang gzhan gyi lus bzhin du gzhan gyi rig pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the body of another is aware, like the body of another, it does not clarify the awareness of another.

original: 'di ltar dkar sham la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyi lus dmigs pa de'i tshe gzhan gyi mal dang stan dang gos la sogs pa'i 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa'i phyir de'i dmigs pa'i de'i lus dang tha mi dad pa
analyzed: 'di ltar dkar sham la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyi lus dmigs pa de'i tshe gzhan gyi mal dang stan dang gos la sogs pa'i 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa'i phyir de'i dmigs pa'i de'i lus dang tha mi dad pa
translated: Thus, when the body of another is perceived in the aspect of white, etc., the special tactile sensations of softness, roughness, etc., of the bed, seat, clothing, etc., of the other are perceived.

original: yin na ni dmigs pa de gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin na ni dmigs pa de gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body of the other is not different from the object of perception, then the object of perception would be clear.

original: gsal bzhin ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba mi gsal na rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul gyi rnam pa can gsal bar byed pa rig pa nyid yul rig pa yin pa'i phyir reg pa dmigs pa rig na
analyzed: gsal bzhin ba ni gsal ba las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba mi gsal na rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir yul gyi rnam pa can gsal bar byed pa rig pa nyid yul rig pa yin pa'i phyir reg pa dmigs pa rig na
translated: And that which is clear is not different from the clear. If the object of perception is not clear, then the cognition of it is not clear. Therefore, the cognition that is clear and has the aspect of the object is itself the perception of the object.

original: mig gis reg pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gis reg pa dmigs par 'gyur ro //
