translated: Thus, the eye-contact would be the perception of the object.

original: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan dang gzhan gyi don dang 'brel pas 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po gzhan dang gzhan gyi don dang 'brel pas 'tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the other sense faculties would be the perceiver in relation to their respective objects.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the element consciousness is not perceived.

original: de ma dmigs kyang de ltar 'dod pa na mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma @104b yin par byas bzhin du ma mthong bas thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa 'gog pa ni tshig la sogs pa gtan tshigs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par smra'o //
analyzed: de ma dmigs kyang de ltar 'dod pa na mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma @104b yin par byas bzhin du ma mthong bas thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa 'gog pa ni tshig la sogs pa gtan tshigs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par smra'o //
translated: But if one maintains that even though it is not perceived, it exists, then, since non-apprehension is not a valid cognition, one is saying that the refutation of omniscience, etc. is a verbal refutation, etc.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi dmigs kyang 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba dang / smra'o zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi dmigs kyang 'dod bzhin du zhes bya ba dang / smra'o zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother says‚Äù and so on is to be applied to the phrase ‚Äúeven though it is not apprehended, one maintains that it exists.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'o ma la zho ma dmigs kyang yod pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs 'dus pa nyid gzhan gyi don ma yin pa las ldog / de nyid kyi phyir nges pa ci yod ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'o ma la zho ma dmigs kyang yod pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gtan tshigs 'dus pa nyid gzhan gyi don ma yin pa las ldog / de nyid kyi phyir nges pa ci yod ces gsungs so //
translated: When curd is not apprehended in milk, but it exists, then, since non-apprehension is not a valid cognition, how can the presence of the reason be excluded from the unapprehended object? That is why it is said, ‚ÄúWhat certainty is there?‚Äù

original: 'di la ni mi dmigs pa nyid nges pa yin na de yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni mi dmigs pa nyid nges pa yin na de yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
translated: Here, non-apprehension itself is the certainty, but since that is not a valid cognition, there is no certainty.

original: da ni zho la sogs pa la 'o ma la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa dang rnam pa gzhan gyis rjes su dpog pa yang bzlog pa'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni zho la sogs pa la 'o ma la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa dang rnam pa gzhan gyis rjes su dpog pa yang bzlog pa'i phyir 'o ma la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: Now, in order to refute the inference of curd, etc. from milk, etc. and the inference in another way, he says: ‚Äúfrom milk, etc.‚Äù

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: The inference of curd, etc. from milk, etc. is as follows:

original: des na ma dmigs kyang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma dmigs kyang med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though it is not perceived, it is not nonexistent.

original: rjes su dpag pa de gang zhe na mi nus pa las zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de gang zhe na mi nus pa las zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: What is that inference? He shows it by ‚Äúfrom the non-efficacious.‚Äù

original: nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid la mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu'i bdag nyid la mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúefficacious‚Äù is the effect, which is the cause in an unclear form.

original: des na mi nus pa las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid nus pa'i ngo bor rang gi bdag nyid la mi gnas pa las zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi nus pa las zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid nus pa'i ngo bor rang gi bdag nyid la mi gnas pa las zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúfrom the non-efficacious‚Äù means from the effect, which is the nature of the cause, not abiding in its own nature.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid la mngon par gsal ba'i gsal bar gyur pa ni skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid la mngon par gsal ba'i gsal bar gyur pa ni skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The manifestation of the cause in a clear form is called ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

original: des na gang la gang zhig mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin med pas de mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin skye ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang la gang zhig mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin med pas de mngon par gsal ba'i rang bzhin skye ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since that which is not the nature of non-clarity does not exist, how could the nature of clarity arise?

original: de ltar gyur na ni gseg ma las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni gseg ma las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then it would arise from a pile of stones.

original: de ltar 'di mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin na rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang 'gog pa ni yang nus pa 'di zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di mi dmigs pa tshad ma yin na rjes su dpag pa mi srid pa nyid kyis sun phyung ba yin yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang 'gog pa ni yang nus pa 'di zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If non-apprehension is a valid means of cognition, then since inference is impossible, it is refuted. However, it is also refuted from another perspective in the line, ‚ÄúThis so-called potentiality.üîΩ‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gang gis 'bras bu rgyu la gnas par 'gyur ba nus pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis 'bras bu rgyu la gnas par 'gyur ba nus pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this so-called potentiality by which the effect exists in the cause?

original: ci 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa de yin nam zho nyid 'o ma'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa de yin nam zho nyid 'o ma'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Is it the existence characterized by the effect? Or is the nature of milk that exists as the essence of potentiality that exists in the nature of yogurt?

original: 'on te rang bzhin gzhan nyid la'o ma'i bdag nyid la 'gal ba med par zho skyed par byed pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin gzhan nyid la'o ma'i bdag nyid la 'gal ba med par zho skyed par byed pa nyid yin /
translated: Or is it another nature that is not milk that is not contradictory to the nature of milk and generates yogurt?

original: @105a * // rnam pa dang po ni re zhig mi rung ngo zhes de nyid dogs par byas nas bzlog pa ni de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @105a * // rnam pa dang po ni re zhig mi rung ngo zhes de nyid dogs par byas nas bzlog pa ni de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first possibility is not tenable, so Candrakƒ´rti raises this doubt and then refutes it: ‚ÄúIt would be just like that.‚Äù

original: zho nyid 'o ma'i bdag nyid la yod na ni /'o ma la yang de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur te de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zho nyid 'o ma'i bdag nyid la yod na ni /'o ma la yang de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur te de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If yogurt existed in the nature of milk, then it would be perceived in milk just like that, because there would be no difference in its nature.

original: mngon par mi gsal ba'i phyir ma dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba'i phyir ma dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not perceived because it is not manifest,

original: mngon par mi gsal ba 'di ci zhig ma rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba 'di ci zhig ma rtogs pa'am /
translated: is this nonmanifestation due to noncomprehension?

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan yin pas zho'i bdag nyid las ngo bo gzhan du grub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan yin pas zho'i bdag nyid las ngo bo gzhan du grub pa'o //
translated: Or is it due to having a different nature from that which has such a form?

original: gal te ma rtogs pa yin na 'o ma'i bdag nyid ma rtogs par mi rung ste rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ma rtogs pa yin na 'o ma'i bdag nyid ma rtogs par mi rung ste rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is due to noncomprehension, then it is not tenable that it is not comprehended in the nature of milk, because it is comprehended.

original: mngon par ma grub pa yin na yang mi gsal ba de'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan yin pas zho'i bdag nyid las ngo bo gzhan du 'grub bo //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa yin na yang mi gsal ba de'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan yin pas zho'i bdag nyid las ngo bo gzhan du 'grub bo //
translated: If it is not established as manifest, then it is established as having a nature that is different from the nature of the unmanifest.

original: de ste 'o ma dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi 'o ma'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ste 'o ma dang rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi 'o ma'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the same nature as milk, then it is perceived as having the nature of milk.

original: 'o na 'o ma'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan ma yin par grub po zhes bshad pa ni ci ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'o ma'i bdag nyid las rang bzhin gzhan ma yin par grub po zhes bshad pa ni ci ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not established as having a nature that is different from the nature of milk, then why is it said that it is different?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: zho yod par 'dod pas 'o ma tsam gyi rang bzhin la gus par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zho yod par 'dod pas 'o ma tsam gyi rang bzhin la gus par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One who accepts the existence of curd does not respect the nature of mere milk.

original: dmigs par khas len pas ni zho'i bdag nyid nyams pa'i phyir 'chol ba ma grub po //
analyzed: dmigs par khas len pas ni zho'i bdag nyid nyams pa'i phyir 'chol ba ma grub po //
translated: Since the acceptance of perception is destroyed by the nature of curd, the argument is not established.

original: des na 'di skad smra ba'i 'di nye bar btags pa tsam du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni nye bar btags pa tsam du ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di skad smra ba'i 'di nye bar btags pa tsam du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni nye bar btags pa tsam du ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that this is merely a designation.

original: de ltar 'di ni ma mthong bas ldog pa grub par smra ba 'di dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni ma mthong bas ldog pa grub par smra ba 'di dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
translated: Thus, those who say that the negation is established by non-apprehension are mutually contradictory.

original: phan tshun gnod pa zhes khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gnod pa zhes khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: They have accepted that they mutually contradict each other.

original: des na de ltar med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi nges par bya ste /
analyzed: des na de ltar med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi nges par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should ascertain the reason that the negation is not established by non-apprehension, and that the negation is not established by non-apprehension of the reason.

original: de khas mi len na smra ba nyid 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang dang gzhan gyi khas blangs pa ma mthong baüîΩtsam gyis ldog pa grub pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de khas mi len na smra ba nyid 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang dang gzhan gyi khas blangs pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa grub pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: If one does not accept that, then, having said that the mere non-apprehension of the reason in the discordant side does not prove the negation, one should explain that the negation is established by the mere non-apprehension of the reason in the discordant side.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar ldog pa grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul pa ma yin na 'o na ji ltar ldog pa grub ce na /
translated: If the mere non-apprehension of the reason in the discordant side does not prove the negation, then how is the negation established?

original: bshad pa de'i phyir rang gi @105b ngo bos ngo bo nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa de'i phyir rang gi @105b ngo bos ngo bo nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that explanation, the negation of intrinsic reality is established.

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúown nature‚Äù?

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin de'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du ston pa ni de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin de'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du ston pa ni de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mere connection with that is called ‚Äúthe nature of that as it is taught.‚Äù

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid rtsol ba las byung ba tsam dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid rtsol ba las byung ba tsam dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence is not merely connected with what is produced by effort,

original: rtsol ba las byung ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even in what is not produced by effort.

original: des na de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na bden te /
analyzed: des na de tsam dang 'brel pa zhes ji ltar brjod ce na bden te /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it is merely connected with that?

original: 'on kyang 'dir 'brel pa'i don rnam pa de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir 'brel pa'i don rnam pa de ltar ni mi 'dod do //
translated: That is true, but here the meaning of ‚Äúconnection‚Äù is not asserted in that way.

original: de tsam yod na rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par grub pa'i phyir de tsam nyid na yod pa nyid ni de tsam dang 'brel par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam yod na rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par grub pa'i phyir de tsam nyid na yod pa nyid ni de tsam dang 'brel par brjod pa yin no //
translated: When there is mere existence, it is established without depending on another reason. Therefore, mere existence is called ‚Äúmerely connected with that.‚Äù

original: des na sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de yin pa'i phyir de dag yod na yod pa las mi 'da' ba /
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid de yin pa'i phyir de dag yod na yod pa las mi 'da' ba /
translated: Therefore, because that is the nature of the proof, when they exist, they are not beyond existence.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam ni yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam ni yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid sgrub par byed pa zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The mere existence of the property of the probandum is the existence of the property itself, which is the probandum.

original: ji ltar zlog par byed ce na gal te ma brjod pa de lta na yang de tsam la yod pa'i shugs kyis log pas ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zlog par byed ce na gal te ma brjod pa de lta na yang de tsam la yod pa'i shugs kyis log pas ldog pa nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: How is it negated? Even if it is not stated, it is ascertained as being negated by the mere implication of existence.

original: de yod pas zlog par byed pa'am med pas yin /
analyzed: de yod pas zlog par byed pa'am med pas yin /
translated: Is it negated by its existence or by its non-existence?

original: de yod pas zlog par byed pa yin na ni de tsam dang 'brel pa 'gal lo //
analyzed: de yod pas zlog par byed pa yin na ni de tsam dang 'brel pa 'gal lo //
translated: If it is negated by its existence, then it contradicts its connection with mere existence.

original: des na med pa nyid kyis zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na med pa nyid kyis zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is negated by its non-existence.

original: des na de yod pa tsam la yod pa gang yin pa de log pa na yod pa ldog par byed de /
analyzed: des na de yod pa tsam la yod pa gang yin pa de log pa na yod pa ldog par byed de /
translated: Thus, when the mere existence of that which exists is negated, existence is negated.

original: de de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas na de med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas na de med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is its own nature, it cannot be established as non-existent.

original: 'di la rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la rtog pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of conceptions in this regard:

original: rang gi ngo bo med na ngo bo med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel pa tsam las ldog par 'grub pa'am yang na de lta bu'i rang gi ngo bo ngo bo'i khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba med pa'o
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med na ngo bo med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel pa tsam las ldog par 'grub pa'am yang na de lta bu'i rang gi ngo bo ngo bo'i khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba med pa'o
translated: If it did not have its own nature, it would not have a nature.üîΩThe word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the commentary indicates that the pervasion is established either by the mere reversal of the relation or by the fact that such a nature is a pervader.

original: // 'am smos pa ni ldog pa tsam gyi phyogs la ltos nas sam nges pa'i yul can nyid kyis so //
analyzed: // 'am smos pa ni ldog pa tsam gyi phyogs la ltos nas sam nges pa'i yul can nyid kyis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù in the root text indicates that the pervasion is established either by the mere reversal of the relation or by the fact that such a nature is a pervader.

original: ldog pa'i rnam pa 'di gtan tshigs gang gi yin zhe na dper na shing gis shing sha pa lta bu ste zhes smos so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rnam pa 'di gtan tshigs gang gi yin zhe na dper na shing gis shing sha pa lta bu ste zhes smos so //
translated: What is the form of the reversal that is the reason? The root text says, ‚ÄúFor example, a tree is a sha-pa tree.‚Äù

original: shing sha pa nyid kyis shing nyid sgrub pa na bsgrub par bya ba shing log pa na shing sha pa ldog par byed pa bzhin no //üîΩ'dir yang ji ltar zlog par byed pa yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel @106a * //
analyzed: shing sha pa nyid kyis shing nyid sgrub pa na bsgrub par bya ba shing log pa na shing sha pa ldog par byed pa bzhin no // 'dir yang ji ltar zlog par byed pa yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel @106a * //
translated: When a sha-pa tree establishes that it is a tree, when the probandum, tree, is reversed, the sha-pa tree is also reversed.

original: pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: pa nyid ston te /
translated: In the same way, in order to show how the reversal is done, the commentary shows that the pervasion is established by the mere reversal of the relation.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du shing zhes grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du shing zhes grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term ‚Äútree‚Äù is known to refer to a particular thing that possesses branches and so on.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na shing de na sha pa de'i rang gi ngo bo yin te sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na shing de na sha pa de'i rang gi ngo bo yin te sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: For that reason, the tree is the essence of the shoot, as previously explained.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar ngo bo yod par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir de med na med pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar ngo bo yod par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir de med na med pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: And how could it exist if it had abandoned its own essence? Because the essence is related to it, it is the invariable mark of the absence of the tree.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa bstan nas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa bstan nas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Having thus explained the contrapositive of a reason based on essence, he explains the contrapositive of a reason based on effect.

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu bzlog par 'gyur zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu bzlog par 'gyur zhes sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The effect is reversed by the cause.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Here, too, there are two parts, as before.

original: 'di la ji ltar rgyu zlog par byed pa yin pa de ston pa ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar rgyu zlog par byed pa yin pa de ston pa ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show how the effect is reversed by the cause, he says, ‚Äúbecause there is no error.‚Äù

original: rgyu med na mi 'byung ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na mi 'byung ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the effect is merely the presence or absence of the presence of the cause.

original: rgyu yang ldog pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin no zhes rgyu nyid kyis nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yang ldog pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin no zhes rgyu nyid kyis nges pa yin te /
translated: And the cause is ascertained by its absence, since the effect is absent when the cause is absent.

original: yod pa nyid ni ldog par byed pa ma yin te rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ldog par byed pa ma yin te rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, existence is not the cause of the absence of the effect, because it is not the cause.üîΩWhen the cause is absent, etc.

original: rgyu log pa na zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i cha rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu log pa na zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i cha rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the previous part is to be supplied.

original: gzhan du na phyi ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na gzhan phyogs pa dag gis 'dod pa'i rnam pa bkag pa na rang bzhin 'brel pa yod pa na don gyis don 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid grub pa yin no zhes lhag dang bcas te ston pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos
analyzed: gzhan du na phyi ma yin no // de ltar na gzhan phyogs pa dag gis 'dod pa'i rnam pa bkag pa na rang bzhin 'brel pa yod pa na don gyis don 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid grub pa yin no zhes lhag dang bcas te ston pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos
translated: Otherwise, it would be the latter.üîΩThus, when the mode of existence asserted by the other party is refuted, the mere fact that there is no error in the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúWhen there is the relation of intrinsic reality, the meaning is not erroneous‚Äù is established.

original: po grub pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: po grub pa ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe establishment of the fact of causality‚Äù is a continuation of the above.

original: ni'i sgra ni sdud pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni sdud pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of inclusion.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa yang ngo bo nyid /üîΩnges par byed de med na mi 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa yang ngo bo nyid / nges par byed de med na mi 'byung bar byed do //
translated: The nature of the cause and effect is established, and the nature is ascertained, that is, it is made to be such that if one is absent, the other is absent.

original: des na de'i bdag nyid grub pa ni zhes bya bar yang rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid grub pa ni zhes bya bar yang rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that ‚Äúthe nature of that is established.‚Äù

original: de bas na zhes pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis na rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na ldog go //üîΩde ltar khas mi le na na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa zhes bya ba nyid mi 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩde lta min na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dis na rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na ldog go // de ltar khas mi le na na ni bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa zhes bya ba nyid mi 'grub bo zhes gsungs pa ni / de lta min na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù ‚Äú In this way‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù ‚Äú In this way‚Äù means ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù ‚Äú In this way‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa khas mi @106b len na bsgrub par bya ba gcig log pas ji ltar gzhan ni zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ldog par 'gyur /üîΩgal te 'gyur na ni de'i tshe bram ze'i khye'u la rta dang ldan pa log na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa khas mi @106b len na bsgrub par bya ba gcig log pas ji ltar gzhan ni zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa ldog par 'gyur /üîΩgal te 'gyur na ni de'i tshe bram ze'i khye'u la rta dang ldan pa log na /

original: phyugs dang ldan pa yang ldog par 'gyur te rta lag na gzhan nyid du khyad par med pas phyugs kyang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyugs dang ldan pa yang ldog par 'gyur te rta lag na gzhan nyid du khyad par med pas phyugs kyang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the possession of cattle would be reversed, because the horse would be reversed, since there is no difference in the otherness of the horse in the hand.

original: 'brel pa med pa log na ldog par 'dod pas de de ltar ci ste mi 'dod ces 'dri ba'i sgo nas de ston pa ni mi la rta mi bdog ces te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa log na ldog par 'dod pas de de ltar ci ste mi 'dod ces 'dri ba'i sgo nas de ston pa ni mi la rta mi bdog ces te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is accepted that when there is no connection, there is reversal, why is it not accepted that way?

original: de ltar ma 'brel pa la ldog pa med par bstan nas rjes su 'gro ba yang med par brjod pa ni de bzhin gcig cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma 'brel pa la ldog pa med par bstan nas rjes su 'gro ba yang med par brjod pa ni de bzhin gcig cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Having thus shown that there is no reversal in the absence of connection, he states that there is also no concomitance: ‚ÄúIn the same way, one . . .‚Äù

original: gcig nye bas gzhan nye ba ni nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig nye bas gzhan nye ba ni nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The proximity of one does not necessarily entail the proximity of another.

original: gzhan du na rta nye na yang ba lang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rta nye na yang ba lang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, when a horse is nearby, a cow would be nearby.

original: chos can gcig gam du mas 'ga' zhig ji ltar gyur pa de ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can gcig gam du mas 'ga' zhig ji ltar gyur pa de ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no certainty that when something is so for one subject, it is so for another.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù concludes the argument.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya go bar byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya go bar byed do //
translated: The reason is understood by the probandum through a natural relation alone.

original: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is based on the reason for the understanding.

original: go bar byed pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bdag nyid las yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bdag nyid las yin no //
translated: The cause of understanding is the nature of positive and negative concomitance.

original: de dag kyang gang zhig gang la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de la de yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhig gang la rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de la de yin par 'gyur te /
translated: That is, when one thing is the nature of something else, it is that.

original: des na rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood through a natural relation alone.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te de'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te de'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: That is of two kinds: the nature of that or the nature of what arises from that.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i dbang kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i dbang kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: If the reason is understood by the probandum only through the power of identity and origination,

original: da ni dpe la dgos pa ci yod de yang rang nyid kyis de dang de dag tu bstan pa la slob dpon gyis kyang tshad ma kun las btus pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni dpe la dgos pa ci yod de yang rang nyid kyis de dang de dag tu bstan pa la slob dpon gyis kyang tshad ma kun las btus pa la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Now, what is the need for an example? Moreover, the Acarya has taught that and that in the Pramanavarttika and so forth.

original: 'di ni rnam pa ji ltar yang nye bar sbyor ba ni med do ;
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa ji ltar yang nye bar sbyor ba ni med do ;
translated: This is not applied in any way.

original: / re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pas 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: / re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pas 'grub pa yin te /
translated: In the case of a natural reason, the understanding of the probandum is established by the analysis of the nature of the reason.

original: de ltar yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa dag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa dag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, it is applied to such things as being produced.

original: sha pa nyid la sogs pa yang sha pa nyid shing gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir @107a * //
analyzed: sha pa nyid la sogs pa yang sha pa nyid shing gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir @107a * //
translated: Even in the case of being a juniper, since being a juniper is a particular kind of tree,

original: shing nyid rtogs so //
analyzed: shing nyid rtogs so //
translated: a tree is understood.

original: thams cad du de lta bu nyid yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'brel pa de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gang las chod pa med par don rtogs par 'gyur ba yang 'phen pa yin no //üîΩldog pa'i bdag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad du de lta bu nyid yin pa'i rgyu mtshan 'brel pa de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa gang las chod pa med par don rtogs par 'gyur ba yang 'phen pa yin no // ldog pa'i bdag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not being separated from the object of knowledge.üîΩThe pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not being separated from the object of knowledge.üîΩThe pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not being separated from the object of knowledge.

original: gang gis rjes su 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i chos can mthong ba'i yul du nye bar sbyor ba chos mthun pa nyid can gyi dper 'gyur ba dang / ldog pa bsgrub pa mthong ba'i yul du sbyar ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dper 'gyur ba de gnyis chos can nges pa'i yul can nyid du 'jug pa grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis rjes su 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i chos can mthong ba'i yul du nye bar sbyor ba chos mthun pa nyid can gyi dper 'gyur ba dang / ldog pa bsgrub pa mthong ba'i yul du sbyar ba chos mi mthun pa nyid can gyi dper 'gyur ba de gnyis chos can nges pa'i yul can nyid du 'jug pa grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not being separated from the object of knowledge.üîΩThe pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not being separated from the object of knowledge.üîΩThe pervasion is the nature that is concomitant with the property to be established. The example is the presence of the reason in similar instances, which is the property of not

original: de gnyis bsgrub par ston pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos can de nyid bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i skabs su dran par byed pa gang yin pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni go bar byed pa'i yan lag tu gyur
analyzed: de gnyis bsgrub par ston pas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos can de nyid bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i skabs su dran par byed pa gang yin pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ni go bar byed pa'i yan lag tu gyur
translated: The reason why the property of the position is recalled at the time of understanding the probandum is that the two, the forward and reverse pervasions, are established by direct perception and nonobservation.üîΩThey are not branches that cause understanding.

original: pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'brel pas grub pa dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'brel pas grub pa dag nyid yin no //
translated: However, they are established by the relation.

original: de la ni chos can nges pa nye bar blangs pas cung zad kyang byar med do //
analyzed: de la ni chos can nges pa nye bar blangs pas cung zad kyang byar med do //
translated: In that case, there is nothing to do by the mere acceptance of the ascertainment of the subject.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pa tsam nyid kyis rnam pa 'di lta bu mtha' dag ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa grub pas ni dper na 'di bzhin no zhes par bkod pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pa tsam nyid kyis rnam pa 'di lta bu mtha' dag ni 'di lta bu yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa grub pas ni dper na 'di bzhin no zhes par bkod pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere analysis of the nature of the proof establishes the entire form of the proof, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù Therefore it is pointless to set it out in this way.

original: gang gi dper na 'di bzhin no zhes nye bar bkod pa don dang ldan par 'gyur ba ji ltar gcig las de yod pa de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi dper na 'di bzhin no zhes nye bar bkod pa don dang ldan par 'gyur ba ji ltar gcig las de yod pa de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The example of like that is not a proper example, because it is not certain that just as it exists in one, so it exists in the other.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang tshang bang la sogs par mthong ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa la nye bar mkho ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang tshang bang la sogs par mthong ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dzin pa la nye bar mkho ba yin gyi /
translated: In the case of an effect reason, seeing smoke and fire together is necessary for apprehending them as cause and effect.

original: der mthong ba'i phyir ri'i spo la de dmigs pa me sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der mthong ba'i phyir ri'i spo la de dmigs pa me sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But seeing that does not establish fire on a mountain peak.

original: tshang bang du du ba yod na me mthong ba zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni ri'i spo la yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te phyugs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir rta dang ldan par nges pa ni ma yin no zhes 'di ni bstan zin to
analyzed: tshang bang du du ba yod na me mthong ba zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni ri'i spo la yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te phyugs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir rta dang ldan par nges pa ni ma yin no zhes 'di ni bstan zin to
translated: It is not the case that just by saying, When there is smoke, fire is seen, it is so on a mountain peak. It has been explained that having cattle does not entail having horses.

original: // du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin la rgyu med par yang 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir du ba las ri la yang me rtogs pa yin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni @107b 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis thams cad du de ltar 'gyur ba 'di gzhan nyid yin gyis /
analyzed: // du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin la rgyu med par yang 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir du ba las ri la yang me rtogs pa yin no zhe na / 'o na ni @107b 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis thams cad du de ltar 'gyur ba 'di gzhan nyid yin gyis /
translated: Smoke is the effect of fire, and it is impossible for an effect to exist without a cause, so from smoke one understands that there is fire on the mountain.

original: tshang bang du de de ltar mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshang bang du de de ltar mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the effect itself that is the reason, then in all cases it will be like this, and it will not be the case that the reason is that one sees it thus in a kitchen.

original: der dmigs pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub la /
analyzed: der dmigs pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub la /
translated: But when one observes it there, the relation of cause and effect is established.

original: de las ni thams cad du de ltar 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir ji skad brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos can bstan pa nye bar mkho ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las ni thams cad du de ltar 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir ji skad brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos can bstan pa nye bar mkho ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And from that, one understands that it will be like this in all cases. Therefore, in this case, there is no need to state the subject in the manner described above.

original: des na phyogs 'di la dpe dgos pa ci yod ces rang gi 'dod pa las ltos te dpe 'gal bar dogs pa bsu nas med na mi 'byung ba de nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: des na phyogs 'di la dpe dgos pa ci yod ces rang gi 'dod pa las ltos te dpe 'gal bar dogs pa bsu nas med na mi 'byung ba de nyid ces smos so //
translated: So, in this case, what is the need for an example? Anticipating the objection that the example is contradictory in terms of what is asserted by the opponent, he says, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist, it does not arise.‚Äù

original: bstan zin pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid dpe dag gis rab tu ston to //
analyzed: bstan zin pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid dpe dag gis rab tu ston to //
translated: The invariable relation that has been taught, which has the nature of concomitance and opposition, is demonstrated by examples.

original: de yang 'brel pa ma bstan par bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa ma bstan par bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that cannot be taught without teaching the relation.

original: rgyu ma bstan pa yang 'bras bu bstan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa rgyu tsam gyis ni 'brel par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu ma bstan pa yang 'bras bu bstan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa rgyu tsam gyis ni 'brel par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad ma nyid kyis so //
translated: And that which is taught as the effect of a cause is not the invariable relation that is taught by the mere cause, but by the valid cognition of concomitance and opposition.

original: des na thams cad du 'di yod na yod pa yin la 'di log na 'di ldog go zhes bstan kyang de skad brjod pa tsam gyis ni de ltar mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: des na thams cad du 'di yod na yod pa yin la 'di log na 'di ldog go zhes bstan kyang de skad brjod pa tsam gyis ni de ltar mi 'grub kyi /
translated: Therefore, even though it is taught that ‚Äúwhen this exists, that exists, and when this ceases, that ceases,‚Äù that is not established by merely stating it in that way.

original: 'on kyang gang las de de ltar 'gyur ba de rtogs pa nyid kyis de rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang las de de ltar 'gyur ba de rtogs pa nyid kyis de rtogs pa yin no //
translated: But rather, it is understood by understanding that from which that comes to be in that way.

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ston pa ni chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dpe dag gi bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ston pa ni chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dpe dag gi bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the function of the similar and dissimilar examples is to show the positive and negative concomitance that is based on the reason, which is the nature of the probandum and the nature of the effect of the probandum.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa yang 'di nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa yang 'di nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The master DignƒÅga‚Äôs intention is also just this.

original: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel pa la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa brjod pa de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe 'di la nges par gzhi mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel pa la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa brjod pa de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe 'di la nges par gzhi mi 'dod de /
translated: Since the examples state the positive and negative concomitance based on the relation, therefore in this dissimilar example, the basis is not necessarily stated.

original: res 'ga' chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dngos por gyur pa ma yin yang bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dngos por gyur pa ma yin yang bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa slob dpon bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, even though the dissimilar example is not an entity, the master accepts that it proves the probandum.

original: de yang dpe'i dgos pa 'di ltar yin na 'thad par 'gyur gyi der de ltar grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa yin na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dpe'i dgos pa 'di ltar yin na 'thad par 'gyur gyi der de ltar grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa yin na ni ma yin no //
translated: If the purpose of the example is like that, it is correct, but if it proves the probandum by the reason that it is established in that way, it is not.

original: ji ltar zhe na de dag med na 'ang zhes smos so //üîΩbsgrub @108a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de dag med na 'ang zhes smos so // bsgrub @108a * //
translated: How so? He says, ‚ÄúEven though they do not exist.‚Äù

original: par bya ba med na sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa las kyang 'brel pa de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par bya ba med na sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa las kyang 'brel pa de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proof is established because the relation is understood from the statement, ‚ÄúIf the probandum does not exist, the proof does not occur.‚Äù

original: dpe ni 'bras bu bstan pa'i don du 'jug pa yin na de ni dpe med par brjod pas kyang 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dpe ni 'bras bu bstan pa'i don du 'jug pa yin na de ni dpe med par brjod pas kyang 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: The example is employed for the purpose of teaching the result. But that is established even without an example, by the statement itself.

original: des na med pa'i dpe la brten pa'i dag  dang dpe med pa'i ngag khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na med pa'i dpe la brten pa'i dag  dang dpe med pa'i ngag khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between a statement that has an example and one that does not have an example.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is understood from the statement.‚Äù

original: da ni gang gis chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi mi bzhed pa dper ji ltar 'brel pa nye bar ston pa de ston pas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni gang gis chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi mi bzhed pa dper ji ltar 'brel pa nye bar ston pa de ston pas 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to show how the example of dissimilarity is not accepted as a basis, he says, ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po skyed par byed pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: dpe ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po skyed par byed pa nyid ston te /
translated: The example shows the nature of that, i.e., the nature of the self and the causal entity that produces it.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag de mi shes pa la rab tu ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag de mi shes pa la rab tu ston pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that and what arises from that are taught to one who does not know that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba la gnas pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba la gnas pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Since the nature of the proof is the probandum itself, the property of the subject is the probandum.

original: de bzhin du rgyu'i dngos po yang de nyid kyi phyir 'grel par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'grel pa ni dpe la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu'i dngos po yang de nyid kyi phyir 'grel par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // 'grel pa ni dpe la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the causal entity is the property of the subject in the proof of that, because of that.üîΩThe commentary explains: ‚ÄúThe probandum is the property of the subject in the proof of that.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni de'i ngo bor de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor ston to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni de'i ngo bor de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bor ston to //
translated: The commentary says: ‚ÄúIn the example, the probandum is taught to be the nature of that, the nature of the probandum, by the nature of the proof.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na de'i rang gi ngo bo rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis de tsam dang 'brel pas te des so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de'i rang gi ngo bo rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis de tsam dang 'brel pas te des so //
translated: How is that? By the causal nature of that being related to just that, by that.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe la sgrub par byed pa yod na bsgrub bya'i chos yod par brjod pa yin la de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba yin te chos mthun pa'i dpe ni rjes su 'gro ba rab tu ston pa tsam gyiüîΩrang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe la sgrub par byed pa yod na bsgrub bya'i chos yod par brjod pa yin la de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba yin te chos mthun pa'i dpe ni rjes su 'gro ba rab tu ston pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is an affirmation by means of a concordant example, then the property to be established exists. That mere connection with that is pervasion, because a concordant example is merely the indication of pervasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba de yang de'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin pa des na rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba de yang de'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyis 'gyur ba yin pa des na rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That pervasion is the nature of that, because it is the nature of that. Therefore, by teaching pervasion, one understands its nature.

original: rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas de'i bdag nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas de'i bdag nyid brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the logic in this statement, ‚ÄúBy teaching pervasion, one expresses its nature?‚Äù

original: brjod pa cung zad byas pa de thams cad mi rtag go zhes chos mthun pa'i dper rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa na 'bras bu byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed do zhes
analyzed: brjod pa cung zad byas pa de thams cad mi rtag go zhes chos mthun pa'i dper rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa na 'bras bu byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo skyed par byed do zhes
translated: The cause that generates the nature of the effect that is produced generates the nature of impermanence.

original: skad cig gi 'jig par ston par @108b 'gyur ba'i tshad ma brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gi 'jig par ston par @108b 'gyur ba'i tshad ma brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The valid cognition that teaches momentary destruction is stated.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gcig yod pa na gzhan mi rtag pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gcig yod pa na gzhan mi rtag pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then when one characteristic of the produced exists, the other, impermanence, would also exist. Since there is no certainty, there would be doubt about error.

original: de ltar yin dang 'di 'khrul pa med par bstan pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'di 'khrul pa med par bstan pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
translated: If that were so, it would not be established that this is taught without error.

original: des na 'di ji lta mi 'khrul par brjod pa de gang las de lta bu nyid du 'grub pa de mtshon par byed pa nyid yin na de ltar rtogs pa'i rigs pa de nyid kyis bstan par byas pa ji ltar rtogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gyur
analyzed: des na 'di ji lta mi 'khrul par brjod pa de gang las de lta bu nyid du 'grub pa de mtshon par byed pa nyid yin na de ltar rtogs pa'i rigs pa de nyid kyis bstan par byas pa ji ltar rtogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gyur
translated: Therefore, if it is said that this is non-erroneous, and if it is established as such, then it is the very indicator of that. If it is taught by that very reasoning which realizes it in that way, then it will be just as it is realized.

original: ro // de bshad pa ni tshad ma des kyang zhes bya ba nas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: ro // de bshad pa ni tshad ma des kyang zhes bya ba nas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is from ‚Äúby that valid cognition‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause it is refuted.‚Äù

original: gal te gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa nyid kyis de ltar 'grub na gzhan mtshon par byed pa la mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa nyid kyis de ltar 'grub na gzhan mtshon par byed pa la mi ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is established in that way by just the teaching ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent, like a pot,‚Äù then it would not depend on another indicator.

original: ci ste yang rang nyid ma grub cing nus pa gzhan yang mtshon par mi byed pa ni the tsom za ba yang nges pa dang ldan pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ji lta ba bzhin ma yin ba kho nar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang rang nyid ma grub cing nus pa gzhan yang mtshon par mi byed pa ni the tsom za ba yang nges pa dang ldan pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ji lta ba bzhin ma yin ba kho nar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not established by itself and does not indicate another capacity, then it would be taught as possessing ascertainment even when in doubt, and therefore it would be taught as not being just as it is.

original: nus pa'i rigs pa mtshon par byed pas ni de'i rtsa ba can gyi bstan pa de lta bu kho na'o zhes bya bar grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i rigs pa mtshon par byed pas ni de'i rtsa ba can gyi bstan pa de lta bu kho na'o zhes bya bar grub pa kho na'o //
translated: The illustration of the reasoning of capability establishes that the teaching which is based on that is just as it is.

original: 'di ltar dpes ni 'di na ji lta bar thams cad du de bzhin no zhes mngon sum gyi byed pa nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dpes ni 'di na ji lta bar thams cad du de bzhin no zhes mngon sum gyi byed pa nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the example brings about the activity of direct perception, ‚Äújust as it is here, so it is everywhere.‚Äù

original: mngon sum tsam ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum tsam ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception alone is not capable of that,

original: gcig tu ci zhig ltar nyams su myong bas thams cad du de lta bu nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu ci zhig ltar nyams su myong bas thams cad du de lta bu nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that just as it is experienced in one place, so it is everywhere.

original: des na ji ltar dpe med pa'i sgra nyid kyis brjod na sgra nus pa med pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar dpe med pa'i sgra nyid kyis brjod na sgra nus pa med pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù cannot express the meaning without a word that is the basis of the exclusion, and just as the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not capable of expressing the meaning, so there is no understanding of the meaning as it is.

original: dpes kyang phyogs gcig pa'i mngon sum nye bar len na mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dpes kyang phyogs gcig pa'i mngon sum nye bar len na mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, if direct perception, which is partial, takes up the example, there is no understanding.

original: des na ngag bzhin du mngon sum yang 'di la nus pa med pa des na nus pa mtshon pa nyid de'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ngag bzhin du mngon sum yang 'di la nus pa med pa des na nus pa mtshon pa nyid de'i byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not capable of expressing the meaning, so direct perception is not capable of expressing the meaning. Therefore, the illustration of the capability is its activity.

original: dpe ni 'brel pa mtshon par byed pa nyid yin gyi ston par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe ni 'brel pa mtshon par byed pa nyid yin gyi ston par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: An example is a mere illustration of a relation, but it is not a demonstrator,

original: de bzhin du nges pa dang ldan par rtogs pa de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nges pa dang ldan par rtogs pa de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of the relation is not possible without the cognition of the example.

original: bstan pa ni 'dir ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya @109a * //üîΩba 'di tsam zhig rtogs pa yin gyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'dir ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya @109a * // ba 'di tsam zhig rtogs pa yin gyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The demonstration here is the mere cognition of the example as it is,üîΩbut not the relation.

original: der de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: der de'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there the application of a valid cognition apprehending that as its object,

original: 'dir chos gzhan gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi chos nyid rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'dir chos gzhan gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi chos nyid rtogs kyi /
translated: because here another property is cognized as the property of another,

original: chos can nges pa la brten pa nyid du ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can nges pa la brten pa nyid du ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not as based on the ascertainment of the property-possessor.

original: nges pa'i chos can yang dper brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i chos can yang dper brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the ascertained property-possessor the example.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod de /
translated: In the case of an effect-reason, too, the statement ‚ÄúWhere there is smoke, there is fire,

original: dper na tshang bang bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshang bang bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: like in a kitchen,‚Äù is not a relation.

original: du ba yod na me yod na ni 'bral pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba yod na me yod na ni 'bral pa ma yin te /
translated: For if there is smoke, there is fire, but there is no relation.

original: 'on kyang me yod na du ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang me yod na du ba yod pa'o //
translated: But if fire exists, smoke exists.

original: gal te 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid kyis tshang bang nye bar len pa yin na ni 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gyur gyi bzlog par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul nyid kyis tshang bang nye bar len pa yin na ni 'brel pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gyur gyi bzlog par ni ma yin no //
translated: If the object of the valid cognition that apprehends the relation is the same as the object of the valid cognition that apprehends the fire, then the relation would be as it is, and not reversed.

original: de na 'dir yang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi dpes rjes su 'gro ba nyid ston pa na de dag gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'phangs pa 'brel pa nye bar ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de na 'dir yang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi dpes rjes su 'gro ba nyid ston pa na de dag gzhan du mi 'thad pas 'phangs pa 'brel pa nye bar ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: So here, when a similar example teaches concomitance, it shows the relation by implying that the two are not tenable apart from each other.

original: de yang gal te chos can de nyid la mthong ba yin na de nyid de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gal te chos can de nyid la mthong ba yin na de nyid de 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the example is seen to have the property of the subject, then the subject itself would be the object of the valid cognition that apprehends the relation.

original: ci ste gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bzung la de yang shes bzhin pa nyid gang na du ba yod na me yod par dmigs par 'gyur ba de dper byed na ni de'i tshe 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bzung la de yang shes bzhin pa nyid gang na du ba yod na me yod par dmigs par 'gyur ba de dper byed na ni de'i tshe 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i yul gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: But if the relation of cause and effect is apprehended elsewhere, and that is exemplified by the cognition ‚Äúwhere there is smoke there is fire,‚Äù then the object of the valid cognition that apprehends the relation would be different.

original: dpe yang gzhan nyid yin par gsal te /
analyzed: dpe yang gzhan nyid yin par gsal te /
translated: The example is also clearly different.

original: gal te 'di dpe med pa'i dag gis kyang mtshon par nus pa'i phyir dpes don med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di dpe med pa'i dag gis kyang mtshon par nus pa'i phyir dpes don med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the meaning is pointless because the example can be illustrated by something that does not exist, you are wrong.

original: dpe yod na ngag der mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe yod na ngag der mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is an example, the statement will be conclusive.

original: dpes stong pa ni nye bar dgod pa ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang rtogs par byed pa'i tshul mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpes stong pa ni nye bar dgod pa ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir dang rtogs par byed pa'i tshul mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: An empty example is not stated because there is no contradiction and because the way of understanding is different.

original: de'i phyir de ston pa'i ngag las chos mthun pa'i dpe gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ston pa'i ngag las chos mthun pa'i dpe gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the statement that teaches that, there is no other example that is similar to the property.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba la sogs pa ltar sbyor bar byed ba ma yin pas mi brjod pa gsal ba yin te rjes su 'gro ldog gi ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba la sogs pa ltar sbyor bar byed ba ma yin pas mi brjod pa gsal ba yin te rjes su 'gro ldog gi ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, it is not stated like a thesis, etc., and so it is clear that it is not expressed, because it is the nature of a statement that follows and reverses.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs cha de'i ngo bor ston pa dpe'i byed pa yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs cha de'i ngo bor ston pa dpe'i byed pa yin par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that the function of the example is to show the nature of that part of the autonomous reason,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bshad pa /
translated: he explains the effect reason.

original: yang na dpe la @109b bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni dngos po tha dad pa la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid don gzhan gyi rgyu dngos por ston to //
analyzed: yang na dpe la @109b bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni dngos po tha dad pa la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid don gzhan gyi rgyu dngos por ston to //
translated: Or else, the property to be established in the example is the nature of an effect, which is a cause that is a different object.

original: gang gi tshe dpes du ba yod na me yod par bstan nas sngar bshad pa'i tshul du du ba la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa la rgyu'i dngos po nyid du bstan par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dpes du ba yod na me yod par bstan nas sngar bshad pa'i tshul du du ba la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa la rgyu'i dngos po nyid du bstan par gyur pa yin te /
translated: When fire is shown to exist where there is smoke, the nature of a cause is shown to be a different object, such as smoke, in the way explained earlier.

original: de ltar bshad pa ni de yod pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir ro ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa ni de yod pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir ro ste /
translated: The explanation is: because it exists when that exists.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it exists when that exists.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas me du ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba bstan pas me du ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by teaching concomitance, it is understood that fire is the cause of smoke.

original: de ltar rtogs pa med par rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med par rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without that understanding, concomitance would not be established.

original: da ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes kyang 'brel pa grub pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes kyang 'brel pa grub pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: Now, to show that the relation is established by the dissimilar example as well, he says:

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus.

original: de'i ngo bo de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo de dag rab tu grub pa yin na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu grub po //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo de dag rab tu grub pa yin na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu grub po //
translated: If the nature of that, its identity, and the nature of its cause and effect are well established, then the contrapositive is well established in the dissimilar example.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni ldog pa bstan pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni ldog pa bstan pa'i don yin la /
translated: The dissimilar example is for the purpose of teaching the contrapositive.

original: de yang 'brel ba grub na 'grub bo //
analyzed: de yang 'brel ba grub na 'grub bo //
translated: And that is established if the relation is established.

original: des na de ni de nyid mtshon pa na ldog pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni de nyid mtshon pa na ldog pa ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when that is illustrated, the contrapositive is taught.

original: gtan tshigs gnyi gar yang ldog pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyi gar yang ldog pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The statement of the contrapositive in both the reason and the example is

original: mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not impermanent.‚Äù

original: de yang 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can nyid du ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can nyid du ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And the statement that that is rooted in the relation is ‚Äúbecause . . .‚Äù

original: gal te chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa can gyi dag dag las de dag gi dpe tha mi dad na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos mthun pa dang mi mthun pa can gyi dag dag las de dag gi dpe tha mi dad na rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the examples in the similar and dissimilar examples are not different, then there would be no inference for oneself.üîΩThe answer to that is

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:üîΩüîΩ

original: ji ltar sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par sgra med kyang sgra'i rtogs pa'i tshul du 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang bar bya ba'i ngo bor chos mthun pa'am mi mthun par khyab pa rtogs pa de bzhin du dpe steng
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor ba mthong ba goms pa las rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par sgra med kyang sgra'i rtogs pa'i tshul du 'phen par byed pa dang 'phang bar bya ba'i ngo bor chos mthun pa'am mi mthun par khyab pa rtogs pa de bzhin du dpe steng
translated: Just as one infers the meaning for oneself from seeing the application of the example, one can project the meaning of the example in the form of a statement, even without the words, by understanding the pervasion in terms of similarity or dissimilarity.

original: thogs su nges pa ji ltar bstan pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: thogs su nges pa ji ltar bstan pa'i med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: The certainty that is taught in the example is the invariable concomitance.

original: de'i phyir dpe la khyab pa brjod pa las lhag pa'i nye bar sbyor ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe la khyab pa brjod pa las lhag pa'i nye bar sbyor ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no application of the example that goes beyond stating the pervasion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason, it is said:

original: gtan tshigs mtshan nyid gsum nyid las /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mtshan nyid gsum nyid las /
translated: From the three characteristics of the reason,

original: dpe ni logs su brjod ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: dpe ni logs su brjod ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: The example is not stated separately.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yang nye bar sbyor na ni mtshan nyid gsum brjod pa yang logs su brjod par 'gyur @110a * //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yang nye bar sbyor na ni mtshan nyid gsum brjod pa yang logs su brjod par 'gyur @110a * //
translated: If the example were applied in some way, then the statement of the three characteristics would also be stated separately.

original: ro // 'brel pa grub pas ldog pa grub pa'i phyir gzhi med kyang gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // 'brel pa grub pas ldog pa grub pa'i phyir gzhi med kyang gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the pervasion is established by the establishment of the relation, the negative concomitance is established even without a locus.

original: gang gi tshe dpe la de ltar dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa 'grub pa de'i tshe ni gzhi med par ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dpe la de ltar dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa 'grub pa de'i tshe ni gzhi med par ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the pervasion is established by the observation and nonobservation of the example in that way, then the negative concomitance is not unestablished even without a locus.

original: mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa la byas pa med pa yin nam 'on te rta'i rva nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos nyid byas pa nyid dang mi ldan pa yin no zhes so /
analyzed: mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir rta'i rva la sogs pa la byas pa med pa yin nam 'on te rta'i rva nyid med pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos nyid byas pa nyid dang mi ldan pa yin no zhes so /
translated: Is it because there is no impermanence that there is no product in a rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on, or is it because there is no rabbit‚Äôs horn itself that the property of an entity, product, is not possessed?

original: des na de med pa'i phyir de la med pa'i phyir 'di cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na de med pa'i phyir de la med pa'i phyir 'di cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because of its nonexistence, it is not suitable for anything to exist in it.

original: de med pa nyid kyis mi 'jug pa yin gyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes mi 'jug pa gzhan du grub pas na ldog pa ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa nyid kyis mi 'jug pa yin gyi mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes mi 'jug pa gzhan du grub pas na ldog pa ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not engaged due to its nonexistence, but not because impermanence does not exist. Since the nonengagement is established elsewhere, the negative concomitance would be indefinite.

original: gang gi tshe ga zhi yod kyang de tsam la bsgrub bya med na med pa nges pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir dpe la gnas pa'i nges pas don 'ga' yang med pa de'i tshe der yang gnyi ga 'dod rgyal bar med pa yin no zhes dogs la 'dir
analyzed: gang gi tshe ga zhi yod kyang de tsam la bsgrub bya med na med pa nges pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir dpe la gnas pa'i nges pas don 'ga' yang med pa de'i tshe der yang gnyi ga 'dod rgyal bar med pa yin no zhes dogs la 'dir
translated: If, although the reason exists, the probandum does not exist merely in virtue of that, then, since the nonexistence of the reason is not a basis for ascertaining the probandum, there is no point in ascertaining the example.

original: yang dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la byed pa yin no zhes dogs pas gzhi med kyang khyad par med la /
analyzed: yang dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la byed pa yin no zhes dogs pas gzhi med kyang khyad par med la /
translated: If you think that in that case, the existence of both is not established by mere whim, then, since it is a property of things, you may think that nonexistence is like the horn of a rabbit, and so on.üîΩBut even without a basis, there is no difference.

original: sgra bzhin du mngon sum yang rang nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa yal bar dor te nges pa'i rgyal mtshan mtshon par byed pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin pa na gzhi yod pa dang med pa dag la khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra bzhin du mngon sum yang rang nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa yal bar dor te nges pa'i rgyal mtshan mtshon par byed pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin pa na gzhi yod pa dang med pa dag la khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If, as in the case of the words, direct perception is also something that is ascertained by its very nature, then, having discarded that, it is the very nature of the ascertainment of the banner of the reason that ascertains. In that case, there is no difference between the existence and nonexistence of the basis.

original: gal te dpe dang bcas pa'i khyab par brjod pa yang don ma nges pa nyid kyis 'brel pa nyid mtshon pa na nges par 'gyur ba yin pa na 'o na 'brel pa de nyid mtshon par bya ba'i khyab pa brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dpe dang bcas pa'i khyab par brjod pa yang don ma nges pa nyid kyis 'brel pa nyid mtshon pa na nges par 'gyur ba yin pa na 'o na 'brel pa de nyid mtshon par bya ba'i khyab pa brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If the pervasion is stated along with an example, and the relation is indicated by the fact that the meaning is not ascertained, then it is ascertained. But what is the use of stating the pervasion in order to indicate that very relation?

original: ji ltar 'brel pa yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas chod pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa 'di ni gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa yod kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas chod pas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa 'di ni gtan la phab zin to //
translated: We have already determined that even when the relation exists, the probandum is not understood because of the interruption of the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: des na de'i yan lag dang mi 'bras pa'i phyir rang dbang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i yan lag dang mi 'bras pa'i phyir rang dbang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not independent because it is not a part of that.

original: de ltar na phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dag tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni dag tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the classification of the position, etc. is not just the nature of the mere words.

original: dngos po'i yan lag tu ma gyur pa brda tsam gyis ni bstan bcos byed pa dag mtshan nyid ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i yan lag tu ma gyur pa brda tsam gyis ni bstan bcos byed pa dag mtshan nyid ston pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who compose treatises do not teach the definition by mere words that are not parts of the thing.

original: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pas ni rjes su 'gro @110b ldog gnyis brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pas ni rjes su 'gro @110b ldog gnyis brjod la /
translated: Thus, the presence and absence of the property to be established in the similar and dissimilar instances are stated as the positive and negative pervasions.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i chos kyi rten gyis ni de dag las phyogs gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i chos kyi rten gyis ni de dag las phyogs gzhan kho na'o //
translated: But the basis of the property to be established is a different category from those two.

original: khyab pa ston pa'i skabs su ni nges pa'i chos can 'dzin pa yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid dam dpe nyid la khyab par brjod par bya'i zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang na 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa ston pa'i skabs su ni nges pa'i chos can 'dzin pa yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid dam dpe nyid la khyab par brjod par bya'i zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang na 'brel pa yin te /
translated: In the context of demonstrating the pervasion, since the ascertained subject is not a part of the proof, the pervasion is stated either in terms of the predicate of the probandum or in terms of the example.

original: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de mi rtag pa yin no zhes nges pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pas na 'di gang gi khyab pa ma yin rjes su dpag par bya ba tsam la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang byas pa de dang de mi rtag pa yin no zhes nges pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pas na 'di gang gi khyab pa ma yin rjes su dpag par bya ba tsam la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
