translated: Since there is no ascertainment that ‚Äúwhatever is produced is impermanent,‚Äù it is not the pervasion of anything.

original: phyi'i khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the external pervasion,

original: dpe tsam la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe tsam la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not rest on the mere example.

original: de ltar spros pas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration.

original: de ltar na 'o na rjes su 'gro ldog bzhin du 'brel pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshig yan lag gsum par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te khyab pa'i tshig rtogs na 'brel pa don gyisüîΩgo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na rjes su 'gro ldog bzhin du 'brel pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshig yan lag gsum par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te khyab pa'i tshig rtogs na 'brel pa don gyis go ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the word ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù is understood, the relation is understood implicitly.

original: de ma rtogs na ni brjod pa'i khyab pa yang mi rtogs pas de brjod pa don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma rtogs na ni brjod pa'i khyab pa yang mi rtogs pas de brjod pa don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not understood, then the stated pervasion is not understood, and so stating it would be pointless.

original: 'brel pa ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshul gsum nyid yin pas 'di tshul gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshul gsum nyid yin pas 'di tshul gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The relation is not the definition of the reason, but rather the trimodal condition. Therefore, it is not a separate mode.

original: des na de ltar de dag med na'ang de med ces bya ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir mi mkhas pa'i dbang du byas te gzhi med par yang zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug par dpe'i dgos pa 'brel pa tsam yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar de dag med na'ang de med ces bya ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir mi mkhas pa'i dbang du byas te gzhi med par yang zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug par dpe'i dgos pa 'brel pa tsam yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though it does not exist in that way, in order to maintain the text as it is, for the sake of the unlearned, the purpose of the example is said to be merely the relation at the end of this statement, ‚Äúwithout a basis.‚Äù

original: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas kyang gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gang dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas kyang gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gang dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to establish the treatise from the point of view of the expert, he says, For those who know the relation.

original: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba rab tu grub pa la'o //
analyzed: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba rab tu grub pa la'o //
translated: For those who know the relation of the nature of that, the essence of that, and the origin of that, it is established.

original: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: In order to teach in another way from the point of view of the expert, he says, For those who know the relation.

original: 'brel pa rig pa'i mkhas pa de rnams la ni 'brel pa rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang 'brel ba gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad do //
analyzed: 'brel pa rig pa'i mkhas pa de rnams la ni 'brel pa rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang 'brel ba gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad do //
translated: For those experts who know the relation, the means of teaching the relation is merely stating the reason.

original: gtan tshigs ni brjod la 'brel pa rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang bral ba zhes bya bas ni phyogs kyi chos tsam 'ba' zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni brjod la 'brel pa rab tu ston pa'i thabs dang bral ba zhes bya bas ni phyogs kyi chos tsam 'ba' zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By saying, The reason is stated, but without the means of teaching the relation, it is explained that one should merely state the property of the subject.

original: tshul gsum med na rtags nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di @111a * //
analyzed: tshul gsum med na rtags nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // 'di @111a * //
translated: Because without the three modes, it would not be a reason.üîΩThis

original: skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: is what is said.

original: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gtan tshigs tsam brjod pa nyid rigs pa'i phyir dpe nyid kyis cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir gzhis ni gsal bar yang byar med do //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gtan tshigs tsam brjod pa nyid rigs pa'i phyir dpe nyid kyis cung zad kyang byar med pa'i phyir gzhis ni gsal bar yang byar med do //
translated: But when it is a matter of the expert, it is proper to state only the reason, because the example itself does nothing, so the locus is not stated.

original: 'di ltar me dud kyi 'brel pa rig pa'i me don du gnyer ba dmigs nas gang na du ba 'di yod pa der song shig ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar me dud kyi 'brel pa rig pa'i me don du gnyer ba dmigs nas gang na du ba 'di yod pa der song shig ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one who knows the connection of smoke and fire, and who is seeking fire, is told, ‚ÄúGo where there is this smoke.‚Äù

original: des na mi mkhas pa 'brel pa mi rtogs pa la de dag med na de med ces brjod pa tsam gyis 'gyur ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhi don med do //
analyzed: des na mi mkhas pa 'brel pa mi rtogs pa la de dag med na de med ces brjod pa tsam gyis 'gyur ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhi don med do //
translated: So, for the ignorant who do not understand the connection, the mere statement, ‚ÄúIf those are not, this is not,‚Äù is sufficient. There is no need for a negative example or a positive example or a locus.

original: mkhas pa la ni brjod pa dang dpe'am de'i gzhi yang rung ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa la ni brjod pa dang dpe'am de'i gzhi yang rung ste /
translated: But for the expert, there is no need for any of these: statement, example, or locus.

original: 'di thams cad dgos pa med do zhes gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad dgos pa med do zhes gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad do //
translated: This is explained by the statement beginning with ‚ÄúFor what purpose?‚Äù

original: ldog pa ni 'brel pa rab tu bstan pa'i don yin na de ni grub pa des na de grub pa de'i tshe dpe brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ldog pa ni 'brel pa rab tu bstan pa'i don yin na de ni grub pa des na de grub pa de'i tshe dpe brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If the purpose of the example is to show the relation, then that is established by the establishment of that, so what is the use of stating an example at that time?

original: de lta yin dang skabs kyi don grub pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni de rab tu bstan na yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skabs kyi don grub pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni de rab tu bstan na yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the meaning of the passage would be established, and that is shown by the words ‚Äúeven if that is shown.‚Äù

original: dpe brjod pa nyid dgos pa med na de rab tu bstan pa yin na 'gyur ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe gzhi gang yin pa de yang don med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa nyid dgos pa med na de rab tu bstan pa yin na 'gyur ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe gzhi gang yin pa de yang don med pa kho na'o //
translated: If the statement of the example is purposeless, then the statement of the example would be purposeless.

original: dpe brjod na de'i tshe gzhi'i yul can gyis dpyod pa 'jug pa zhig na de brjod pa yang med na ni gzhi nye bar mkho ba med par gdon mi za ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod na de'i tshe gzhi'i yul can gyis dpyod pa 'jug pa zhig na de brjod pa yang med na ni gzhi nye bar mkho ba med par gdon mi za ba kho na'o //
translated: If the example were stated, then the analysis of the subject matter would be engaged, but if that is not stated, then the subject matter is certainly not needed.

original: slob dpon yang 'di bzhed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni snyam du dgongs shing bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon yang 'di bzhed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni snyam du dgongs shing bya ba'o //
translated: The master also accepts this, as explained.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe phyir rgol ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rtag pa khas mi len pa'i tshe ji ltar rtag pa la byas pa nyid ldog ce na zhes dgos pa bsu nas de'i the tshom nyid med de /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe phyir rgol ba nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rtag pa khas mi len pa'i tshe ji ltar rtag pa la byas pa nyid ldog ce na zhes dgos pa bsu nas de'i the tshom nyid med de /
translated: The master Dignaga, anticipating this objection, abandons the basis of the argument, saying, There is no such doubt,

original: de med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po gzhi spong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po gzhi spong bar mdzad do //
translated: because, in the absence of that, one does not engage in it.üîΩThus, since it is said that the example is baseless, it is taught that he accepts the relation.

original: des na de ltar dpe med pa gzhi spong bar gsungs pas 'brel pa bzhed pa kho na'o zhes bstan nas tshul gzhan gyis kyang slob dpon 'brel pa zhal gyis bzhes par ston pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar dpe med pa gzhi spong bar gsungs pas 'brel pa bzhed pa kho na'o zhes bstan nas tshul gzhan gyis kyang slob dpon 'brel pa zhal gyis bzhes par ston pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase for that very reason teaches that the master accepts the relation in another way.

original: dpe la de'i ngo bo dang / rgyu'i dngos po ston pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis gzhi spong bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi @111b phyir gang gis 'brel pa shes pa'i rtogs pa po de la gnyis las zhes bya ba skabs su babs pa'i dpe gnyis kyi nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig
analyzed: dpe la de'i ngo bo dang / rgyu'i dngos po ston pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis gzhi spong bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi @111b phyir gang gis 'brel pa shes pa'i rtogs pa po de la gnyis las zhes bya ba skabs su babs pa'i dpe gnyis kyi nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig
translated: The example is the illustration of the nature of that and the cause of that. The reason that is explained to abandon the basis is that very reason. Therefore, for the one who understands the connection, from the two examples that are relevant,

original: smras pas don gyis go bas shugs kyis thob pa de rgyur gyur pas dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pas don gyis go bas shugs kyis thob pa de rgyur gyur pas dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is stated. By the meaning being understood, the one that is implicitly obtained is the cause. Thus, correct recollection arises.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang gi tshe dpe 'brel pa rab tu ston par byed pa de'i tshe de rnam pa gnyis yin yang gang yang rung ba zhig brjod pas 'brel ba shes pa na dpe gnyis pa las dran pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang gi tshe dpe 'brel pa rab tu ston par byed pa de'i tshe de rnam pa gnyis yin yang gang yang rung ba zhig brjod pas 'brel ba shes pa na dpe gnyis pa las dran pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is said: When the connection of the example is being taught, at that time, although it is twofold, by stating one of the two, when the connection is understood, recollection arises from the second example.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is being taught: Or,

original: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi der yang slob dpon dpes de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po ston par dgongs te /
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi der yang slob dpon dpes de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po ston par dgongs te /
translated: Not only is this the explanation above, but the Master also intends to teach the nature and causal state of that example.

original: don gyis go pas gcig brjod pas dpe cig shos 'grub par bshad do //
analyzed: don gyis go pas gcig brjod pas dpe cig shos 'grub par bshad do //
translated: Since the meaning is understood, by stating one, the other example is established.

original: yang ji ltar na dpe de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po ston pa yin la /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na dpe de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po ston pa yin la /
translated: Again, how does that example teach the nature and causal state of that?üîΩAnd how does the meaning understood cause one to remember the other?

original: don gyis go bas gzhan dran par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas gzhan dran par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Thus, he says,

original: 'brel pa nye bar ston pa mdor bsdus nas bshad kyang rgyas par 'chad do //
analyzed: 'brel pa nye bar ston pa mdor bsdus nas bshad kyang rgyas par 'chad do //
translated: although the connection is taught in brief, it is explained extensively.üîΩWhen it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent,‚Äù

original: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes smras na zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes smras na zhes bya bas ni chos mthun pa bstan to //
translated: this teaches the similar property.

original: dpe'i skabs yin yang ches mthun pa tsam brjod pa ni ji skad brjod pa'i tshul du dpe tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i don du'o //üîΩgsal bar te gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa gang yin pa 'di ni byas pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dpe'i skabs yin yang ches mthun pa tsam brjod pa ni ji skad brjod pa'i tshul du dpe tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i don du'o // gsal bar te gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa gang yin pa 'di ni byas pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.

original: ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig can bshad pa de tsam dang 'brel pa'o //üîΩgang zhig gang yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa de ni de'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig can bshad pa de tsam dang 'brel pa'o // gang zhig gang yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa de ni de'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang byas pa yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang byas pa yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.

original: gal te gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes smras na ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid do zhes rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde yod par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes smras na ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid do zhes rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / de yod par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: The nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.

original: mi rtag pa de yod par nges pa'i phyir 'di de'i ngo bo yin no zhes shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa de yod par nges pa'i phyir 'di de'i ngo bo yin no zhes shes so //
translated: The nature of the thing is the invariable concomitance.üîΩThe nature of the thing is the invariable

original: gang byas pa de mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa nges par rtogs te /
analyzed: gang byas pa de mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa nges par rtogs te /
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: gang byas pa zhes byas pa mtha' dag yongs su bzung nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang byas pa zhes byas pa mtha' dag yongs su bzung nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one definitely understands that impermanence exists, because the entire category of what is produced is taken as the basis.

original: 'di skad @112a * //üîΩbrjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad @112a * // brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: byas pa las mi ldog pa nges par bstan pas mi rtag pa de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo yin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa las mi ldog pa nges par bstan pas mi rtag pa de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo yin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: One understands that impermanence is the nature of the essence that is related to just that which is produced, because it is taught that what is produced is not reversed.

original: de'i bdag nyid du mi shas na de ltar nye bar ston pa ma yin pa des na yod pa bzhin du de'i ngo bor tshad mas mthong ba nyid du de nyid las rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du mi shas na de ltar nye bar ston pa ma yin pa des na yod pa bzhin du de'i ngo bor tshad mas mthong ba nyid du de nyid las rtogs so //
translated: If one does not understand that it is of that nature, it is not taught in that way. Therefore, one understands from that itself that it is seen by valid cognition as the nature of that which exists.

original: de bshad pa ni tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äúseen by valid cognition.‚Äù

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang de yod par nges pa yod pa ma yin nam des na ji ltar de las de tsam dang 'brel ba'i rang gi ngo bor rtogs she na don tha dad pa med na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang de yod par nges pa yod pa ma yin nam des na ji ltar de las de tsam dang 'brel ba'i rang gi ngo bor rtogs she na don tha dad pa med na zhes smos so //
translated: If there is no difference in meaning, it is said.

original: re zhig mi rtag pa ni byas pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mi rtag pa ni byas pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Impermanence is not different from the produced.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de yod par nges pa gang yin pa de ni chos gcig gi bdag nyid du go bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de yod par nges pa gang yin pa de ni chos gcig gi bdag nyid du go bar byed do //
translated: That which is not different, if it is certain that it exists, it is understood to be of the nature of a single phenomenon.

original: gzhan ma yin yang byas pa rtsol ba las byung ba la nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba brjod na de'i bdag nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin yang byas pa rtsol ba las byung ba la nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // des na ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba brjod na de'i bdag nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is not different, it is not certain that the produced arises from effort.üîΩTherefore, if the concomitance as taught is stated, it is understood to be of the same nature as that.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid du shes pas na don gyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyod pa'i don gyis go bas mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid du shes pas na don gyi rang bzhin rnam par dpyod pa'i don gyis go bas mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is said to be of that nature. By knowing it to be of the same nature as that, the meaning of the analysis of the nature of the object is understood. Therefore, if impermanence does not exist, the produced does not exist.

original: mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa med do zhes rtogs pa'i byed pa yang yod la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa med do zhes rtogs pa'i byed pa yang yod la /
translated: If impermanence did not exist, then the activity of understanding ‚Äúthe produced does not exist‚Äù would exist,

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag gi don gyi rnam pa'i don kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ngag gi don gyi rnam pa'i don kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: and the meaning of the statement would exist in the form of an aspect.

original: des na zhes bya ba'i sgra don 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin na ni de'i ngo bor shes pa la de lta bu'i don du 'gyur bar brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'i sgra don 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid yin na ni de'i ngo bor shes pa la de lta bu'i don du 'gyur bar brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù had the nature of apprehending an object, then it would be said that consciousness would have that nature as its object.

original: de ni de'i ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i ci yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that at all.

original: des na rtogs pa'i byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i rtogs pa bstan pa yin te rtogs pa med pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa'i byed pa nyid kyis rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i rtogs pa bstan pa yin te rtogs pa med pa la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúTherefore, consciousness has that nature as its object‚Äù teaches that the aspect is the activity of understanding, because if there were no understanding, that would not exist.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa nyid kyis ldog pa 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa nyid kyis ldog pa 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: This statement itself implies the pervasion.

original: des na de'i ngo bor shes pa zhes brjod par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de'i ngo bor shes pa zhes brjod par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that consciousness has that nature as its object.

original: 'di ltar gal te mi rtag pa med par yang byas pa yod na ni gang byas pa de mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te mi rtag pa med par yang byas pa yod na ni gang byas pa de mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, if the produced existed without impermanence, then it would not be the case that whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: byas pa rtag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa rtag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is produced is permanent.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis ldog pa 'phangs pas 'brel pa mdun du 'gro ba la mi ltos so //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis ldog pa 'phangs pas 'brel pa mdun du 'gro ba la mi ltos so //
translated: Therefore, because of the pervasion, the reverse is implied, and so it does not depend on the forward pervasion.üîΩIn the same way, the reverse pervasion is taught in the following passage:

original: de bzhin du rjes thogs su ston par 'gyur @112b ba'i ldog pa yang ngo zhes de'i dgongs pa 'di yin te gal te yang 'ga' zhig tu byas pa yod par mi rtag pa yod par 'gyur bas byas pa de mi rtag pa zhes bya ba yin mod kyi
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes thogs su ston par 'gyur @112b ba'i ldog pa yang ngo zhes de'i dgongs pa 'di yin te gal te yang 'ga' zhig tu byas pa yod par mi rtag pa yod par 'gyur bas byas pa de mi rtag pa zhes bya ba yin mod kyi
translated: ‚ÄúIf something is produced, it must be impermanent.‚Äù

original: / de lta na yang gang byas pa zhes de ltar khyab pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: / de lta na yang gang byas pa zhes de ltar khyab pa mi 'grub po //
translated: However, even so, the pervasion is not established in the way that ‚Äúwhatever is produced is impermanent.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar brjod pa tsam gyis de lta yin par 'gyur na khyab pa brjod pas ldog pa 'phen par 'gyur ro 'brel pa nyid las de ltar 'gyur ba yin te des na gcig gis gzhan 'brel ba'i sgo kho na nas 'phen to //
analyzed: gal te de ltar brjod pa tsam gyis de lta yin par 'gyur na khyab pa brjod pas ldog pa 'phen par 'gyur ro 'brel pa nyid las de ltar 'gyur ba yin te des na gcig gis gzhan 'brel ba'i sgo kho na nas 'phen to //
translated: If that were so, then the reverse pervasion would be implied by the statement of the pervasion, because that is the way it is, due to the relation between the two. Therefore, one implies the other only through the relation between them.

original: de lta na ni 'brel pa las rjes su 'gro ba yin la rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis kyang ldog pa 'phen par 'gyur gyis rjes su 'gro bas ni 'brel pa rtogs la de la ldog pa 'phen pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'brel pa las rjes su 'gro ba yin la rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis kyang ldog pa 'phen par 'gyur gyis rjes su 'gro bas ni 'brel pa rtogs la de la ldog pa 'phen pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the relation would be established by the positive concomitance, and the negative concomitance would be projected by the positive concomitance itself, but the relation would not be established by the positive concomitance, and the negative concomitance would not be projected by that.

original: 'di ltar byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces 'brel pa la don grub na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces 'brel pa la don grub na /
translated: If the meaning of the relation ‚ÄúAll that is produced is impermanent‚Äù is established,

original: gang gi phyir byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces 'brel pa la don grub na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces 'brel pa la don grub na /
translated: then the meaning of the relation ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent‚Äù is established.

original: gang gi phyir byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa med na byas pa med do zhes 'grub bo zhe na 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa med na byas pa med do zhes 'grub bo zhe na 'di la brjod pa /
translated: If the meaning of the relation ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent‚Äù is established, then it is established that ‚ÄúIf the impermanent does not exist, the produced does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'dir gcig ni brjod pa'i sgo nas 'phen la gzhan ni tshad ma'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dir gcig ni brjod pa'i sgo nas 'phen la gzhan ni tshad ma'i sgo nas so //
translated: In this regard, one is projected by the statement and the other is projected by the valid knowledge.

original: des na gal te byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces bya bas ldog pa 'phen pa de lta na yang thams gang gi gzhi las rjes su 'gro ba grub pa thabs de'i gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te byas pa thams cad mi rtag ces bya bas ldog pa 'phen pa de lta na yang thams gang gi gzhi las rjes su 'gro ba grub pa thabs de'i gzhir gyur pa nyid kyis ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the statement ‚ÄúAll that is produced is impermanent‚Äù implies the contrapositive, then the contrapositive is established by the same means that establishes the pervasion.

original: des na de nyid kyi de 'phen to //
analyzed: des na de nyid kyi de 'phen to //
translated: Therefore, it implies the contrapositive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bor med par yod par 'gyur na ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bor med par yod par 'gyur na ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it existed without that, it would not exist.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du rtogs na gang gi phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir de med na med par rtogs pa'i phyir don gyi go bas ldog pa rtogs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du rtogs na gang gi phyir de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa de'i phyir de med na med par rtogs pa'i phyir don gyi go bas ldog pa rtogs so //
translated: Because impermanence is the nature of the produced, when it is understood to be its nature, then because it is its nature, it is understood that it does not exist without it. Therefore the contrapositive is understood by the meaning of the statement.

original: de de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na de dang tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na de dang tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: If it were its nature, it would be inseparable from it.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid med pa gang yin ba de nyid byas pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid med pa gang yin ba de nyid byas pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of impermanence is itself the absence of the produced.

original: gang gi tshe de'i bdag nyid rab tu ston pa'i rjes su 'gro bas 'bras bu ldog pa 'phen par mi byed pa de'i tshe ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub po zhes bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i bdag nyid rab tu ston pa'i rjes su 'gro bas 'bras bu ldog pa 'phen par mi byed pa de'i tshe ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub po zhes bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When the pervasion is not established, then the reverse pervasion is not projected by the indication of its nature, and at that time, the forward pervasion is not established.

original: tha dad pa med pa ma yin na byas pa yod na mi rtag pa nyid yod do zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na de ltar rjes su @113a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ma yin na byas pa yod na mi rtag pa nyid yod do zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // des na de ltar rjes su @113a * //
translated: If it were not so, then the existence of impermanence would not be due to the existence of being produced.

original: 'gro bas 'brel pa rtogs par byed pa na ldog pa 'phen te /
analyzed: 'gro bas 'brel pa rtogs par byed pa na ldog pa 'phen te /
translated: Thus, when the connection by the forward pervasion is understood, the reverse pervasion is projected.üîΩOtherwise, it would follow that the forward pervasion would not be established.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma grub par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsgrubs nas tshul 'di nyid chos mi mthun pa brjod pa la yang yod do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba nyid ma grub par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bsgrubs nas tshul 'di nyid chos mi mthun pa brjod pa la yang yod do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Having thus established that, he explains that this method also applies to the statement of a dissimilar example:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly.

original: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang de med na de med do zhes smras na ldog pa brjod pa nyid kyis de rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa la rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang de med na de med do zhes smras na ldog pa brjod pa nyid kyis de rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa la rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If one says that when that does not exist, this does not exist, then by stating the contrapositive, one understands that. Therefore, by understanding its nature, memory arises that conforms to the cognition of that nature.

original: chos mi mthun pa brjod pa las de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa 'thob po //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa brjod pa las de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa 'thob po //
translated: By stating the dissimilar example, one obtains the cognition of its nature, which is the understanding of its nature.

original: re zhig thabs gzhan gyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: re zhig thabs gzhan gyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: For now, it is not by another method that one understands the conformity,

original: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid kho nas yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rig ces bya ba dang de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid kho nas yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rig ces bya ba dang de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas zhes bshad do //
translated: but rather by its very nature. To demonstrate this, it is said, by the cognition of its nature and by understanding its nature.

original: de ltar brjod pas ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs ba de bshad pa ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pas ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs ba de bshad pa ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: By this statement, how is the understanding of its nature explained? It is like this: This impermanence is the nature of this.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if impermanence does not exist, then the produced does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin te de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni don gzhan de med na med par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni don gzhan de med na med par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, if it were not of the nature of that, then it would not be the case that when the other object does not exist, it does not exist.

original: de ltar rnam pa 'dis de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa yin no //üîΩji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang bstan pa'i phyir de der nges pa med pa'i phyir me'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rang zhes smras na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'dis de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa yin no // ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang bstan pa'i phyir de der nges pa med pa'i phyir me'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rang zhes smras na /
translated: Thus, by this method, it is understood to be of its nature.

original: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ji skad brjod pa'i rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du shes pa don gyis go bas ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu ring bar 'brel to //
analyzed: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ji skad brjod pa'i rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid du shes pa don gyis go bas ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu ring bar 'brel to //
translated: In order to show that the very method explained is also the case with the effect-inferential reason, he says, ‚ÄúIf one says that smoke is the nature of the characteristic of fire, because it is ascertained as that, then, by the concomitance of the statement, ‚ÄòSmoke is the effect of fire,‚Äô its being the effect is understood by implication, and the counter-pervasion is understood.‚Äù The connection is very extended.

original: ji ltar du ba me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro bas shes she na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar du ba me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro bas shes she na bshad pa /
translated: How is it known that smoke is the effect of fire by the concomitance?

original: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
analyzed: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
translated: Thus, if smoke exists, then fire exists without a doubt.

original: de lta ma yin te 'bras bu nyid ma yin na du ba de dang 'brel pa de yod na yod pa'i mtshan nyid der nges pa med pa'i phyir me'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'bras bu nyid ma yin na du ba de dang 'brel pa de yod na yod pa'i mtshan nyid der nges pa med pa'i phyir me'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, if smoke were not an effect, then the existence of the relation of the existence of the effect in the existence of the cause would not be ascertained in that, and smoke would be independent as the nature of the definition of fire.

original: du ba yod na gdon mi za bar yod pa spangs te de yod kyang med par 'gyur ro snyam par dogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ba yod na gdon mi za bar yod pa spangs te de yod kyang med par 'gyur ro snyam par dogs pa'o //
translated: If smoke exists, it would be necessary to abandon the existence of fire, and it would be thought that fire would not exist even though smoke exists.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa byas pa @113b yod na yang mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa byas pa @113b yod na yang mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the non-effect is produced, is impermanence not also present?

original: don gzhan zhes smos so //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúother‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos po tha dad 'brel pa nges pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad 'brel pa nges pa mi 'thad do //
translated: The relation of different things is not tenable.

original: me yang du ba las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: me yang du ba las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Fire is also different from smoke.

original: da lta yin dang me med kyang du ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da lta yin dang me med kyang du ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is explained that if fire exists, smoke would exist, and if fire does not exist, smoke would not exist.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is the explanation.

original: gang gi phyir me rang dbang du 'gyur te du ba yod pa yin yang med pa des na du ba yod kyang me med pa'i phyir du ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur pas na me med kyang du ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir me rang dbang du 'gyur te du ba yod pa yin yang med pa des na du ba yod kyang me med pa'i phyir du ba 'ba' zhig tu gyur pas na me med kyang du ba med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Why would fire be independent? Even if smoke exists, it does not exist. Therefore, even if smoke exists, fire does not exist. Because it is only smoke, even if fire does not exist, smoke does not become nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its own nature is not incomplete.

original: gang gi tshe ma las du ba'i rang gi ngo bo mthong bas du ba me'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa de'i tshe ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rigs pas du ba yod pa na yang me yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma las du ba'i rang gi ngo bo mthong bas du ba me'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa de'i tshe ji skad bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rigs pas du ba yod pa na yang me yod pa yin no //
translated: When the nature of smoke is seen from the cause, since smoke is dependent on fire, at that time, by the reasoning of the pervasion of the previously explained reason, when smoke exists, fire also exists.

original: gang gi phyir tshul gsum pa gtan tshigs su sngar bstan pa des na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul gsum pa gtan tshigs su sngar bstan pa des na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Because the trimodal criterion of the reason was previously explained, one must accept that it definitely exists. Therefore, it is definitely dependent.

original: des na me las gdon mi za bar 'byung ba dor na du ba yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na me las gdon mi za bar 'byung ba dor na du ba yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if one abandons the definite arising from fire, smoke is not its effect.

original: des na 'di me med kyang rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang nyams pa med pas ldog pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des na 'di me med kyang rang gi ngo bo 'ga' yang nyams pa med pas ldog pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, even though fire does not exist here, since its own nature is not impaired in any way, the absence of fire is not established.

original: des na thams cad du du ba yod na me yod do zhes rjes su 'gro ba smras pas kyang ldog pa 'phen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad du du ba yod na me yod do zhes rjes su 'gro ba smras pas kyang ldog pa 'phen pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though one states that wherever there is smoke, there is fire, the absence of fire is not implied.

original: des na 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa med na rjes su 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar bstan pa med na rjes su 'gro ba med la /
translated: Therefore, it is established that if the relation of cause and effect is not demonstrated, the absence of fire is not implied.

original: ldog pa don gyi 'phen pa yang nyams pa med do zhes bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni 'bras bu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa don gyi 'phen pa yang nyams pa med do zhes bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni 'bras bu yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having established this, the statement ‚Äúif it is a cause and effect, it is tenable‚Äù is made.

original: 'bras bu yod na ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yod do //
translated: If the effect exists, the cause certainly exists.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu rgyu nyid yin pa ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu rgyu nyid yin pa ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: The reason is that the cause is a cause only ifüîΩthe effect exists, and the cause is established as a cause only if the effect exists.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog pa ste nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog pa ste nye bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is that if it exists, its own nature is established, that is, it is present.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: 'bras bu yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang zhes smos so //
translated: The effect is also mentioned.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni de yod pa nyid na yod pa yin no //üîΩdes na 'bras bu yod pa rgyu med na med pas gdon mi za bar rgyu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni de yod pa nyid na yod pa yin no // des na 'bras bu yod pa rgyu med na med pas gdon mi za bar rgyu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect exists when it exists.üîΩTherefore, since the effect exists when the cause exists, the cause must exist.

original: des na de'i rtsa ba can don gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa ni rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i rtsa ba can don gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa ni rgyu'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause is the cause of the effect, since the existence of the effect is based on it, and the existence of the cause is based on the existence of the cause of the cause.

original: 'bras bur bstan na ni @114a * //
analyzed: 'bras bur bstan na ni @114a * //
translated: If the effect is taught,

original: 'di 'thad pa yin na du ba la 'di yod ces bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di 'thad pa yin na du ba la 'di yod ces bya ba ga las she na /
translated: then this is tenable. But how can it be said that this exists in smoke?

original: de yang du ba la yod do zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang du ba la yod do zhes smos so //
translated: It is said that it exists in smoke.

original: de yod pa nyid ni yod pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu nyid du ba la yod pa de lta bas na du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid ni yod pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bu nyid du ba la yod pa de lta bas na du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The existence of that is the nature of existence. The effect exists in smoke. Therefore, smoke is the effect of fire.

original: des na rnam pa 'dis ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba grub par bshad pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'dis ldog pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba grub par bshad pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that the pervasion is established by the reverse formulation.

original: me med na du ba med do zhes ldog pa smras na gor ma chag phar me las du ba 'byung ngo zhes rtogs pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: me med na du ba med do zhes ldog pa smras na gor ma chag phar me las du ba 'byung ngo zhes rtogs pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWhen there is no fire, there is no smoke,‚Äù then without a doubt, the understanding ‚ÄúSmoke comes from fire‚Äù arises.

original: des na ldog pa brjod pas me las du ba 'byung bar rtogs te /
analyzed: des na ldog pa brjod pas me las du ba 'byung bar rtogs te /
translated: Thus, by stating the contrapositive, one understands that smoke comes from fire.

original: shugs kyi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By implication, one understands the positive concomitance.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the reason were not stated in that way‚Äù means

original: me las du ba 'byung ba ma yin na ldog pa nyid mi 'grub po //
analyzed: me las du ba 'byung ba ma yin na ldog pa nyid mi 'grub po //
translated: if smoke did not come from fire, the contrapositive would not be established.

original: de grub pas ni de las phyung ba nyid du rtogs par byed la /
analyzed: de grub pas ni de las phyung ba nyid du rtogs par byed la /
translated: By establishing that, one causes the understanding that smoke comes from fire.

original: de las kyang shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
analyzed: de las kyang shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
translated: And from that, by implication, one understands the positive concomitance.

original: pha rol po dag gang zhig gang med na med do zhes rtogs pa des na de tsam gyis 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gang zhig gang med na med do zhes rtogs pa des na de tsam gyis 'brel pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the opponent does not understand the relation between the reason and the predicate just because he understands that when one thing does not exist, another thing does not exist,

original: rtag pa dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe permanent and the impermanent.‚Äù

original: nyan pa'i shes pa med pa las rtag pa'i don yod na mthong ba ni med de nam mkha' la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan pa'i shes pa med pa las rtag pa'i don yod na mthong ba ni med de nam mkha' la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the meaning of permanent existed from the absence of the cognition of hearing, then it would be seen, but it is not, because it does not exist in space.

original: des na 'di rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the effect of the permanent.

original: mi rtag pa la yang ma yin te bum pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la yang ma yin te bum pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it the effect of the impermanent, because it does not exist in a pot.

original: des na mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the effect of the impermanent.

original: des na nyan pa'i shes pa gnyi ga'i 'bras bu ma yin yang gnyi ga med na yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nyan pa'i shes pa gnyi ga'i 'bras bu ma yin yang gnyi ga med na yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although it is not the effect of both the permanent and the impermanent, it does not exist if either of them does not exist.

original: des na gang zhig gang med na med pa de tsam gyis gal te don gzhan yin na de de'i 'bras bu yin na nyan pa nyid rtag pa med pa bum pa la med pas na rtag pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang med na med pa de tsam gyis gal te don gzhan yin na de de'i 'bras bu yin na nyan pa nyid rtag pa med pa bum pa la med pas na rtag pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a different object from that which does not exist if it does not exist, then if it is the effect of that, hearing would be the effect of the permanent, because it does not exist if the permanent does not exist.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa med na nam mkha' la med pas mi rtag pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa med na nam mkha' la med pas mi rtag pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, it would be the effect of the impermanent, because it does not exist if the impermanent does not exist.

original: 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin mdo kyi de lta na yang de med na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu ma yin mdo kyi de lta na yang de med na med pa yin no //
translated: It is not the effect of the permanent or the impermanent, but it does not exist if either of them does not exist.

original: des na don gzhan da med na med pa tsam gyis ni de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa ma yin pas na de bzhin du me med na du ba med do zhes smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi 'thad par brjod pa yin no zhes de de ltar
analyzed: des na don gzhan da med na med pa tsam gyis ni de'i 'bras bur rtogs pa ma yin pas na de bzhin du me med na du ba med do zhes smras na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi 'thad par brjod pa yin no zhes de de ltar
translated: Therefore, if the other object does not exist, it is not understood to be the effect of that mere nonexistence. Thus, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIf fire does not exist, smoke does not exist,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe master DignƒÅga said that the object of hearing is characterized by the absence of an object.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du gsungs @114b ba'i phyir 'dir ldog pa 'brel pa mchon  par byed pa nyid du brjod pa la /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du gsungs @114b ba'i phyir 'dir ldog pa 'brel pa mchon  par byed pa nyid du brjod pa la /
translated: Here, the absence of an object is expressed as the sign that indicates the relation.

original: slob dpon gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gal te ldog pas 'brel pa go bar byed na 'di yang de bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gal te ldog pas 'brel pa go bar byed na 'di yang de bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa yin no //
translated: Following the system of the master, if the relation is understood through the absence of an object, then this is also understood in the same way.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir med pa nyid ma yin te zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir med pa nyid ma yin te zhes gsungs so ;
translated: To refute this, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it does not exist.‚Äù

original: / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don med na nyan pa nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don med na nyan pa nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: If the object of hearing is permanent or impermanent, it is not the case that it does not exist.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di la ni ldog pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni ldog pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the absence of an object is not established.

original: gal te yin na ni don gzhan nyid yin pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yin na ni don gzhan nyid yin pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If it were, then the difference in meaning would not be the effect.

original: ldog pa med do zhes ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ldog pa med do zhes ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How do you understand that there is no exclusion?

original: de las de dag nyid la zhes smos so //
analyzed: de las de dag nyid la zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom that, those very things.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom sgrub par byed pa ma nges pa nyid du nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mnyan par bya ba nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir the tshom sgrub par byed pa ma nges pa nyid du nye bar bkod do //
translated: The master has stated the uncertainty of the proof of doubt because the state of being heard is not common.

original: des na gal te 'di rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med na med pa yin la nyan pa'i shes pa de las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te 'di rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med na med pa yin la nyan pa'i shes pa de las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it is the case that the state of being heard is absent when permanence and impermanence are absent, then doubt about permanence and impermanence would not arise from that state of being heard.

original: de bshad pa ni de lta bu ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de lta bu ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúif it were not like that.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang med na zhes nges pa de yod pa ni da yod pa mtshon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin gyi the tshom gyi rgyur ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med na zhes nges pa de yod pa ni da yod pa mtshon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin gyi the tshom gyi rgyur ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is ascertained as ‚Äúif this is absent, that is absent‚Äù is a cause of doubt because it indicates the existence of what is present.

original: gal te gnyi ga med par yang med pa na de mtshon par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga med par yang med pa na de mtshon par byed pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it does not exist when both exist, then it would follow that it is the indicator of both.üîΩBut it is not possible for both to be one, and therefore it is doubtful.

original: gnyi ga gcig srid pa yang ma yin pa des na the tshom za ba yin no zhes de lta na ni 'o na gnyi ga med na med pa nyid ces bya bar ma grub pas ldog pa med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga gcig srid pa yang ma yin pa des na the tshom za ba yin no zhes de lta na ni 'o na gnyi ga med na med pa nyid ces bya bar ma grub pas ldog pa med do //
translated: If that is so, then since it is not established that it does not exist when both do not exist, it is not a negative.

original: 'o na 'di ji ltar slob dpon gyis ldog pa dang ldan par gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ji ltar slob dpon gyis ldog pa dang ldan par gsungs she na /
translated: Well, then, how is it that the master said that it is a negative?

original: yod par nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yod par nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIt is ascertained as existent.‚Äù

original: 'di rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las ldog par nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod kyi de med na med pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa'i don du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las ldog par nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir med do zhes brjod kyi de med na med pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa'i don du ma yin no //
translated: He said this in order to show that it is not ascertained as a negative of permanence or impermanence. He did not say that it is a negative of that, but that it is a negative of nonexistence.

original: gal te nam mkha' dang bum pa dag la mnyan pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' dang bum pa dag la mnyan pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, if space and a pot are not non-existent,

original: ji ltar de med pa la med pa nyid du ma nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de med pa la med pa nyid du ma nges she na /
translated: how is it that it is not ascertained that they are non-existent?

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa nyid du nges pa ni bden mod kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa nyid du nges pa ni bden mod kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is true that it is ascertained that sound does not exist in space, etc., but not that it is permanent or impermanent.

original: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag kyang de la med par nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag kyang de la med par nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not ascertained that sound does not exist as permanent or impermanent?

original: de yang bden mod kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir de la med pa yin nam 'on te sgra gcig pu'i chos @115a * //
analyzed: de yang bden mod kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir de la med pa yin nam 'on te sgra gcig pu'i chos @115a * //
translated: That is true, but is it ascertained that sound does not exist because it is permanent or impermanent, or is it ascertained that sound does not exist because it is not the common property of both?

original: ma yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes the tshom mi za'o //üîΩdes na sgra rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin zhes thun mong ma yin pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes the tshom mi za'o // des na sgra rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin zhes thun mong ma yin pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: There is no doubt that it is ascertained because it is not the common property of both.üîΩTherefore, it is not ascertained that sound is permanent or impermanent.üîΩBut is it not ascertained that sound exists, since it is heard?

original: yod pa bzhin du mnyan bya go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes rnam par nges pa'i rjes su 'brang bar gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa bzhin du mnyan bya go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes rnam par nges pa'i rjes su 'brang bar gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: This is the conclusion: it is ascertained that sound exists, but it is not ascertained that it is permanent or impermanent.

original: des na de ltar de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin yang nyan pa'i shes pa de'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ldog pas 'bras bu nyid du mtshon pa ma yin no zhes brjod la de la ldog pa nyid med par bshad do //
analyzed: des na de ltar de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin yang nyan pa'i shes pa de'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ldog pas 'bras bu nyid du mtshon pa ma yin no zhes brjod la de la ldog pa nyid med par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, although it is not the effect in that way, it is not indicated as the effect by the reverse, because it conforms to the cognition that hears it. And in that case, the reverse itself does not exist.

original: de med pa yang the tshom sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa yang the tshom sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that nonexistence is established by doubt.üîΩEven though there is nonapprehension of that nonexistence, there is no reverse, and how is that established by doubt?

original: de med pa la mi dmigs pa yod kyang ldog pa med cing de las ji ltar the tshom sgrub par byed pa yin zhes dogs pa la rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i
analyzed: de med pa la mi dmigs pa yod kyang ldog pa med cing de las ji ltar the tshom sgrub par byed pa yin zhes dogs pa la rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i
translated: Fearing that, in order to show that it is not established as permanent or impermanent, or as the state of cause and effect,

original: phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhen . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe'i bdag nyid gnyis yod pa las chos mi mthun pas zhes rjes thogs nyid du khyad par du ston pa'i phyir 'dir khyad par med kyang chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpe'i bdag nyid gnyis yod pa las chos mi mthun pas zhes rjes thogs nyid du khyad par du ston pa'i phyir 'dir khyad par med kyang chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the two kinds of example are presented immediately after the dissimilar example, the present example is not a dissimilar example, but rather a similar example.

original: gang gi tshe chos mthun pa'i dpes me dang du bdag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma grub na shugs 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos mthun pa'i dpes me dang du bdag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba nyid mi 'grub pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma grub na shugs 'grub par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When the similar example does not show that fire and smoke are the entities of cause and effect, then one cannot establish their concomitance, and if the entity is not established, how could the example establish it by implication?

original: gang gi shugs kyis 'phangs pa gang yin pa de ni de ma grub par mi grub po //
analyzed: gang gi shugs kyis 'phangs pa gang yin pa de ni de ma grub par mi grub po //
translated: That which is implied by implication is not established without establishing that.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa'i dpes me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa'i dpes me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, when the dissimilar example does not show that fire and smoke are the entities of cause and effect, then one cannot establish their nonconcomitance, so how could one remember their concomitance?

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di la brten nas bstan /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di la brten nas bstan /
translated: Why is it taught in dependence on that?

original: gang gi phyir 'di la 'bras bu ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni de lta ma yin na don gzhan de dang 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir bshad zin la de bzhin du ldog pa med pa yang de lta ma yin na de med
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la 'bras bu ma yin na rjes su 'gro ba med pa ni de lta ma yin na don gzhan de dang 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir bshad zin la de bzhin du ldog pa med pa yang de lta ma yin na de med
translated: Because if it is not an effect, it is not concomitant with it. If it is not concomitant with it, then it is not related to it in any other way.

original: na ci ste yod par mi 'gyur zhes bshad zin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: na ci ste yod par mi 'gyur zhes bshad zin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is not a non-observation, then if it does not exist when that does not exist, why would it not be nonexistent?

original: lha rnams dga' bas skabs mi shes so //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' bas skabs mi shes so //
translated: The gods are pleased, but do not understand the occasion.

original: nyan pa'i shes pa nyid la 'bras bu nyid med pa kho nas ldog pa med par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa'i shes pa nyid la 'bras bu nyid med pa kho nas ldog pa med par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said that the mere cognition of sound is not a non-observation, because it is not an effect.

original: gal te ded la brten pa nyid kyis ci'i phyir ma brjod /
analyzed: gal te ded la brten pa nyid kyis ci'i phyir ma brjod /
translated: If you ask, why is it not said that it is a non-observation because it is dependent on sound?

original: gzhi gzhan @115b la gnas par brjod pa ci bya zhes rtsod na /
analyzed: gzhi gzhan @115b la gnas par brjod pa ci bya zhes rtsod na /
translated: What is the point of saying that it is based on another basis?

original: de la 'dir brjod pa rjes su 'gro ldog dang ldan par rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na de med par bstan pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa de 'ba' zhig gi thabs can de med na mi 'byung
analyzed: de la 'dir brjod pa rjes su 'gro ldog dang ldan par rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na de med par bstan pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa de 'ba' zhig gi thabs can de med na mi 'byung
translated: Here, the reason that is endowed with forward and reverse pervasion is also the method for ascertaining the forward and reverse pervasions by teaching that if the entity of cause and effect does not exist, it does not exist.

original: ba yin pa'i phyir nyan pa'i shas pa nyid don gzhan yin pa na 'bras bu nyid du ma nges pa kho nas ldog pa med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba yin pa'i phyir nyan pa'i shas pa nyid don gzhan yin pa na 'bras bu nyid du ma nges pa kho nas ldog pa med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the mere cognition of hearing is not ascertained as the effect, the reverse pervasion would not exist.üîΩThus, the three types of reasons are endowed with the three modes.

original: des na de ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum nyid tshul gsum dang ldan ba yin no zhes gzhung gzugs par bya ba 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis gnyis bsgrubs nas gsum pa yang de'i rtsa ba can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum nyid tshul gsum dang ldan ba yin no zhes gzhung gzugs par bya ba 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis gnyis bsgrubs nas gsum pa yang de'i rtsa ba can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having established the two by means of the two types of relations, in order to teach that the third is also based on those two,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúbecause‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag ces mdor smos pa de'i phyir gyi sgra'i 'brel pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag ces mdor smos pa de'i phyir gyi sgra'i 'brel pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, in order to establish the connection of the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù in the brief statement ‚Äúbecause of cause and nature,‚Äù

original: dpes rang bzhin 'brel pa 'di kho na rab tu ston pa yin gyi bya ba gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba rgyu gzhan med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dpes rang bzhin 'brel pa 'di kho na rab tu ston pa yin gyi bya ba gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba rgyu gzhan med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis connection is shown by the example, and there is no other action.‚Äù He is saying that there is no other cause.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa yang de ltar mthong ba'i phyir de med na mi 'byung ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa yang de ltar mthong ba'i phyir de med na mi 'byung ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the connection of nature is not merely a case of invariable concomitance, he says,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äúas it is seen in the case of what has been explained.‚Äù

original: de gang gi don du bstan pa gang gis 'dir brjod ma thag pa de rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gang gi don du bstan pa gang gis 'dir brjod ma thag pa de rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the purpose of that is the cause, he says,

original: gcig yod na zhes smos te sgrub par byed pa yod na gzhan zhes bya ba bsgrub bya rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig yod na zhes smos te sgrub par byed pa yod na gzhan zhes bya ba bsgrub bya rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one exists, the other is established.‚Äù When the proof exists, the other, i.e., the probandum, is established.

original: de lta na yang don 'di skabs su babs pa'i don gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de rab tu grub pa la gtan tshigs bshad pa ni de med na zhas bya ba ste bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang don 'di skabs su babs pa'i don gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de rab tu grub pa la gtan tshigs bshad pa ni de med na zhas bya ba ste bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, since this is not the meaning of the present context, the reason for establishing that is stated: ‚Äúbecause if that does not exist, this does not exist,‚Äù because if the probandum does not exist, the proof is impossible.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa ste /
translated: The reason is that cause and essence do not exist.

original: skyed par byed pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa na /
translated: When the producer and the pervader are not observed,

original: 'ga' zhig dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i yang gtan tshigs yin te bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i yang gtan tshigs yin te bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: the reason is also a proof of a negation, which is the probandum.

original: dgongs pa 'di yin te gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na de med na ldog pa'i phyir gzhan yod na gzhan yod pa yin pa des na 'di ji ltar bsgrub pa'i yan lag yin pa de bzhin dgag pa la yang yin te @116a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di yin te gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na de med na ldog pa'i phyir gzhan yod na gzhan yod pa yin pa des na 'di ji ltar bsgrub pa'i yan lag yin pa de bzhin dgag pa la yang yin te @116a * //
translated: The intended meaning is this: Because if the relation of essence exists, if that does not exist, it is reversed. If the other exists, the other exists. Therefore, just as it is a part of the proof, in the same way, it is also a negation,

original: ldog na ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog na ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is reversed, it is reversed.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rtsa bas med par 'gyur na yod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rtsa bas med par 'gyur na yod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the root of natural relation did not exist, then it would not exist.

original: des na ldog na ldog par byed pa rang bzhin 'brel pa yin pa des na dpes nye bar bstan pa na gtan tshigs kyi yan lag ma yin yang gang zhig dgag par 'dod pa de bkag pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa la brten pa kho nas rtogs pa
analyzed: des na ldog na ldog par byed pa rang bzhin 'brel pa yin pa des na dpes nye bar bstan pa na gtan tshigs kyi yan lag ma yin yang gang zhig dgag par 'dod pa de bkag pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa la brten pa kho nas rtogs pa
translated: Therefore, when the negation is reversed, the reversal is due to natural relation. Thus, when the example is demonstrated, although it is not a part of the logical reason, the negation of that which is to be negated is understood solely in dependence on natural relation.

original: yin no // ji ltar gang zhig gang du rang bzhin 'brel pa ldog na 'brel pa'i yul gyi don nye bar gnas pa las mi 'da' pas na de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa'i rten log na yang 'brel pa log pa'i
analyzed: yin no // ji ltar gang zhig gang du rang bzhin 'brel pa ldog na 'brel pa'i yul gyi don nye bar gnas pa las mi 'da' pas na de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa'i rten log na yang 'brel pa log pa'i
translated: Just as when something is related to something else by natural relation, if the relation is reversed, then the object of the relation does not pass beyond the domain of the thing that is related to it, and thus the logical reason that proves it has a root in relation. In the same way, when the basis of the relation is reversed, the relation is also reversed.

original: phyir de log pas 'brel pa ldog pa rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyir de log pas 'brel pa ldog pa rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, by the reversal of that, the reversal of the relation is understood.

original: 'brel pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That relation is of two types:

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of identity and the nature of origination.

original: des na ji ltar gtan tshigs gnyis yin pa de bzhin du de'i rtsa ba can gyi dgag pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: des na ji ltar gtan tshigs gnyis yin pa de bzhin du de'i rtsa ba can gyi dgag pa yang rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, just as there are two kinds of reason, so too there are only two kinds of negation that are based on them.

original: khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: They are the negation of the pervaded and the negation of the cause.

original: des na de ltar gnyis 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can du bshad pa de bzhin du gsum pa yang yin no //üîΩ'di nyid 'chad pa ni 'brel pa'i yul rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag kho na ldog pa na rang dang 'brel pa 'bras bu dang khyab bya zlog par byed pas gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de ltar gnyis 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can du bshad pa de bzhin du gsum pa yang yin no // 'di nyid 'chad pa ni 'brel pa'i yul rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de dag kho na ldog pa na rang dang 'brel pa 'bras bu dang khyab bya zlog par byed pas gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, just as the two are explained as being based on the relation, so too is the third.üîΩThis is explained as follows: When those very objects of the relation, the cause and the pervader, are negated, the relation with the effect and the pervaded are also negated.

original: 'dis ni skabs su bab pa ji ltar gtan tshigs nyid du nye ba sbyor ba de bstan nas de nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs la yang ston pa ni don 'ga' zhig dgag pa la yang bsgrub par 'dod pas rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa dang 'brel pa ni
analyzed: 'dis ni skabs su bab pa ji ltar gtan tshigs nyid du nye ba sbyor ba de bstan nas de nyid dgag pa'i gtan tshigs la yang ston pa ni don 'ga' zhig dgag pa la yang bsgrub par 'dod pas rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa dang 'brel pa ni
translated: This shows how the reason is applied in the present context. It also shows that the reason for the negation is that the proponent of the negation wishes to prove that the object is absent. The relation with the cause or the pervader is negated.

original: rang bzhin ldog pa gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ldog pa gtan tshigs su brjod par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the pervasion is to be stated as the reason.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu khyab par bya ba dag der rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir gal te yang ldog pa dag la 'brel pa med pa de lta na yang 'di 'brel pa'i rtsa bas go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos pos mi 'khrul par grub pa
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu khyab par bya ba dag der rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir gal te yang ldog pa dag la 'brel pa med pa de lta na yang 'di 'brel pa'i rtsa bas go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos pos mi 'khrul par grub pa
translated: Thus, the pervasion of the effect is related to the nature of the pervader. Even if the two negations are unrelated, still, because of the root of the relation, the relation of the object to be understood and the understanding is established without error.

original: kho na'o // 'brel pa med na ni ji ltar gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: kho na'o // 'brel pa med na ni ji ltar gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed /
translated: If there is no relation, how can the negation of one thing establish the negation of another?

original: des na de ltar 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bzhin du @116b dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bzhin du @116b dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, just as there are two kinds of affirmative reasons, there are also two kinds of negative reasons, because of the two kinds of relations.

original: des na gtso bo'i sbyor ba la ltos nas mi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gtso bo'i sbyor ba la ltos nas mi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there are two kinds of non-observation, depending on the principal application.

original: de ltar yang nus pa ma yin te 'di gnyis phan tshun rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir gcig nyid du ma grub pas gtan tshigs rnam pa bzhir thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang nus pa ma yin te 'di gnyis phan tshun rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir gcig nyid du ma grub pas gtan tshigs rnam pa bzhir thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for them to be like that, because these two do not mutually follow, and since they are not established as one, it follows that there are four types of reason.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin mi dmigs par ni 'di gnyi ga yang bstan par nus pa des na /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin mi dmigs par ni 'di gnyi ga yang bstan par nus pa des na /
translated: As explained above, both of these can be shown to be non-observation of essence.

original: de yang gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de yang gtso bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that to be the primary one, he says:

original: dmigs par ni rigs ldan de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i dgag par bya ba de mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes 'brel pa brjod pa'o //üîΩgnyi ga bsdus pa'i don tu gnyi gar yang /
