analyzed: dmigs par ni rigs ldan de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i dgag par bya ba de mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes 'brel pa brjod pa'o // gnyi ga bsdus pa'i don tu gnyi gar yang /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-observation of that object of negation, which is the object of the mind that is the opposite of the object of observation, is a reason for negation.‚Äù This is the connection.

original: yang gi sgra sbyar te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the two being included in the second is that the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is applied to both.

original: yang ji ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs par yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes 'brel par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rang bzhin mi dmigs par yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes 'brel par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the non-observation of essence is a correct reason?

original: de ston pa ni dgag pa'i yul can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ston pa ni dgag pa'i yul can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To teach that, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of the mind that is the opposite of the object of observation‚Äù and so forth.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dgag pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-apprehension itself establishes the negation.

original: de lta na 'o na dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sgra'i don de'i yul can gyis tha snyad kyi don yin pa des na rgyu dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba der rjes su 'gro ba 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kyi sgra'i don de'i yul can gyis tha snyad kyi don yin pa des na rgyu dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba der rjes su 'gro ba 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the meaning of the word ‚Äúnegation‚Äù as a logical reason is the object of the expression ‚Äúnon-apprehension of the cause and the pervader,‚Äù and so the pervasion is contradicted.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained: ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader is the logical reason for both negation and the expression ‚Äònegation.‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang zhig snga ma dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ba 'dir dgag pa'i sgras tha snyad brjod pa'am gang gis phyi ma dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ba med pa nyid brjod pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa'i yul can gyi rtogsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te gang zhig snga ma dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ba 'dir dgag pa'i sgras tha snyad brjod pa'am gang gis phyi ma dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ba med pa nyid brjod pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa'i yul can gyi rtogsüîΩpa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: The word ‚Äúnegation‚Äù is not used here to express a negation that is not related to what precedes it, nor does it express non-existence that is not related to what follows it. Rather, it is a cognition that has non-existence as its object.

original: des na rang bzhin mi dmigs par med pa sgrub par byed pa bkag pa'i phyir rtogs pa tsam gyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin mi dmigs par med pa sgrub par byed pa bkag pa'i phyir rtogs pa tsam gyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-observation of essential nature is refuted as a proof of non-existence, it is merely a realization.

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos su na mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis dngos su na mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, as explained, there are three types of non-observation in actuality.

original: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis lkog tu gyur pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir gnyis gtso bo yin no //üîΩrang bzhin @117a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kyis lkog tu gyur pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir gnyis gtso bo yin no // rang bzhin @117a * //
translated: Since the non-existence of the imperceptible is realized by just the two types of non-observation through the two types of relation, those two are primary.

original: mi dmigs pa la ni med pa mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ni med pa mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: In the non-observation of essential nature, non-existence is directly perceived.

original: 'on kyang der de gnyis kyang khongs su bsdu ba'i gzhi yin pas gtso bor bgrang ba kho na ste des na mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang der de gnyis kyang khongs su bsdu ba'i gzhi yin pas gtso bor bgrang ba kho na ste des na mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
translated: However, since those two are also included in that, they are counted as primary, and therefore there are only three types of non-observation proofs.

original: gal te rnam pa gsum kho na yin na sngar dbye ba gzhan du yang bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gsum kho na yin na sngar dbye ba gzhan du yang bstan ce na /
translated: If there are only three types, why were other divisions taught previously?

original: bshad pa rnam pa gsum yin yang rnam pa du mar bshad do //
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gsum yin yang rnam pa du mar bshad do //
translated: Although there are three types, they are explained in many ways.

original: gal te rnam pa gsum nyid rnam pa du ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum nyid bshad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gsum nyid rnam pa du ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum nyid bshad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the three aspects are many aspects, then wouldn‚Äôt the three aspects be explained?

original: rnam pa gsum rnam pa du mar zhes brjod pa na de nyid brjod par 'gyur ba bden mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum rnam pa du mar zhes brjod pa na de nyid brjod par 'gyur ba bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that if one says ‚Äúthe three aspects are many aspects,‚Äù then that is explained.

original: rnam pa gsum yin yang mi dmigs pa rnam pa du ma yin no zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yin yang mi dmigs pa rnam pa du ma yin no zhes brjod pa na /
translated: But if one says ‚Äúalthough there are three aspects, non-observation is many aspects,‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam pa rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: then one would only understand the aspects that are other than that.

original: de bshad pa ni de dang de 'gal la sogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de dang de 'gal la sogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúcontradictory and so on.‚Äù

original: de ma rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag dang de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag dang de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: It is by the specific application of not understanding that and by the specific application of understanding that which is contradictory to it.

original: gang dag ma dmigs pas med par 'grub par brjod pa rgyu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag ni 'dir de ma rtogs pa'i sgras bstan la 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa ni rtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag ma dmigs pas med par 'grub par brjod pa rgyu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag ni 'dir de ma rtogs pa'i sgras bstan la 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa ni rtogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those non-observations that are said to establish non-existence, such as the non-observation of a cause, are indicated here by the word ‚Äúnot understanding that.‚Äù The observation of a contradiction and so on are understanding and so on.

original: gang rtogs pas med par rtogs pa de dag las gcig bstan pas gzhan yongs su bzung ba'i don du 'dis sogs pa'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: gang rtogs pas med par rtogs pa de dag las gcig bstan pas gzhan yongs su bzung ba'i don du 'dis sogs pa'i sgra yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that one of those which is understood as nonexistent through understanding something else is understood as nonexistent through understanding something else.

original: gang ma rtogs pas med par rtogs pa de ni 'ga' zhig brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ci yang byar med do //üîΩ'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni gtso bor rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: gang ma rtogs pas med par rtogs pa de ni 'ga' zhig brjod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ci yang byar med do // 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni gtso bor rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are not used to indicate anything else which is understood as nonexistent through not understanding something else, because that is not expressed.üîΩThe words ‚ÄúThe reason for negation‚Äù indicate the following:

original: ji skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: The reason for negation is just the three kinds of reasons which have been explained.

original: de ltar gyi sgra 'chad pas de dag nyid rang gi ngo bos ston te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra 'chad pas de dag nyid rang gi ngo bos ston te /
translated: The words ‚Äúin that way‚Äù indicate those very reasons by their nature.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang rang gi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the nonobservation of a cause, the nonobservation of a pervader, and the nonobservation of itself.

original: de dag kyang so sor dmigs su yod pa ste gzhan du na dngos po med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang so sor dmigs su yod pa ste gzhan du na dngos po med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also individually observed, because otherwise the nonexistence of a thing would not be established.

original: de ltar nges pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig la 'dren pa can rtogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur par rtogs pa 'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig la 'dren pa can rtogs pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur par rtogs pa 'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù is the realization of the characteristic of the object of knowledge in the single cognition.

original: tshig le 'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma bshad @117b pa'i phyir de ni zhes smos te de dang de 'gal la sogs pa rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dbye ba'i sgo nas zhes bya bas ni 'dir ji ltar gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa de ston to //
analyzed: tshig le 'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma bshad @117b pa'i phyir de ni zhes smos te de dang de 'gal la sogs pa rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dbye ba'i sgo nas zhes bya bas ni 'dir ji ltar gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa de ston to //
translated: In order to explain the second half of the verse, he says, ‚ÄúThat is to say, the realization and non-realization of the contradictory, etc., are distinguished.‚Äù Here, it is shown that whatever is related to something is included in that.

original: de ma rtogs pa ni rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa ni rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-realization of that is the non-apprehension of the cause, etc.

original: de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the contradictory of that is the apprehension of the contradictory.

original: sogs pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra'i don brjod pa ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is stated as ‚Äúthe realization of the effect of the contradictory, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du gang zhig gang gi khongs su 'du bar bstan pa de ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du gang zhig gang gi khongs su 'du bar bstan pa de ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Here, the three kinds of syllogism have been shown, and it has been shown in what category each falls.

original: des sbyor ba rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid rnam pa du mar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des sbyor ba rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid rnam pa du mar brjod pa yin no //
translated: This very three-fold division is expressed in many ways.

original: gal te sngar ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa rang rgyud du bstan gyi ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dbye ba rnam pa gsum las gang rung zhig gis rnam par dbye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngar ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa rang rgyud du bstan gyi ji ltar nye bar bstan pa dbye ba rnam pa gsum las gang rung zhig gis rnam par dbye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If previously the observation of a contradictory nature was taught as autonomous, then as taught, it is not a division of any one of the three types.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni sngar rang rgyud du ma yin par bstan la /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni sngar rang rgyud du ma yin par bstan la /
translated: The non-observation of the pervader was previously taught as not autonomous,

original: 'dir ni rang rgyud du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang rgyud du bstan te /
translated: but here it is taught as autonomous.

original: des na ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: So how is there no contradiction?

original: brjod pa dbye ba mtha' dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir 'dir 'brel pa bstan pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa na 'brel pa la rtag dbang du bstan pas de ltar bstan pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: brjod pa dbye ba mtha' dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir 'dir 'brel pa bstan pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa na 'brel pa la rtag dbang du bstan pas de ltar bstan pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Because the entire division is included within the non-observation of a nature, when it is taught here for the sake of showing the connection, it is taught in terms of the connection being constant, so there is no contradiction in the teaching.

original: des na // 'gal dang 'bras bu dag grub dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa ni de dag khongs su bsdu ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na // 'gal dang 'bras bu dag grub dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyor ba'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa ni de dag khongs su bsdu ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the fourfold division of syllogisms, such as ‚Äúthe establishment of the contradictory and the effect,‚Äù is included in these three, because they are the basis of the division.

original: sbyor ba gzhan khongs su 'du ba can de dag kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan khongs su 'du ba can de dag kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du'o //
translated: And these other syllogisms are included in the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: 'dir ni 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis bkod la dngos po med pa mngon sum du byas pa ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir gnyis bkod la dngos po med pa mngon sum du byas pa ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: Here, in order to show the connection, two are set forth, and the third is the actualization of the non-existence of the thing.

original: thams cad khongs su 'du ba'i gzhi yin ba'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum du 'grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad khongs su 'du ba'i gzhi yin ba'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum du 'grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis of the inclusion of all, the three kinds of reasons are established as the cause.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa can kho na'o//
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa can kho na'o//
translated: And the apprehension of the contradictory is only the root of the relation of cause and effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang 'gal bar grub pa 'di yang khongs su rgyu ma grub pa zhes rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa rgyu mi dmigs pa khongs su 'dus par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang 'gal bar grub pa 'di yang khongs su rgyu ma grub pa zhes rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa rgyu mi dmigs pa khongs su 'dus par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, this is also included in the non-establishment of the reason, and the observation of a contradictory effect of the reason is included in the non-observation of the reason.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes @118a * //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro // des na de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes @118a * //
translated: If it were not so, it would be explained as the observation of a contradiction.

original: su dpag par rtags kyi sbyor ba rnam pa 'di gsum kho na yin pas rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ni de nyid du nye bar bsdu bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: su dpag par rtags kyi sbyor ba rnam pa 'di gsum kho na yin pas rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ni de nyid du nye bar bsdu bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these three kinds of application of the reason in an inference for oneself are the only ones. Therefore, it is reasonable to include the definition of an inference for oneself in just those.

original: des na de ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i tshul gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir der 'du ba'i rgyu rang bzhin 'brel pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i tshul gsum du 'dus pa'i phyir der 'du ba'i rgyu rang bzhin 'brel pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since the three modes are included in the definition of a reason, the nature of the reason is taught to be the relation of inclusion.

original: de la yang mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir gnyis nyid du lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir gnyis nyid du lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the non-observation is included in the natural reason, there are only two kinds of reason.

original: des na tshul gsum don dam par gnyis su gyur pa'i gsum du bsdus pa'i phyir 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: des na tshul gsum don dam par gnyis su gyur pa'i gsum du bsdus pa'i phyir 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the three modes are included in the two valid cognitions, the relationship is said to be only of two kinds.

original: 'on te tshul gsum tsam gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin na de gsum du nye bar bsdu bas ci dgos /
analyzed: 'on te tshul gsum tsam gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid yin na de gsum du nye bar bsdu bas ci dgos /
translated: But if the mere three modes are the definition of a reason, then what is the point of subsuming them into three?

original: gsal ba gsum du bstan pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba gsum du bstan pa'o zhe na /
translated: They are taught as three modes.

original: gal te gsal ba gsum kho na de lta bur gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba gsum kho na de lta bur gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the three modes are just like that,

original: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa kho nas de ltar rtogs pas na grangs kyis ci bya /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa kho nas de ltar rtogs pas na grangs kyis ci bya /
translated: then since one understands them in that way by possessing that definition, what is the point of counting them?üîΩBut if the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.

original: 'on te gzhan la yang mtshan nyid de yod pa nyid na bgrangs kyang de mi spongs so zhes dogs pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩnges pa ni nges par byed pa las yin par 'thad do //üîΩnges pa yang med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la yang mtshan nyid de yod pa nyid na bgrangs kyang de mi spongs so zhes dogs pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // nges pa ni nges par byed pa las yin par 'thad do // nges pa yang med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: If the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.üîΩIf the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: If the definition exists in other things, then even if one counts them, one does not eliminate them.

original: med na mi 'byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba yang yin la /
translated: It is also a necessary relation.

original: nges pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a necessary relation.

original: gzhan yang nges pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges pa med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is a necessary relation because it is not a relation of non-existence.

original: med na bshad do //
analyzed: med na bshad do //
translated: It is explained as a necessary relation.

original: med na mi 'byung ba yang rjes su 'gro ldog nyid de /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba yang rjes su 'gro ldog nyid de /
translated: A necessary relation is just the relation of forward pervasion and reverse pervasion.

original: ji skad du med na mi 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du med na mi 'byung ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúA necessary relation is the pervasion that has been explained.‚Äù

original: rnges su 'gro ba ni nges pa'i bdag nyid kho na ste de lta ma yin na sgrub byed yod na bsgrub bya yod pa'i nges pa ma grub pas bsgrub bya rtogs par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rnges su 'gro ba ni nges pa'i bdag nyid kho na ste de lta ma yin na sgrub byed yod na bsgrub bya yod pa'i nges pa ma grub pas bsgrub bya rtogs par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Forward pervasion is just the nature of a necessary relation. Otherwise, if the existence of the probandum were not established when the evidence exists, then the probandum would not be understood.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa yang nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa yang nges pa kho na ste /
translated: Similarly, reverse pervasion is just a necessary relation.

original: de nyid la khyab par bya ba yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la khyab par bya ba yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion is just the existence of the probandum in the evidence.

original: des na nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi med na mi 'byung ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi med na mi 'byung ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, a necessary relation that has the nature of a necessary relation is just forward pervasion and reverse pervasion.

original: de ni nges par byed pa kho na las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nges par byed pa kho na las 'gyur ro //
translated: It is just from the establishment of a necessary relation that it is ascertained.

original: nges par byed pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te me'i rgyun du ba'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: nges par byed pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te me'i rgyun du ba'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: and the reason is the entity of cause and effect.

original: du ba yod na yod par mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / gzhan @118b las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba yod na yod par mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / gzhan @118b las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir de med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stream of smoke projects the stream of fire, and because when there is smoke there is no error that fire exists, and because it does not occur from another, it does not exist when that does not exist.

original: rang bzhin yang res par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang res par byed pa yin te /
translated: And the nature is the reason,

original: chos de chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pas de yod pa na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pas de yod pa na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that exists, it exists, and because when it does not exist, it does not exist, that is, because the pervasion and the counter pervasion are established.

original: nges na nges par byed pa la brtan nas nges pa yin pa des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bdag kho na las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nges na nges par byed pa la brtan nas nges pa yin pa des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bdag kho na las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it is ascertained, it is ascertained on the basis of the reason, and because of that, it is ascertained. Therefore, it is only from the nature of that and from that that the pervasion and the counter pervasion occur.

original: nges par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nges pa yin mod /
analyzed: nges par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nges pa yin mod /
translated: It is certainly the case that ascertainment is due to the reason.

original: 'di rtogs pa ni rang 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rtogs pa ni rang 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: The realization of this is based on the realization of the apprehension of itself.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu'i rgyu mtshan can ni gang gi tshe rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa de'i tshe rang 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa la yin no //üîΩde'i 'bras bu nyid kyis du ba me la nges pa ni mngon sum kho na ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rgyu'i rgyu mtshan can ni gang gi tshe rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa de'i tshe rang 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa la yin no // de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis du ba me la nges pa ni mngon sum kho na ste /
translated: When the nature of the effect is the reason for the cause, it is realized by its own nature, and at that time it is based on the realization of the apprehension of itself.

original: de yod na me yod par rtogs pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du me med na yod par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na me yod par rtogs pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du me med na yod par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ascertainment of fire by smoke is only by perception, because of the realization that when there is smoke there is fire, and because of the realization that when there is no fire there is no smoke.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyis 'di yod na de yod pa dang / de med na 'di ldog pa yin la de ni mngon sum kho nas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyis 'di yod na de yod pa dang / de med na 'di ldog pa yin la de ni mngon sum kho nas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: By the mere fact of being the effect, the existence of that is ascertained by the existence of this, and the cessation of that is ascertained by the cessation of this, and that is realized only by perception.

original: de bzhin du sha pa yang de'i bdag nyid kho nas shing la nges pa yin la nges par yang mngon sum kho nas rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha pa yang de'i bdag nyid kho nas shing la nges pa yin la nges par yang mngon sum kho nas rtogs so //
translated: In the same way, the ascertainment of tree by ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is only by the identity of the two, and the ascertainment is realized only by perception.

original: des na gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa dang gang gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni yod dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa dang gang gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni yod dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since whatever is the effect of something and whatever is the nature of something must follow existence and nonexistence,üîΩthere is no other valid cognition that can comprehend a thing that endures.

original: gnas pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan kho na yin no zhes dogs pa la de'i yul can gyi tshad ma gzhan sel ba ni ma mthong ba las min zhes bya bas ni ldog pa'i rtogs pa bsal te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dngos po rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan kho na yin no zhes dogs pa la de'i yul can gyi tshad ma gzhan sel ba ni ma mthong ba las min zhes bya bas ni ldog pa'i rtogs pa bsal te /
translated: In order to dispel the apprehension of the reverse, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not from the nonperception of the object of that valid cognition.‚Äù

original: mthong las min zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong las min zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: In order to dispel the apprehension of the forward pervasion, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not from perception.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te 'dir go bar byed pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te 'dir go bar byed pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: Here, the occasion for the branches of understanding is the forward pervasion and the reverse pervasion.

original: de dag gtan tshigs shes pa'i yan lag ma yin na ni dngos por gnas pa tsam du bstan pa dom med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag gtan tshigs shes pa'i yan lag ma yin na ni dngos por gnas pa tsam du bstan pa dom med pa kho na'o //
translated: If those are not branches of understanding the reason, then the mere statement of the thing that endures is completely pointless.

original: de dag rang gi rgyu'i dbang gi bdag nyid grub pa yin yang de ltar rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin te /üîΩrnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po 'di'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin no zhes rnam par gzhag @119a * //
analyzed: de dag rang gi rgyu'i dbang gi bdag nyid grub pa yin yang de ltar rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid bstan par bya ba yin te / rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po 'di'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin no zhes rnam par gzhag @119a * //
translated: Although they are established by the power of their cause, the valid knowledge that causes the realization of that is what is to be taught.üîΩWhat is the point of teaching the meaning that is not a part of the presentation, ‚ÄúThe reason for this thing that has this type of aspect is this‚Äù?

original: pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i don bstan pas ci bya dngos po dpyod pa ni de bstan par bya ba yin gyis rjes su dpag pa'i yan lag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i don bstan pas ci bya dngos po dpyod pa ni de bstan par bya ba yin gyis rjes su dpag pa'i yan lag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: The analysis of the thing is what is to be taught, but it is not a part of the inference.

original: des na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa'i tshad ma can kho na 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa'i tshad ma can kho na 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the invariable relation that is the reason for the relation is only the invariable relation that is the evidence for the relation that is set forth.

original: 'di ltar du ba dang me yod pa dang med par rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum tsam gyis ni med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba dang me yod pa dang med par rtogs par byed pa'i mngon sum tsam gyis ni med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid kyis te /
translated: In this way, the mere direct perception that causes the realization of the existence and nonexistence of fire and smoke does not ascertain the invariable relation, but rather it is by the effect.

original: thams cad du de ltar yin par mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de med par skabs kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du de ltar yin par mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de med par skabs kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not directly perceived that it is so in all cases, and because there is no proof that it is so in the absence of that.

original: de bzhin sha pa zhes de ltar rtogs pa 'di ci yod zhes rnam par dpyod pa na gang gi tshe khyad par can gyi dbyibs rtogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin sha pa zhes de ltar rtogs pa 'di ci yod zhes rnam par dpyod pa na gang gi tshe khyad par can gyi dbyibs rtogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one analyzes, thinking, ‚ÄúWhat is this that is understood as a tree?‚Äù and understands the particular shape,

original: sha pa 'di ni shing gi rnag bzhin nyid do zhes rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sha pa 'di ni shing gi rnag bzhin nyid do zhes rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: one understands that this tree is just like the trunk of a tree.

original: ji ltar rtags rtogs pa bzung ba dag la chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rnam par dpyad par nus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags rtogs pa bzung ba dag la chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rnam par dpyad par nus pa kho na ste /
translated: The nature of things can be analyzed only in regard to those things that are grasped as being understood through signs.

original: dper na skad cig ma zhes bya bar ldog pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa dang / nus pa zhes bya ba dbyibs dang / dkar po zhes bya ba gzugs su rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma zhes bya bar ldog pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa dang / nus pa zhes bya ba dbyibs dang / dkar po zhes bya ba gzugs su rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one understands the nature of something called ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù as having the nature of cessation, one understands the nature of something called ‚Äúpotential‚Äù as shape, and one understands the nature of something called ‚Äúwhite‚Äù as form.

original: des na ji ltar dkar po'i dkar po nyid yin pas der 'khrul pa med pa de bzhin du shad pa nyid kyang shing la mi 'khrul te sha pa nyid bzhin no zhes 'di gnyi ga yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dkar po'i dkar po nyid yin pas der 'khrul pa med pa de bzhin du shad pa nyid kyang shing la mi 'khrul te sha pa nyid bzhin no zhes 'di gnyi ga yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the whiteness of a white object is not mistaken with regard to that object, in the same way, the explanation of a tree is not mistaken with regard to a tree, just like the explanation of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.üîΩTherefore, since the three modes exist in the proof of that and the reason exists for understanding that, in order to explain that, the three modes are subsumed in that.üîΩMoreover, since the reason exists for the existence of that and the understanding of that, the three modes exist in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩHowever, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.

original: des na gang las gsum la tshul gsum yod pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsum nyid la de nye bar bsdus so //
analyzed: des na gang las gsum la tshul gsum yod pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsum nyid la de nye bar bsdus so //
translated: Moreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.

original: de la yang de yod pa dang rtogs pa dag gi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum yod mod /üîΩgzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba des na de ni rnam pa gsum nyid ces bya ba'i nges pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang de yod pa dang rtogs pa dag gi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum yod mod / gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba des na de ni rnam pa gsum nyid ces bya ba'i nges pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Moreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.

original: gzhan du zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes smos so //
translated: Moreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.üîΩMoreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in the three modes.

original: ngi ltar bshad pa'i nges par byed pa med na /
analyzed: ngi ltar bshad pa'i nges par byed pa med na /
translated: Moreover, since the three modes exist in the three modes, the three modes are subsumed in

original: tha dad pa gzhan don tha dad pa gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gnag yin pa ste de las rang gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med na ci ste med /
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan don tha dad pa gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gnag yin pa ste de las rang gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med na ci ste med /
translated: If it does not exist, how could it exist?

original: des na ji ltar yod pa des pa yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar yod pa des pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how could it exist in that way?

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa phenomenon that is the basis for something else‚Äù

original: de yod pa tsam dang rjes @119b su 'brel pa nyid med par brjod do //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam dang rjes @119b su 'brel pa nyid med par brjod do //
translated: indicates that it is not merely the existence of that, nor is it just the mere relation.

original: des na 'di tha dad par gyur pas de'i bdag nyid med do //
analyzed: des na 'di tha dad par gyur pas de'i bdag nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is different, it does not have the nature of that.

original: gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid med na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid med na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike a cloth and dye‚Äù indicates that if it does not have the nature of that, then it is not definitely existent.

original: 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las kyang gzhan du gyur pa yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na gzhan dag dang nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par bstan pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid kyang med
analyzed: 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las kyang gzhan du gyur pa yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na gzhan dag dang nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par bstan pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid kyang med
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúfrom something else‚Äù indicates that it is different from the nature of the relation. Therefore, if there is no relation of cause and effect, then it is not the case that other things definitely exist. The demonstration that there is no nature of difference shows that it does not have the nature of that.

original: pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med pa yang brjod par nus mod kyi /
analyzed: pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med pa yang brjod par nus mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to say that it does not have the nature of that.

original: de lta na yang tha dad pa med pa tsam nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos gcig gi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad pa med pa tsam nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos gcig gi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is not just the mere absence of difference, but rather it is the nature of a single phenomenon.

original: des na de med par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid de ltar brjod de /
analyzed: des na de med par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid de ltar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, it is stated in that way.

original: de yod tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the mere existence and the subsequent connection that impel.

original: yang na gzhan du zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las tha dad par brjod pa yin te ;
analyzed: yang na gzhan du zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las tha dad par brjod pa yin te ;
translated: Or, by ‚Äúelsewhere,‚Äù the state of being cause and effect is stated to be different.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dogs po las med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin te /üîΩgzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dogs po las med na mi 'byung ba nges pa yin te / gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
translated: The ascertainment that it does not occur without the cause and effect is ascertained.

original: zhes 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can another be ascertained as existing elsewhere,üîΩapart from another?‚Äù

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
translated: By ‚Äúthe phenomenon that has another object as its causal basis,‚Äù it is different from the characteristic of the mere connection with that.

original: gos la ni tshon don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin te /
analyzed: gos la ni tshon don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin te /
translated: The cloth is the property of the dye, which is a different object.

original: des na gos de la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gos de la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cloth is certainly the substratum of the dye.

original: gos yin pa tsam gyis ni sgrub par brjod mi nus so //
analyzed: gos yin pa tsam gyis ni sgrub par brjod mi nus so //
translated: But it cannot be said that the cloth is established by the mere fact of its being cloth.

original: des na gos ni tshon don gzhan las 'gyur ba'i phyir de la gos mi 'khrul pa ma yin te //
analyzed: des na gos ni tshon don gzhan las 'gyur ba'i phyir de la gos mi 'khrul pa ma yin te //
translated: Therefore, since the cloth is the substratum of the dye, which is a different object, the cloth is not nonerroneous.

original: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo ma yin par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo ma yin par brjod pa'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúinterpolated verse‚Äù is not a s≈´tra statement.

original: des na de ltar 'brel pa nyid las gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'brel pa nyid las gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin par bsgrubs te /
translated: Thus, in this way, the proof of the establishment of the reason by the connection is stated.

original: gang dug don gzhan gyi rgyu can yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos gcig gi bdag nyid kyis 'thob pa de tsam ma dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid spong ba de dag la 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i
analyzed: gang dug don gzhan gyi rgyu can yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos gcig gi bdag nyid kyis 'thob pa de tsam ma dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid spong ba de dag la 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i
translated: In that case, having accepted that the substratum is the nature of the thing, which has a different object, the acquisition of the nature of the property, such as impermanence, by the identity of one nature, the refutation of that mere connection is the proof of the connection in those.

original: don nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of refuting the very meaning of the establishment of the connection, he says:

original: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù is stated because of another fault.

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid @120a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid @120a * //
translated: If the characteristic of impermanence

original: kyi chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na de'i phyir gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the sign of another thing, then it would be different.

original: dngos mo bdag nyid thob pa'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa zhes bya ba de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos mo bdag nyid thob pa'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa zhes bya ba de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That impermanence which is the attainment of the nature of a thing is called destruction. It arises from the cause of destruction.

original: des na 'di dngos po de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di dngos po de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be the intrinsic nature of that thing.

original: gzhan de skad smra bas ni rgyu mtha' dad 'jig pa'i bdag nyid skyed pa nyid kyis byas pa nyid 'jig pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan de skad smra bas ni rgyu mtha' dad 'jig pa'i bdag nyid skyed pa nyid kyis byas pa nyid 'jig pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The one who speaks thus would be saying that because the nature of destruction is produced by a cause that is different from the thing, it is not different from the thing.

original: rgyu dang 'brel pas byas pa yin la rgyu dang 'brel pas /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pas byas pa yin la rgyu dang 'brel pas /
translated: Because it is related to a cause, it is produced.üîΩBecause it is related to a cause, it is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid spang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyang spangs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba de'i bdag nyid spang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyang spangs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The intrinsic nature of that is abandoned. In the same way, impermanence is also abandoned.

original: 'di ltar 'di mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid du skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, impermanence does not arise in the nature of the produced,

original: de ltar khas blangs na de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs na de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one accepts that, then it would be established in that nature.

original: des na mi rtag pa phyis 'byung na byas pa las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa phyis 'byung na byas pa las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if impermanence occurs later, it would be just another impermanence other than the produced.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin can du 'gyur ba ma yin na des na dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin can du 'gyur ba ma yin na des na dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But another does not become the nature of another, and therefore things would not be impermanent.

original: dper na bum pa snam bur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa snam bur mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a pot does not become a cloth.

original: 'grel pa ni de grub na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni de grub na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary states, ‚ÄúIf that is established . . . ‚Äù

original: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las gnyis 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan las gnyis 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Two things become different due to the reason of having different objects.

original: rgyu don gzhan yin pa nyid kyis dngos po grub kyang mi rtag pa nyid ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir de'i rgyu gzhan yin par 'gyur ba des na rgyu gzhan yin pas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid chos 'gal ba gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu don gzhan yin pa nyid kyis dngos po grub kyang mi rtag pa nyid ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir de'i rgyu gzhan yin par 'gyur ba des na rgyu gzhan yin pas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid chos 'gal ba gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the cause is different, the impermanent is not produced, and the impermanent is not produced. Because the cause is different, it becomes the cause of another. Therefore, because the cause is different, the characteristics of the produced and the unproduced are contradictory.

original: rgyu yod pa nyid na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyu can de grub kyang rang gi rgyu med pas ma grub pa ni phyis nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid na 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyu can de grub kyang rang gi rgyu med pas ma grub pa ni phyis nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the cause exists, the effect is established. Therefore, although it is established as having another cause, it is not established because its own cause does not exist. Later, it exists again.

original: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa spang ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa spang ro //
translated: In the same way, the difference in causes is to be rejected.

original: des na gang skyes kyang ma skyes pa gnag yin pa de de'i rnag bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gang skyes kyang ma skyes pa gnag yin pa de de'i rnag bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if something is produced but not produced, it is not the nature of that. Therefore, things are not impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa stong pa nyid du bdag nyid la rang gi rgyu las mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa stong pa nyid du bdag nyid la rang gi rgyu las mi rtag pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanence is not in the impermanent itself by its own cause.

original: gal te de dang 'brel pa'i phyir de de'i rang bzhin yin pa des na de'i rang bzhin du rigs la ma yin na zhes bya ba gnag yin pa'i tshig ti tshul ni gsog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel pa'i phyir de de'i rang bzhin yin pa des na de'i rang bzhin du rigs la ma yin na zhes bya ba gnag yin pa'i tshig ti tshul ni gsog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of that because of being related to that, then it is reasonable that it is its nature. If it is not, then the statement ‚Äúit is not‚Äù is meaningless.

original: 'on te 'brel par rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel par rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: But if it is said that it is not reasonable to be related,

original: de ni cir yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni cir yang mi rung ste /
translated: then that is not reasonable at all.

original: tha dad pa la ltos nas sun 'byin pa brjod @120b pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / tha dad kyang de'i rang bzhin du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ltos nas sun 'byin pa brjod @120b pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / tha dad kyang de'i rang bzhin du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is the context of expressing refutation in dependence on difference, and because it is reasonable that even if different, it is its nature.

original: brjod pa de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir tha mi dad pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir tha mi dad pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not reasonable that it is its nature‚Äù refutes non-difference here.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad pa la brjod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo tha mi dad pa la brjod kyi /
translated: Nature is said to be the undifferentiated intrinsic essence of a thing.

original: 'brel kyang dngos po dngos po gzhan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel kyang dngos po dngos po gzhan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if related, one thing does not become the nature of another thing.

original: ser po dang sngon po bzhin du 'brel zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ser po dang sngon po bzhin du 'brel zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: It would be like saying ‚Äúyellow and blue‚Äù and not ‚Äúnature.‚Äù

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa dang dang rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba gnag yin pa 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa dang dang rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba gnag yin pa 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that they are different because of the difference of established and non-established causes?

original: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis is the only difference of things.‚Äù

original: gang ni tha dad pa yin la rgyu tha dad pa yang gang yin zhe na chos 'gal bar gnas pa'am rgyu tha dad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang ni tha dad pa yin la rgyu tha dad pa yang gang yin zhe na chos 'gal bar gnas pa'am rgyu tha dad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: What is the difference and what is the difference of cause? He explains, ‚ÄúIt is the presence of mutually exclusive properties or the difference of cause.‚Äù

original: chos 'gal ba gnas pa ni tha dad pa yin la rgyu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas pa ni tha dad pa yin la rgyu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The presence of mutually exclusive properties is the difference. The difference of cause is the difference of cause.

original: gang dag gi chos phan tshun 'gal ba dang gcig tu gyur pa chos 'gal ba gnas pa de nyid de dag gi tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi chos phan tshun 'gal ba dang gcig tu gyur pa chos 'gal ba gnas pa de nyid de dag gi tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Those whose properties are mutually exclusive and become one, the presence of mutually exclusive properties is their difference.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig tshogs pa gzhan la skye ba na gnag zhig gzhan las skye ba rgyu tha dad pa de ni de dag gi rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig tshogs pa gzhan la skye ba na gnag zhig gzhan las skye ba rgyu tha dad pa de ni de dag gi rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, when a certain effect arises from a certain collection of causes and conditions, the causes and conditions of that effect are different from the causes and conditions of any other effect.

original: tha dad pa ni rnam pa nyis te gsal ba tha dad pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rnam pa nyis te gsal ba tha dad pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: Difference is of two kinds: difference of manifestation and difference of class.

original: de la gang gi rgyu byed pa na gnag gi rgyu byed pa med pa de ni rigs pa mtshungs pa'am de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: de la gang gi rgyu byed pa na gnag gi rgyu byed pa med pa de ni rigs pa mtshungs pa'am de lta ma yin yang bla ste /
translated: When a certain cause produces a certain effect, that cause is the cause of that effect, whether or not it is the cause of any other effect.

original: gsal ba tha dad par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad par nges pa yin no //
translated: The difference of manifestation is certain.

original: 'dri ni 'di nyid skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ni 'di nyid skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: This question is pertinent here.

original: rigs mi mthun pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las skyes pa yin no zhes 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las skyes pa yin no zhes 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: We shall explain that dissimilar effects arise from dissimilar causes.

original: de la grub pa nyid ni ma grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grub pa dang ma grub pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la grub pa nyid ni ma grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grub pa dang ma grub pa dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Here, the established and the nonestablished are different, because the established does not become nonestablished.

original: gang zhig rgyu'i mthu las bdag nyid thob pa na rgyu gzhan las 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu'i mthu las bdag nyid thob pa na rgyu gzhan las 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: But when something obtains its own nature through the power of a cause, whatever it becomes from another cause is only different.

original: de dag tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de dag tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How is it known that they are different?

original: tshad mas de ltar rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: tshad mas de ltar rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that valid cognition knows it that way,

original: gang zhig don thams cad nges par nus pa'i tshad ma ni med de ji srid rig pa tsam rnam par 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rig pa ma yin pa rnams kyang rig pa dang 'dra ba'i nges pa yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir thams @121a * //
analyzed: gang zhig don thams cad nges par nus pa'i tshad ma ni med de ji srid rig pa tsam rnam par 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rig pa ma yin pa rnams kyang rig pa dang 'dra ba'i nges pa yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir thams @121a * //
translated: there is no valid cognition that can ascertain all objects, because knowledge is posited merely in terms of awareness, and because even non-awareness is ascertained as if it were awareness.

original: cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la thams cad rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la thams cad rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since he is not omniscient, he does not know everything.

original: des na la lar grub pa dang ma grub pa tha dad par rig kyang gzhan du de lta ma yin par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na la lar grub pa dang ma grub pa tha dad par rig kyang gzhan du de lta ma yin par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, even though he knows that in some cases things are different, he does not know that in other cases.

original: des na tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir chos 'gal bar gnas pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir chos 'gal bar gnas pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, because it is understood just as it is, it does not make different things that are contradictory dharmas.üîΩHere it is said:

original: 'di ni dngos po'i gnas thabs yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i gnas thabs yin gyi /
translated: This is the way things are.

original: 'di tshad ma'i byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tshad ma'i byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the function of a pramƒÅ·πáa.

original: yod pa dang khyad par rtogs pa dag la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa 'jug gi / rnam pa 'di lta bu ni 'di ltar yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i gnas thabs yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang khyad par rtogs pa dag la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa 'jug gi / rnam pa 'di lta bu ni 'di ltar yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po'i gnas thabs yin te /
translated: The function of direct perception and inference is to understand existence and its distinctions, but this is the way things are, that is, ‚Äúit is like this.‚Äù

original: dper na gang byas pa de mi rtag go zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gang byas pa de mi rtag go zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, ‚Äúwhatever is produced is impermanent.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po'i gnas lugs kyang rang nyid gsal ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i gnas lugs kyang rang nyid gsal ba ni ma yin la /
translated: If the way things are is not itself clear,

original: de gsal ba gang yin pa de yang tshad ma yin pa des na 'di ni gang ji ltar dmigs pa de de kho na ltar blang bar bya zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gsal ba gang yin pa de yang tshad ma yin pa des na 'di ni gang ji ltar dmigs pa de de kho na ltar blang bar bya zhes bya ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which makes it clear is a pramƒÅ·πáa, then it would be just this: ‚Äúwhatever is perceived is to be accepted just as it is.‚Äù

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po yod do zhes bya ba 'di yang shes pa yul du ma byas par rang nyid gsal bar ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po yod do zhes bya ba 'di yang shes pa yul du ma byas par rang nyid gsal bar ni mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is not tenable that the existence of a thing with such an aspect is itself manifest without being cognized.

original: tshad ma med par dngos po'i gnas pa grub pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma med par dngos po'i gnas pa grub pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: And there is no establishment of the existence of a thing without a valid cognition.

original: 'dir nges par gzung bar gyis shig / dus der grub pa dang / dus gzhan du grub pa dag rtogs pa de nyid kyis rtogs sam ma rtogs /
analyzed: 'dir nges par gzung bar gyis shig / dus der grub pa dang / dus gzhan du grub pa dag rtogs pa de nyid kyis rtogs sam ma rtogs /
translated: So, you must understand this: Is the establishment of a thing at that time or the establishment of a thing at another time understood by that cognition?

original: gal te ma rtogs na ni tshad ma nyid med par thal lo //
analyzed: gal te ma rtogs na ni tshad ma nyid med par thal lo //
translated: If it is not understood, then it follows that there is no valid cognition.üîΩBut it is not so, because conceptual thoughts are not objects of direct perception, and because the establishment of a thing at another time is not understood by that cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis ma rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na ma yin te der ltag par zhen pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu nyams su myong ba la brten pa'i phyir don dam par rtogs pa ma yin yang rtogs par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyis ma rtogs pa kho na'o zhe na ma yin te der ltag par zhen pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu nyams su myong ba la brten pa'i phyir don dam par rtogs pa ma yin yang rtogs par sgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because conceptual thoughts are not objects of direct perception, and because the establishment of a thing at another time is not understood by that cognition.

original: 'on te rtogs pa yin na de lta na rtogs pa de la gnas pa 'di nges par brtag nus so //
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa yin na de lta na rtogs pa de la gnas pa 'di nges par brtag nus so //
translated: But if it is a cognition, then it is possible to determine that cognition as abiding in that.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las nas 'jug pa'i phyir ji srid 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa na yul 'di ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i zhes des rtogs pa nges par brtag par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las nas 'jug pa'i phyir ji srid 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa na yul 'di ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i zhes des rtogs pa nges par brtag par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: But conceptual cognition is engaged in dependence on mere desire, and so long as it is engaged in desire, it is only to be determined that it cognizes this object in this way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid rnam par rtog pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid rnam par rtog pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is explained that the suitability of being expressed is conceptualization itself.

original: des na ji ltar 'di'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes rang gi ngo bor ma @121b gyur pa'i chos dag tu nges par rtogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor gyur bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'di'i rjod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes rang gi ngo bor ma @121b gyur pa'i chos dag tu nges par rtogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor gyur bas kyang ngo //
translated: Therefore, just as it is ascertained that these phenomena, which are not of the nature of being expressed, are expressed in this way, so too it is ascertained that those which are of the nature of being expressed are not expressed in this way.

original: gal te bdag nyid gang du 'di nges par brtag pa de gal te 'di'i bdag nyid yin na ni de rig pas rig pa nyid pas 'di la nges par rtogs pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid gang du 'di nges par brtag pa de gal te 'di'i bdag nyid yin na ni de rig pas rig pa nyid pas 'di la nges par rtogs pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: If it is determined in this way, if it is of this nature, then if it is known by that, it is known by that itself. What other determination is needed for this?

original: bdag nyid ma yin na yang sgro 'dogs pa tsam du 'gyur gyi de'i bdag nyid rnam par dpyod pa na ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin na yang sgro 'dogs pa tsam du 'gyur gyi de'i bdag nyid rnam par dpyod pa na ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is not the self, then it is merely superimposition. When analyzing the nature of something, it is not.

original: brjod pa char lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa chos tsam la brten pas kyang chos gang zhig chos gzhan gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de /
analyzed: brjod pa char lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa chos tsam la brten pas kyang chos gang zhig chos gzhan gang gi bdag nyid yin pa de /
translated: We reply: By merely clinging to the rain, the conceptual consciousness that is based on mere phenomena, when it realizes one phenomenon,

original: de rtogs pa na ma rtogs kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos de rtogs pa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de rtogs pa na ma rtogs kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi chos de rtogs pa la gnas pa na /
translated: even though it does not realize another phenomenon, it is still the case that when it abides in the realization of a phenomenon that has such a nature,

original: yod pa nyid do zhes rtogs pa des ma rtogs kyang rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul du bya bar nus so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid do zhes rtogs pa des ma rtogs kyang rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul du bya bar nus so //
translated: it is able to take as its object another phenomenon that is not realized by that realization.

original: ji ltar dngos po cha med par yul du byed pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis sngon po myong ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po cha med par yul du byed pa'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis sngon po myong ba na /
translated: When a sense consciousness that takes a partless object as its object experiences blue,

original: de ji ltar myong ba bzhin du rtogs pa po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i rtogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir nges par brtag par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa na rnam par rtog pa rnams phyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gal te yang spyis dben pa'i rang bzhin
analyzed: de ji ltar myong ba bzhin du rtogs pa po'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i rtogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir nges par brtag par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa na rnam par rtog pa rnams phyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gal te yang spyis dben pa'i rang bzhin
translated: Because it is the nature of the object of cognition to be determined by the cognizer in accordance with his experience, and because conceptual thoughts have external objects as their domain, even though the nature of the object is not ascertained as being devoid of universals,

original: nges pa ma yin pa de lta na yang snang ba'i sngon po rang bzhin gcig tu snang ba 'di rang gi ngo bo'am ngo bo gzhan gyi rjes su song bar mi snang ba'i phyir spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pas bdag nyid de la spyis stong pa nyid yod
analyzed: nges pa ma yin pa de lta na yang snang ba'i sngon po rang bzhin gcig tu snang ba 'di rang gi ngo bo'am ngo bo gzhan gyi rjes su song bar mi snang ba'i phyir spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pas bdag nyid de la spyis stong pa nyid yod
translated: the appearance of blue as a single entity does not appear to be the nature of itself or of something else, and therefore it is not a universal. Thus, the existence of the emptiness of a universal in that nature

original: do zhes da'i rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pa nyid la nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: do zhes da'i rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pa nyid la nges pa bzhin no //
translated: is ascertained by the analysis of its nature.

original: de'i phyir chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid can snang ba'i chos kyi rnam par dbye mi nus pa'i rang bzhin ni mi snang yang rnam par dpyad pa las nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid can snang ba'i chos kyi rnam par dbye mi nus pa'i rang bzhin ni mi snang yang rnam par dpyad pa las nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the appearance, which has the nature of another phenomenon, cannot be analyzed, but it is ascertained through analysis, even though it does not appear.

original: de bas na rang gi rgyu mtshan gyis bskyed pa'i rtogs pas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de'i dus su grub pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi rgyu mtshan gyis bskyed pa'i rtogs pas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de'i dus su grub pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the nature that is realized by the realization that is produced by its own cause is either established at the time of realization or it is established at another time.

original: dus gzhan du grub pa las tha dad pa'i bdag nyid rtogs pa des ma rtogs kyang chos de dang bdag nyid gcig pas yod do zhes rtogs pa gzhan dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du grub pa las tha dad pa'i bdag nyid rtogs pa des ma rtogs kyang chos de dang bdag nyid gcig pas yod do zhes rtogs pa gzhan dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Even though the realization does not realize it by means of a different nature, it is realized by other realizations that it exists because it is the same nature as that phenomenon.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams don gyi ngo bo yod pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin nyid med na de'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin gzhan yod par ltag la 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams don gyi ngo bo yod pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin nyid med na de'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin gzhan yod par ltag la 'gyur /
translated: If conceptual consciousnesses do not depend on the nature of an existent object, then how could the nature that is realized by that conceptual consciousness be the nature that is being realized? If it does not exist, then it would be contradictory for another nature that is its nature to exist.

original: rang bzhin yod na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /üîΩdper na logs gcig rtogs @122a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te / dper na logs gcig rtogs @122a * //
translated: If it existed by its own nature, it would be realized.

original: pa'i bum pa la logs gzhan yod pa'i phyir yang rtogs par 'dod na de yang rtogs par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i bum pa la logs gzhan yod pa'i phyir yang rtogs par 'dod na de yang rtogs par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, if one side of a pot is realized, then because the other side of the pot exists, it is asserted that it is realized, and it would be realized.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni mngon sum la mi brten pa de'i dus su grub par rtogs pa la gang gis bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba de yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni mngon sum la mi brten pa de'i dus su grub par rtogs pa la gang gis bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba de yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: So too, when it is realized that it is established at the time of perception, it is not the case that the nature that is the object of realization is not realized.

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang phyi rol ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i don yod pas de'i rang gi ngo bos nye ba'i rang bzhin gzhan rtogs par mi smra'i /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang phyi rol ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i don yod pas de'i rang gi ngo bos nye ba'i rang bzhin gzhan rtogs par mi smra'i /
translated: It is true, but since the external object exists as it is realized, we do not say that the nature of the object is realized by the nature of the object itself.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa la de ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar sngon por rtogs pa skyes pa na de'i yul du gyur pa sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis nges par rtogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa la de ltar yod pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar sngon por rtogs pa skyes pa na de'i yul du gyur pa sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis nges par rtogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: However, it is as it exists for the consciousness that realizes it.üîΩWhen the consciousness that realizes blue arises, the aspect of blue that is its object is ascertained by another consciousness.

original: de'i dus su grub pa rtogs pa na yang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nges par brtags pa de bzhin du de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus su grub pa rtogs pa na yang ji ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nges par brtags pa de bzhin du de nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, when it is realized that it is established at the time of perception, the nature that is the object of realization is ascertained by the nature that is the object of realization.

original: rtogs pa dang / ma rtogs pas tha dad kyang rang gi ngo bos khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / ma rtogs pas tha dad kyang rang gi ngo bos khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in their own nature, whether they are realized or not.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid nges par rtogs pa ni dran par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid nges par rtogs pa ni dran par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Realization is the ascertainment of the nature of an object, and memory is the recollection of that ascertainment.

original: ma rtogs pa la ni dngos po'i gnas thabs khongs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la ni dngos po'i gnas thabs khongs su chud pa yin no //
translated: If the object is not realized, it is not included within the sphere of experience.üîΩNow, when one realizes the nature of an object, does one realize it as it abides in the present?

original: 'o na de'i rang gi ngo bos de rtogs pa na rtogs pa la rnam par gnas pa glo na nye bar gnas pa ltar rtogs sam /üîΩyang na rtogs bzhin pa de'i rang gi ngo bo las rtogs /
analyzed: 'o na de'i rang gi ngo bos de rtogs pa na rtogs pa la rnam par gnas pa glo na nye bar gnas pa ltar rtogs sam / yang na rtogs bzhin pa de'i rang gi ngo bo las rtogs /
translated: Or does one realize it as it existed in the past?

original: rnam par rtog pa snga ma la ni rtog pa rnam par dpyod pa don med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snga ma la ni rtog pa rnam par dpyod pa don med do //
translated: In the first case, it is pointless to analyze the object conceptually.

original: phyi ma la yang gang gis de rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dag gi 'brel bar rtogs par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang gang gis de rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dag gi 'brel bar rtogs par brjod dgos so //
translated: In the second case, one must explain how one can realize the connection between the object as it existed in the past and the object as it is realized in the present.

original: des na tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin dngos po rtogs pa'i tshul gzhan gyis ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i don gyi rang bzhin
analyzed: des na tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin dngos po rtogs pa'i tshul gzhan gyis ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum bzhin du rtogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i don gyi rang bzhin
translated: Therefore, since the mode of understanding things is not like that of valid cognition, what is this so-called ‚Äúunderstanding of a contradictory property‚Äù? Conceptual thought does not understand the nature of an object that is present like direct perception,

original: rtogs pa ni ma yin te sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan med par 'dod pa tsam gyis nye bar gnas par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni ma yin te sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan med par 'dod pa tsam gyis nye bar gnas par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
