translated: because it is not understood to be present through mere assertion without a reason such as a word.

original: des na mthong ba'i cha sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba ltar rang gi rgyu mtshan nyid la ni rtogs bzhin pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma rtogs pa'i chos rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i cha sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba ltar rang gi rgyu mtshan nyid la ni rtogs bzhin pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma rtogs pa'i chos rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the part of seeing is seeing what was not seen before, the part of understanding is not the understanding of a property that was not understood before, in the nature of the property that is being understood.

original: 'o na ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: Well then, how is it understood?

original: rtogs pa'i chos nyid las so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos nyid las so //
translated: It is understood from the nature of the understood property.

original: 'brel pa @122b rtogs pa la ltos pa yang ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa @122b rtogs pa la ltos pa yang ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not dependent on the understanding of the relation, because they are not different.

original: 'o na ci ltar de rtogs pa na ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar de rtogs pa na ma rtogs she na /
translated: But if it is not realized when that is realized, how is it realized?

original: chos tha mi dad kyang ltos pa'i dbang gis tha dad par ba rtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos tha mi dad kyang ltos pa'i dbang gis tha dad par ba rtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although the phenomena are not different, they are realized as different by the power of dependence.

original: dper na lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par kho na sha pa'i phyir sha pa zhes bya bas shing nyid kyi nang du 'dug pa yin yang seng ldeng la yang yod pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas tha dad par byed pa de bzhin du de'i
analyzed: dper na lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par kho na sha pa'i phyir sha pa zhes bya bas shing nyid kyi nang du 'dug pa yin yang seng ldeng la yang yod pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas tha dad par byed pa de bzhin du de'i
translated: For example, since a tree is just a particular that possesses leaves, etc., it is included within the category of tree, but because it exists in a particular place, it is distinguished by the imagination as different.

original: dus su grub pa dus gzhan du grub pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa tsam gyi khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: dus su grub pa dus gzhan du grub pa las rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa tsam gyi khyad par du gyur pa zhes bya bar mi 'grub po //
translated: In the same way, although the establishment of the time is different from the establishment of another time, it is not established as a mere difference, called a particular.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid can yongs su dor bar mi nus pa yang rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na de rtogs na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid can yongs su dor bar mi nus pa yang rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na de rtogs na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the nature of that particular phenomenon, which cannot be separated from its identity, is realized as its nature. Therefore, when that is realized, it is realized.

original: tha dad pa med kyang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med kyang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: But if they are not different, how can one understand the other?

original: de'i rnam par nges par brtags pa las so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par nges par brtags pa las so zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that one understands it through the ascertainment of its form.üîΩWhat is this called ‚Äúascertainment‚Äù?

original: nges par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / smras pa gal te de'i dus su grub pa rang bzhin gcig tu gyur na dus gzhan du grub pa bzhin dus der grub pa dus der mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / smras pa gal te de'i dus su grub pa rang bzhin gcig tu gyur na dus gzhan du grub pa bzhin dus der grub pa dus der mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were established at that time as having the same nature as it has at another time, then it would not be established at that time as it is established at another time.

original: dus gzhan du grub pa yang dus de nyid du 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gzhan du grub pa yang dus de nyid du 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, that which is established at another time would be established at that time, because they are not different.

original: gcig nyid ni bdag nyid gzhan med pa yin la de yang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni bdag nyid gzhan med pa yin la de yang tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Identity is the absence of another nature, and that is the absence of difference.

original: bdag nyid gzhan dang ldan pa ni du ma nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhan dang ldan pa ni du ma nyid do //
translated: Possessing another nature is multiplicity.

original: des na de ltar des de dang dus gzhan du grub pa dag dus tha dad pa dang gcig nyid bdag nyid gzhan dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin par rnam par phye nas de dag tha dad par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar des de dang dus gzhan du grub pa dag dus tha dad pa dang gcig nyid bdag nyid gzhan dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin par rnam par phye nas de dag tha dad par nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way, one ascertains their difference through the analysis of the difference and identity of that which is established at that time and at another time, and of the identity that is free from another nature.

original: rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /üîΩmngon sum la sogs pa dag las shes pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / mngon sum la sogs pa dag las shes pa'am /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúanalysis‚Äù?üîΩIt is the discernment of an object through the understanding of a word, etc.,

original: sgra la sogs pas rtogs pa rmongs pa med pa'i rtogs pas rnam par phye nas nges par sems pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar 'ga' zhig shing nyid la skyes bu zhes rtogs te des na des shing la rnam par phye nas nges par rtogs pa na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pas rtogs pa rmongs pa med pa'i rtogs pas rnam par phye nas nges par sems pa'o // 'di ltar 'ga' zhig shing nyid la skyes bu zhes rtogs te des na des shing la rnam par phye nas nges par rtogs pa na /
translated: by means of a non-deluded understanding.üîΩFor example, someone understands a tree through the word ‚Äúperson.‚ÄùüîΩWhen he discerns the tree through that word, he ascertains that it is not a person.

original: skyes bu'i bdag nyid ma yin par nges pa ji ltar shing ni lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bdag nyid ma yin par nges pa ji ltar shing ni lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: He ascertains that a tree is endowed with leaves, etc.,

original: skyes bu ni rkang lag la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu ni rkang lag la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and that a person is endowed with feet, hands, etc.

original: lo ma la sogs pa nyid kyang rkang lag la sogs pa ma yin pas na /üîΩskyes bu las shing @123a * //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa nyid kyang rkang lag la sogs pa ma yin pas na / skyes bu las shing @123a * //
translated: Since leaves, etc., are not feet, hands, etc.,

original: gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin no //
translated: a tree is different from a person.

original: shing nyid kyang lo ma la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: shing nyid kyang lo ma la sogs pa las gzhan ma yin pa des na /
translated: Since a tree is not different from leaves, etc.,üîΩa tree is not different from a person.

original: de ltar shing nyid rnam par phye ba nyid kyis skyes bu las gzhan nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin du de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su grub pa dag dang / dus tha dad pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no//üîΩbdag nyid gcig pa las kyang gcig nyid gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shing nyid rnam par phye ba nyid kyis skyes bu las gzhan nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin du de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su grub pa dag dang / dus tha dad pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no// bdag nyid gcig pa las kyang gcig nyid gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.

original: lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid shing yin no zhes ni mngon sum las nges na gcig nyid rnam pa gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba go ba las mngon sum nyid las so zhe na 'o na gzhan de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes byaüîΩbar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩgal te de lta na shing lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid shing yin no zhes ni mngon sum las nges na gcig nyid rnam pa gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba go ba las mngon sum nyid las so zhe na 'o na gzhan de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na / gal te de lta na shing lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.

original: de ltar ni mi nus te lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa gzhan dag yod kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa la shing zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi nus te lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa gzhan dag yod kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa la shing zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: And the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is established and at the time when the person is not established.üîΩAnd the tree is not different from the person, because the tree is established at the time when the person is

original: des na lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid de lta ma yin no zhes ni mi nus so //
analyzed: des na lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyid de lta ma yin no zhes ni mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that what possesses leaves, etc. is not that .

original: gzhan lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan lo ma la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that what does not possess leaves, etc. is refuted.üîΩBut if one understands a tree in that case, there is no contradiction in the entity, because the mere name is changed.

original: 'on kyang de la yang shing zhes rtogs na ming tsam gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po la 'gal ba med do zhe na de ltar na ro gcig ni bdag nyid gcig pa can dang / tha mi dad pa yin la gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes mngon sum la rtogs sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la yang shing zhes rtogs na ming tsam gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po la 'gal ba med do zhe na de ltar na ro gcig ni bdag nyid gcig pa can dang / tha mi dad pa yin la gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes mngon sum la rtogs sam /
translated: If that is so, then the identity of a single taste is the identity of a single nature and is not different.

original: srid pa rnam par gzhag kyang rung ste phung po gnyis su nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa rnam par gzhag kyang rung ste phung po gnyis su nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Whether or not existence is established, it is definitely twofold because of the two aggregates.

original: des na khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference at all.

original: des na gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos de rtogs pa na /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos de rtogs pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one understands a dharma that has become the nature of something,

original: yongs su ma btang ba'i bdag nyid kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin rnam par phye ba nyid la de rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su ma btang ba'i bdag nyid kho nar rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin rnam par phye ba nyid la de rtogs pa yin no //
translated: because it is understood as the nature that is not relinquished, it is understood as the nature that is distinguished from that .

original: des na chos 'gal ba gnas pa tha dad par byed pa la tshad ma tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di'i de'i bdag nyid la tshad mas rtogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na chos 'gal ba gnas pa tha dad par byed pa la tshad ma tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa 'di'i de'i bdag nyid la tshad mas rtogs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, where the valid cognition is seeking to establish the difference of the two mutually exclusive properties, it is not the case that the valid cognition does not depend on the establishment of their identity.

original: chos 'gal ba gnas pa tha dad par byed pa nyid la grub pa dang / ma grub pa dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar tshad ma 'ga' zhig gi rtogs pa ltos par bya ba 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas pa tha dad par byed pa nyid la grub pa dang / ma grub pa dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar tshad ma 'ga' zhig gi rtogs pa ltos par bya ba 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the valid cognition depends on the establishment of the difference of the two mutually exclusive properties, and the establishment of the difference of the two properties depends on the valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang de tshad ma'am tshad ma yin pas rtogs pa na grub pa nyid kyis rang bzhin ma grub pa dang / tha dad pa ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par @123b 'byed pa nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de tshad ma'am tshad ma yin pas rtogs pa na grub pa nyid kyis rang bzhin ma grub pa dang / tha dad pa ni rang gi ngo bo rnam par @123b 'byed pa nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: However, when the valid cognition cognizes the property and the property-possessor, it is the valid cognition that establishes the difference of the two properties, and the difference of the two properties is established by the valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te don bdag 'di 'dod na de las bdag gis ci zhig bya zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te don bdag 'di 'dod na de las bdag gis ci zhig bya zhes bshad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is said: ‚ÄúIf you accept the object, what do I do with the self?‚Äù

original: des na gsal ba med par ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rang nyid mi 'grub la gsal ba yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin don grub po zhes smras pa de mi rigs te tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa yang rtogs
analyzed: des na gsal ba med par ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rang nyid mi 'grub la gsal ba yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ji lta ba bzhin don grub po zhes smras pa de mi rigs te tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa yang rtogs
translated: Therefore, the nature of an entity is not established without manifestation. And since manifestation is valid knowledge, it is not correct to say that the object is established in accordance with valid knowledge.

original: pa'i bdag nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The nature that is not realized by valid knowledge is realized from the nature of realization.

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma la ltos pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And valid knowledge that apprehends the connection between realization and nonrealization is not relied upon.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba de de lta ma yin par srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba de de lta ma yin par srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that what exists by its own nature does not exist in that way.

original: sngon po'i sngon po nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i sngon po nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the blueness of blue.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba la gal te tshad ma de ltar ma yin par 'gyur na phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba la gal te tshad ma de ltar ma yin par 'gyur na phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if valid knowledge does not exist in that way, when it exists by its own nature in that way, it would be just the opposite.

original: de lta na'o 'di rtags nyid las rtags can rtogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na'o 'di rtags nyid las rtags can rtogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be called the realization of the characterized from the very evidence.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is this:

original: 'brel pa tshad ma gzhan gyis nges ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa tshad ma gzhan gyis nges ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: the relation is not ascertained by another valid cognition.

original: bden te nges pa'i chos can la gnas par rtogs na rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden te nges pa'i chos can la gnas par rtogs na rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: To be sure, but if one understands that the subject is ascertained, then it is just inference.

original: tshad ma ni dngos po la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma ni dngos po la brten pa yin la /
translated: A valid cognition is based on an entity,

original: dngos po yang yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yang yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa yin no //
translated: and an entity is determined in terms of place, time, and form.

original: shes rab phul du byung bas thob par bya ba dngos po rnam par dpyod pa'i rtsa ba can 'ga' zhig la de ltar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yul nges pa sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: shes rab phul du byung bas thob par bya ba dngos po rnam par dpyod pa'i rtsa ba can 'ga' zhig la de ltar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni yul nges pa sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: That which is based on the analysis of an entity to be attained by the highest wisdom is not a valid cognition, because it does not establish a determined object.

original: de'i phyir grub pa ma yin pa de ma grub pa las tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po rtogs pa tsam yin te grub pa tsam du rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa ma yin pa de ma grub pa las tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po rtogs pa tsam yin te grub pa tsam du rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement, ‚ÄúThat which is not established is different from that which is not established,‚Äù is merely an understanding of an entity, just like the understanding of mere establishment.

original: don gang dag gis gcig par mi srid pa'i chos dang / gcig pa 'gal ba'i chos dang gcig gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bdag nyid de nyid de dag gi tha dad pa chos 'gal bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: don gang dag gis gcig par mi srid pa'i chos dang / gcig pa 'gal ba'i chos dang gcig gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bdag nyid de nyid de dag gi tha dad pa chos 'gal bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the phenomena which are impossible as identical, the phenomena which are contradictory as identical, and the very nature which is the nature of one, are different phenomena which abide in contradiction.

original: don de skyes kyang ma skyes pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de dang gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de skyes kyang ma skyes pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de ni de dang gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the impermanence which is produced but not produced were not identical with that, then the thing would not be impermanent.

original: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa yang skyed par byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu tha dad pa yang skyed par byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And thus, the difference in cause also teaches the difference in the producer.

original: 'di tha dad pa byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gal te de dag kyang zhes @124a * //
analyzed: 'di tha dad pa byed pa nyid kyis rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir gal te de dag kyang zhes @124a * //
translated: In order to teach another principle by means of this difference, he says, ‚ÄúIf those also . . . ‚Äù

original: smos te / chos 'gal bar gnas pa dang rgyu tha dad pa dag kyang tha dad par byed pa ma yin na ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smos te / chos 'gal bar gnas pa dang rgyu tha dad pa dag kyang tha dad par byed pa ma yin na ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If the phenomena which abide in contradiction and the different causes also do not produce difference, then everything would be one substance.

original: 'gal ba'i dngos po gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa la ltos nas de gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i tha dad pa yang chos 'gal bar gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar nus la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i dngos po gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa la ltos nas de gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i tha dad pa yang chos 'gal bar gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar nus la /
translated: And in dependence on the other entity that is incompatible with it, the difference of the entity that possesses endurance is also the endurance of incompatible attributes.

original: 'gal ba'i chos de logs shig tu gyur pa la ltos nas ni tha dad par byed pa yang yin pas gnyi ga ltar bstan to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos de logs shig tu gyur pa la ltos nas ni tha dad par byed pa yang yin pas gnyi ga ltar bstan to //
translated: And in dependence on the incompatible attributes that are separate from it, it is also the differentiation. Thus both are taught.

original: gang zhig gang la ltos nas rang bzhin nges pa gal te tha dad dang tha mi dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa ma yin na ni dngos po mtha' dag bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la ltos nas rang bzhin nges pa gal te tha dad dang tha mi dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa ma yin na ni dngos po mtha' dag bdag nyid gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: If, in dependence on something, the nature of something is ascertained, and if it is not different due to difference or non-difference, or due to difference in cause, then all things would have the same nature,

original: gcig gi rang bzhin ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is their nature.

original: gang gi tshe chos 'gal ba dang 'brel kyang tha mi dad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos 'gal ba dang 'brel kyang tha mi dad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is connected with incompatible attributes, but is not different, then at that time,

original: de dag gcig nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gcig nyid de /
translated: they are the same.

original: tha dad pa med na dngos po rnams la tha mi dad pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na dngos po rnams la tha mi dad pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no difference, then all things would definitely be the same.

original: tha mi dad pa de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag gis thob par 'gyur te chos 'gal bar gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa de la yod pa'i phyir dang de yang tha dad pa ma yin pas gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa de yang 'gro ba mtha' dag gis thob par 'gyur te chos 'gal bar gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa de la yod pa'i phyir dang de yang tha dad pa ma yin pas gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that nondifference would be obtained by all transmigrating beings, because that nondifference that has the nature of the contradiction of phenomena would exist, and that also would not be different and would become one.üîΩIt is not possible to accept that all transmigrating beings are one.

original: 'gro ba gcig nyid du khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni ril gcig yin pa des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig nyid du khas blang bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni ril gcig yin pa des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ste /
translated: Since all is one, arising and disintegrating would be simultaneous.

original: gcig gang yin pa de nyid gzhan yin pas ji ltar de skyes pa na skyes pa nyid yin pa dang zhig pa na yang zhig pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du don gzhan dag kyang de kho na ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gang yin pa de nyid gzhan yin pas ji ltar de skyes pa na skyes pa nyid yin pa dang zhig pa na yang zhig pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du don gzhan dag kyang de kho na ltar 'gyur te /
translated: That which is one is itself another, and just as it is, so it is when it arises, it arises, and when it disintegrates, it disintegrates. In the same way, other objects would be just like that,

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from that.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, everything would be applied to everything.

original: me yang gsher bar byed nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: me yang gsher bar byed nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Fire would be able to moisten.

original: de chu las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de chu las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir chu nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different from water, just like water itself.

original: chu yang 'bar bar nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu yang 'bar bar nus par 'gyur te /
translated: And water itself could be burning,

original: me nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: me nyid bzhin no //
translated: just like fire.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ba la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, you should understand that they would be of one nature, and so on.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med na ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med na ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did not have such a nature, they would not be one.

original: so sor skye ba dang 'jig pa dang nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / rang bzhin tha dad na ni rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gnas pas gcig ces bya bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor skye ba dang 'jig pa dang nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / rang bzhin tha dad na ni rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gnas pas gcig ces bya bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were different in nature, they would not be established as one, because they would be established in their own nature, like arising and ceasing individually, being connected, and having a nature.

original: de bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚ÄúIf that were not so. . . . ‚Äù

original: ming tha dad par zad de rnam pa tha @124b dad pa la sogs pa'i don khas blangs nas de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming tha dad par zad de rnam pa tha @124b dad pa la sogs pa'i don khas blangs nas de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is just a difference in name, because it is said that way after accepting the meaning of a difference in aspect, and so on.

original: chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa tha dad par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba dang ldan pa tha dad par byed pa yin na /
translated: If they were different because they had incompatible attributes,

original: de dang ldan pa'i don rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i don rnams tha dad pa med pa'i phyir gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and because the objects that possess it are not different, it follows that they are one.

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin de tha dad pa ma yin na 'gal ba dang ldan pa gzhan yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin de tha dad pa ma yin na 'gal ba dang ldan pa gzhan yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of such an aspect is not different, then it would not be different from that which possesses the contradictory properties.

original: gcig pa nyid ma yin na yang lhan cig skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pa 'di ni dngos po gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir nye bar bkod pa yin gyi
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ma yin na yang lhan cig skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pa 'di ni dngos po gnas pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa tha dad par byed pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir nye bar bkod pa yin gyi
translated: And if they are not identical, then they would arise simultaneously, and so on. This is the final point. This is presented in order to prove that the connection of a thing with contradictory properties is itself a cause of difference.

original: 'gal ba'i chos 'du ba tha dad par byed pa ma yin na 'di yang rigs pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur bas nye bar mi 'god par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'gal ba'i chos 'dus pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhag ste
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos 'du ba tha dad par byed pa ma yin na 'di yang rigs pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur bas nye bar mi 'god par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'gal ba'i chos 'dus pa tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhag ste
translated: If the connection of contradictory properties were not a cause of difference, then this would not be a case of the establishment of another nature by another reason.üîΩTherefore, we set this aside for the time being.

original: gal te de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nye bar bkod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nye bar bkod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The response beginning with ‚ÄúBut if they are . . .‚Äù is not correct.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan gyi rgyu can du mi rigs par bstan pa la gzhan dag gi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan gyi rgyu can du mi rigs par bstan pa la gzhan dag gi rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang zhes smras so //
translated: Thus, having taught that impermanence is not tenable as the cause of another object, another says, ‚ÄúEven though there is no difference in the object, . . .‚Äù

original: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na gzhan nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na gzhan nyid du brjod do //
translated: If it is the causal basis of another object, it is called ‚Äúanother.‚ÄùüîΩIf that were so, then it would follow that the effect would have contradictory characteristics, which are established and not established, and the cause would be a different cause, and thus it would be a different thing.

original: de ltar gyur na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos 'gal bar thal ba dang / rgyu rgyu gzhan nyid du 'gyur bas tha dad pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos 'gal bar thal ba dang / rgyu rgyu gzhan nyid du 'gyur bas tha dad pa byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mi rtag pa nyid gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But impermanence is not the causal basis of another.

original: yod pa nyid las 'jig pa'i ngang can du skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa nyid las 'jig pa'i ngang can du skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises from existence as a momentary state,

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i rgyu med mod 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo la ltos te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i rgyu med mod 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo la ltos te /
translated: there is no need for a different cause.

original: grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'gal ba go ji med /
analyzed: grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'gal ba go ji med /
translated: The characteristics of an existent and a non-existent are mutually exclusive.

original: de nyid ston pa ni dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni dngos po'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The demonstration of that is: ‚ÄúBecause impermanence is not established at the time of the thing.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po zhig pa yin no //
translated: Impermanence is the disintegration of a thing.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyang zhig pa nyid rab tu sbyor bar byed pa byas te mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyang zhig pa nyid rab tu sbyor bar byed pa byas te mi rtag pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: The one who is in the habit of disintegrating is also called impermanent, because he applies disintegration.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jig pa'i ngang can yang dngos po ngo bor gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa mi pa rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jig pa'i ngang can yang dngos po ngo bor gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa mi pa rtag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the one who is in the habit of disintegrating would be the nature of the thing, and just as blue, etc., are not impermanent, so also the one who is in the habit of disintegrating would not be impermanent.

original: de bas na don gyi mi rtag pa nyid na zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don gyi mi rtag pa nyid na zhig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanence is the disintegration of the thing.

original: de yang yod pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that does not exist at the time the thing exists.

original: @125a * // dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang dngos po'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @125a * // dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / med pa yang dngos po'i dus na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of non-entity, and because non-existence does not exist at the time of entity.

original: des na tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, difference is the abiding of contradictory attributes.

original: de yang dngos po dang mi rtag pa la yod pa'i phyir rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang mi rtag pa la yod pa'i phyir rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: And since that exists in entity and impermanence, although the meaning of cause and effect is not different, they are similar in not being its nature.

original: dngos po zhig pa las dngos po mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don de yin yang /
analyzed: dngos po zhig pa las dngos po mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don de yin yang /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is that which is destroyed from entity.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po'i rang bzhin la brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: But impermanence is said to be the nature of entity.

original: des na zhig pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin te de la dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhig pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin te de la dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, destruction is not impermanence because it does not have the nature of entity.

original: 'on kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: But that which is destroyed is impermanent.

original: des na 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi med pa tsam ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi med pa tsam ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the state of being perishable is impermanence, and not mere nonexistence.

original: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is that nothing whatsoever is established as impermanence in that way.

original: don gzhan gyi rgyu can nyid ma yin na ni mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i dus na grub pas dngos po med par brjod mi nus te phyis 'grub bar 'gyur ba yin na rgyu gzhan 'jug pa la brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rgyu can nyid ma yin na ni mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i dus na grub pas dngos po med par brjod mi nus te phyis 'grub bar 'gyur ba yin na rgyu gzhan 'jug pa la brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not the cause of another object, impermanence would be established at the time of the object, and it could not be said to be nonexistent. If it were established later, it would depend on the engagement of another cause.

original: des na rgyu tha dad pa med na grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'gal ba dang 'brel pa yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dir ji lta mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang
analyzed: des na rgyu tha dad pa med na grub pa dang ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'gal ba dang 'brel pa yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dir ji lta mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang
translated: Therefore, if there is no separate cause, the connection of a contradictory characteristic, such as establishment and nonestablishment, is related to its own nature. How could impermanence be established later?

original: med pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa nyid de /
translated: That is nonexistence.

original: 'on kkyang dngos po skad cig mar gnas ba'i chos can de kho na phyi ma la ltos nas rang gi ngo bo med ba yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kkyang dngos po skad cig mar gnas ba'i chos can de kho na phyi ma la ltos nas rang gi ngo bo med ba yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: However, in dependence on the future, the entity that is momentary and has the attribute of enduring is said to have the nature of destruction because it lacks its own nature.

original: byung ma thag tu med par 'gyur ba la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ma thag tu med par 'gyur ba la de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that which arises and then ceases is said to be impermanent.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having the nature of destruction is impermanence.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyi byung ma thag tu med pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ba la mi rtag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid kyi byung ma thag tu med pa'i 'jig par 'gyur ba la mi rtag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Having the nature of destruction is said to be impermanence because that which arises ceases.

original: 'jig pa don gzhan gyi rgyu can la yang gal te tha dad par brjod pa de lta na yang dngos po mi rtag pa nyid ni nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa don gzhan gyi rgyu can la yang gal te tha dad par brjod pa de lta na yang dngos po mi rtag pa nyid ni nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: If destruction is caused by another entity, even if it is said to be different, impermanence is not undermined.

original: byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod pa yin yang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod pa yin yang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because although impermanence that has the nature of being produced exists, destruction does not exist.

original: ma byung ba las skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: ma byung ba las skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: That which is produced from what has not occurred is impermanent.

original: sngar med @125b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar med @125b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it did not exist previously.

original: phyis med pas ni 'jig pas mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis med pas ni 'jig pas mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it does not exist later, it is impermanent due to destruction.

original: des na sngar med pa thob pa la phyis 'byung ba de'i rang bzhin nyid yin yang de'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na sngar med pa thob pa la phyis 'byung ba de'i rang bzhin nyid yin yang de'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, although the nature of that which arises later is the attainment of that which did not exist previously, impermanence characterized by that does indeed exist.

original: de lta bu'i mi rtag pa nyid byas pa grub pa nyid na grub mod /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi rtag pa nyid byas pa grub pa nyid na grub mod /
translated: If such impermanence were established by being produced, it would be established.

original: phyis kyang med pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa grub kyang ma grub pa'i phyir tha dad de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de 'dir sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: phyis kyang med pa gang yin pa de ni byas pa grub kyang ma grub pa'i phyir tha dad de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de 'dir sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: But that which does not exist later is not established even if produced, so it is not the nature of that which is different. It cannot be established here.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i zhig pa'am de dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi de lta bu'i rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i zhig pa'am de dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi de lta bu'i rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't impermanence the disintegration of an entity or a universal related to that, the basis of such a cognition?

original: des na dngos po de kho na mi rtag pa nyid do zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: des na dngos po de kho na mi rtag pa nyid do zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that that entity itself is impermanence?

original: gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin na ni dngos po mi rtag pa snyam du don gzhan du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin na ni dngos po mi rtag pa snyam du don gzhan du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If impermanence were a thing, then one would not understand the meaning of ‚Äúimpermanence of a thing‚Äù as something different.

original: dngos po mi rtag pa zhes tha dad pa med par rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag pa zhes tha dad pa med par rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it follows that one would understand ‚Äúimpermanence of a thing‚Äù as not different.

original: 'di la bshad pa chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la ste /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: with respect to the different words of the property and the subject,

original: tshig tha dad pa'i yul la yang rgyu mtshan bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig tha dad pa'i yul la yang rgyu mtshan bshad par bya'o //
translated: the reason must be explained with respect to the different words.

original: yul du gyur pa'i dngos po gcig nyid la 'di ji ltar tha dad pa de ltar tha dad pa de ltar ni 'og tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul du gyur pa'i dngos po gcig nyid la 'di ji ltar tha dad pa de ltar tha dad pa de ltar ni 'og tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: With respect to a single thing that is the object, it is different in that way, and it is different in that way. This will be shown later.

original: de de ltar mi rtag pa nyid phyis 'grub pa spangs ste /
analyzed: de de ltar mi rtag pa nyid phyis 'grub pa spangs ste /
translated: Thus, having rejected the establishment of impermanence later,üîΩif impermanence were a thing, then the time of understanding impermanence would be later.

original: mi rtag pa dngos po nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i dus ni phyi nas yin no zhes na bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dngos po nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid rtogs pa'i dus ni phyi nas yin no zhes na bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: phyis 'di nges pa'i dus yin pa des na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyis 'di nges pa'i dus yin pa des na de'i tshe rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since this is the time of its ascertainment later, at that time it is posited as permanent.

original: gang gis dngos po'i dus na ma rtogs pa'i phyir ma grub pas na gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po'i dus na ma rtogs pa'i phyir ma grub pas na gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: Since it is not established because it is not realized at the time of the entity, it is posited as other.

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes so sor grub pa dgag pa'i phyir rtogs pa tsam nyid dus tha dad par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes so sor grub pa dgag pa'i phyir rtogs pa tsam nyid dus tha dad par bshad pa yin no //
translated: When it is realized, it is not arisen. In order to refute establishment individually, the mere realization itself is explained as a different time.

original: yang ci'i phyir phyis nges pa'i dus yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phyis nges pa'i dus yin zhe na /
translated: Also, why is it the time of ascertainment later?

original: bshad pa / mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because of the realization of non-abiding through non-observation.

original: gang gi tshe 'di g-yo mo'i gnas skabs su bum par ma dmigs pa de'i tshe 'di mi gnas par rtogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di g-yo mo'i gnas skabs su bum par ma dmigs pa de'i tshe 'di mi gnas par rtogs pa skye'o //
translated: When this is in the state of movement, at the time of non-observation of the pot, at that time the realization of non-abiding arises.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If impermanence is not the intrinsic essence of an entity,

original: des na 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtsa ba las mi / gnas par rtogs pa la ltos kyi /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtsa ba las mi / gnas par rtogs pa la ltos kyi /
translated: then here the realization of non-abiding depends on non-observation.

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i chos ltar dngos po rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dir ji ltar nges par ma gyur ce na /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa'i chos ltar dngos po rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dir ji ltar nges par ma gyur ce na /
translated: Just as one realizes the nature of things such as blue, why wouldn‚Äôt one ascertain impermanence in the same way?

original: @126a * // bshad pa /
analyzed: @126a * // bshad pa /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de ni dngos po 'di'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de ni dngos po 'di'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The reality of momentary endurance is the nature of this thing.

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skyes pa'i phyir de skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skyes pa'i phyir de skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Because it arises in that way from its own cause alone, it is said to exist as the reality of momentary endurance. This is the reason of nature.

original: de ni mthong bzhin du yang yod pa dmigs pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de ni mthong bzhin du yang yod pa dmigs pas mi rtogs so //
translated: Even though it is seen, it is not realized because its existence is not observed.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te yang 'bras bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa rang bzhin gcig tu gsal ba yin la rnam pa khyad par can gyi gsal bas stong pa'i mngon sum yang nges par tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa rang bzhin gcig tu gsal ba yin la rnam pa khyad par can gyi gsal bas stong pa'i mngon sum yang nges par tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa
translated: If impermanence, which is undifferentiated from such things as the effect, is a single nature that is clearly manifest, and direct perception, which is empty of a clearly manifest differentiated aspect, does not differentiate it,

original: de ltar na yang 'bras bu nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ltar mi rtog pa nyid rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan rang bzhin khyad par can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'bras bu nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ltar mi rtog pa nyid rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan rang bzhin khyad par can dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of the nature of that, which is characterized by the observation of a special nature, is the reason for understanding non-conceptuality, just as one follows or turns away from something by the effect itself.

original: des dben par rtogs pas de med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dben par rtogs pas de med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands the absence of that by understanding the absence of that.

original: des na gal te rgyun mi 'chad par mig bgrad nas lta ba na de la yang bum pa'i rgyun dmigs pa par dang bcas pa nyid du gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di 'byung zhing med par 'gyur ro zhes mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te rgyun mi 'chad par mig bgrad nas lta ba na de la yang bum pa'i rgyun dmigs pa par dang bcas pa nyid du gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di 'byung zhing med par 'gyur ro zhes mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one were to look with wide-open eyes without interruption, and if the continuum of the pot were observed as having parts, then at that time one would understand impermanence, thinking, ‚ÄúIt arises and ceases.‚Äù

original: des na gang gi phyir rang bzhin kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang 'jigs pa nyid lhur gyur pas de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de med par dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir rang bzhin kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin pa de lta na yang 'jigs pa nyid lhur gyur pas de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de med par dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the nature itself is impermanent, in order to understand that, the reason for understanding that is precisely the observation of the absence of that, because it is the nature of fear itself.

original: 'di la ni yod pa dmigs pa nyid yod kyi med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni yod pa dmigs pa nyid yod kyi med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In this case, the existent is the object of perception, not the non-existent.

original: gal te med pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te med pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If one says that the non-existent is the object of perception, then the non-existent thing is not the object of perception.

original: de'i rang bzhin dang bral bas dmigs pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang bral bas dmigs pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of intrinsic nature, it is not the basis of perception.

original: 'on kyang dngos po des dben pa'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po des dben pa'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa nyid de /
translated: However, the other thing that is devoid of that thing is the object of perception.

original: de ni skad cig ma la yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma la yang yod pa yin te /
translated: That also exists in the moment.

original: de la yang skad cig snga mas dben pa skad cig gnyis pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang skad cig snga mas dben pa skad cig gnyis pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that case, the second moment exists as devoid of the previous moment.

original: skad cig ma skad cig ma snga mas dben par rtogs pa ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: skad cig ma skad cig ma snga mas dben par rtogs pa ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the previous moment of the moment is not realized as devoid.

original: mi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the very cause of non-realization must be stated.

original: gal te sngon po rtogs nas ma rtogs pa las yang rtogs pa na de'i tshe skad cig ma rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te sngon po rtogs nas ma rtogs pa las yang rtogs pa na de'i tshe skad cig ma rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If, after realizing blue, one realizes it again from what was not realized, then at that time the moment would be realized.

original: skyes pa tsam nyid na mi @126b mngon par 'gyur ba'i glog 'gyu ba'i snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes pa tsam nyid na mi @126b mngon par 'gyur ba'i glog 'gyu ba'i snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Just as lightning flashes are not seen when they are produced, so too are things.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te rgyun bar mtshams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te rgyun bar mtshams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because there is no interruption in the continuum.

original: dngos po skad cig bar chod na ni de'i rgyun la brten nas 'byung ba'i dngos po gzhan skye bar 'gyur te rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig bar chod na ni de'i rgyun la brten nas 'byung ba'i dngos po gzhan skye bar 'gyur te rgyu med pa can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were an interruption in the momentary thing, then another thing would arise in dependence on its continuum, because it would follow that it would be without a cause.

original: 'on kyang rgyu nus pa yod pa nyid yin te des na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu nus pa yod pa nyid yin te des na /
translated: However, the cause exists with the potential to produce the effect, and

original: dngos po skye ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skye ba yin no //
translated: the thing arises from that.

original: de yang rgyu'i dngos po yod pa dang bar ma chod par skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i dngos po yod pa dang bar ma chod par skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it arises without interruption from the existence of the cause.

original: de ni skad cig ma gnyis tsam du zad kyi 'di la dngos po med pa'i skad cig ma gsum pa med pa des na rgyu dang 'bras bu bar ma chod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma gnyis tsam du zad kyi 'di la dngos po med pa'i skad cig ma gsum pa med pa des na rgyu dang 'bras bu bar ma chod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only two moments, and there is no third moment of nonexistence for this thing. Thus, cause and effect are without interruption.

original: des na gal te dngos po la skad cig ma gzhan dag gis dben pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des na gal te dngos po la skad cig ma gzhan dag gis dben pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, if things are devoid of other moments,

original: de lta na yang gal te yod pa bar dang bcas par dmigs par gyur na skad cig mar 'jig pa nyid rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang gal te yod pa bar dang bcas par dmigs par gyur na skad cig mar 'jig pa nyid rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Nevertheless, if one observes a thing as having intervals, then one does understand its momentary destruction.

original: bar med pa yin na ni ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: bar med pa yin na ni ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin gcig kho na yin no //
translated: If it is without intervals, then it is a single nature without cessation.

original: dngos po gzhan bar ma chod par yod pa yin zhes ma nges pa'i phyir mi rtogs so //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan bar ma chod par yod pa yin zhes ma nges pa'i phyir mi rtogs so //
translated: But if one does not understand that it is without intervals, then one does not understand that it is momentary.

original: yod par bar ma chad pa'i phyir na skad cig ma nyid ma rtogs pa tsam du yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yod par bar ma chad pa'i phyir na skad cig ma nyid ma rtogs pa tsam du yang ma zad kyi /
translated: But not only does one not understand its momentariness because of its existence without intervals,

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni dngos po de rtag tu de ltar yod par gnas la dogs pas bslus pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log tu yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni dngos po de rtag tu de ltar yod par gnas la dogs pas bslus pa'o //
translated: but, moreover, one understands it in a perverted way. This is what is shown by the words, ‚ÄúOne is deceived by the doubt that it exists in that way permanently.‚Äù

original: rtag par rtogs pa nges pa'i rang bzhin yin yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir dogs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtag par rtogs pa nges pa'i rang bzhin yin yang tshad ma med pa'i phyir dogs zhes brjod do //
translated: Even though the understanding of permanence is a perverted nature, it is called ‚Äúdoubt‚Äù because it is without a valid cognition.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dngos po yod pa kho na rtag tu dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni yod pa kho na'o zhes phyin ci log tu gyur la skad cig ma nyid du nges pa'i rgyu med pa dmigs pa med pas ni mi rtags pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa kho na rtag tu dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni yod pa kho na'o zhes phyin ci log tu gyur la skad cig ma nyid du nges pa'i rgyu med pa dmigs pa med pas ni mi rtags pa yin no //
translated: Because an existent thing is always perceived, it is wrongly supposed that it exists alone. And because there is no perception of a cause for the certainty of momentariness, it is wrongly supposed that it does not exist.

original: gal te skad cig so sor bar du rtogs pa med pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa ma rtogs pas skad cig ma nyid du mi nges na bum pa la sogs pa la mtha'i gnas skabs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skad cig so sor bar du rtogs pa med pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa ma rtogs pas skad cig ma nyid du mi nges na bum pa la sogs pa la mtha'i gnas skabs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is argued that momentariness is not ascertained because the cessation is not perceived, since there is no perception of the absence of an interval between each moment, then a pot, etc., would not have a final state.

original: de yang gyo mo la sogs pa yod pa bar mchod par byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gyo mo la sogs pa yod pa bar mchod par byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of its fragments, etc., is perceived after the pot, etc., has been destroyed.

original: de ste der des dben pa de dag nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ldog pa ma rtogs na de ltar na 'di ni snga ma la ltos te skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams la yang khyad par med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ste der des dben pa de dag nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ldog pa ma rtogs na de ltar na 'di ni snga ma la ltos te skad cig phyi ma phyi ma rnams la yang khyad par med do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the cessation is not perceived because the absence of the pot, etc., in that place is perceived, then, in that case, it is not different in the later moments in dependence on the earlier ones.

original: 'di zlog pa'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di zlog pa'i phyir 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute that, it is said that it is deceived by the occurrence of other similar things.

original: gyo mo'i gnas skabs su mi 'dra ba'i skad cig skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ldog @127a * //
analyzed: gyo mo'i gnas skabs su mi 'dra ba'i skad cig skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ldog @127a * //
translated: Because a different moment is observed in the state of the potsherd, the error is reversed.

original: go // bum pa'i rgyun dmigs par ni bum pa'i skad cig gnyis pa 'dra ba kho na dmigs so //
analyzed: go // bum pa'i rgyun dmigs par ni bum pa'i skad cig gnyis pa 'dra ba kho na dmigs so //
translated: The continuum of the pot is observed, but only the second moment of the pot is similar to the first moment.

original: des na skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par bum pa'i skad cig nyid dmigs pas rtag tu de yod par dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: des na skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par bum pa'i skad cig nyid dmigs pas rtag tu de yod par dgos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in the second moment and so on, the moment of the pot is observed, and it is necessary that it always exists.

original: mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de mi dmigs pa skad cig ma nyid du nges pa'i rgyu de med par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dmigs pa'i bdag nyid de mi dmigs pa skad cig ma nyid du nges pa'i rgyu de med par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the absence of the cause of the ascertainment of momentariness, namely, the observation of a different object, is not understood.

original: gal te gyo mo la sogs pa dag la yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang bum pa la gnas par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gyo mo la sogs pa dag la yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang bum pa la gnas par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the existence of the pot is observed in the potsherds and so on, but it is not understood to be enduring?

original: 'gyur mod / gnas par rtogs pa'i rgyu tsam nyid kyis ni yod pa dmigs pa bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur mod / gnas par rtogs pa'i rgyu tsam nyid kyis ni yod pa dmigs pa bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That is correct, but the mere cause of the understanding of endurance does not teach the observation of existence.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid mi nges pa'i rgyur bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid mi nges pa'i rgyur bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, this is taught as the cause of the non-ascertainment of impermanence.

original: de la yang med par mi dmigs pa mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa'i rgyur 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang med par mi dmigs pa mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa'i rgyur 'khrul pa med do //
translated: And the non-apprehension of non-existence is not a cause for the certainty of impermanence, because it is not a mistake.

original: des na yod pa dmigs na de ltar yod par dogs pa 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa dmigs na de ltar yod par dogs pa 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when existence is apprehended, the apprehension of existence is a mistake.

original: yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang mi 'dra ba gzhan byung na mi gnas par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa rtogs pa la 'di gnyi ga rgyu rang dbang du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang mi 'dra ba gzhan byung na mi gnas par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa rtogs pa la 'di gnyi ga rgyu rang dbang du gyur pa yin no //
translated: But when a different non-existence is apprehended, it is a cause for the realization of non-endurance, because it is a cause for the realization of destruction.üîΩWhen the realization is directed inward, it is not realized that the realization is not realized, because the identity or any transformation is not apprehended.

original: gang gi tshe rtogs pa nang du mngon du phyogs pa na de'i bdag nyid dam rnam par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma rtogs te slar yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid dmigs pa de'i tshe 'thad pas grub pa nyid kyi skad cigüîΩmar nges pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtogs pa nang du mngon du phyogs pa na de'i bdag nyid dam rnam par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir rtogs pa ma rtogs te slar yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid dmigs pa de'i tshe 'thad pas grub pa nyid kyi skad cig mar nges pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: When that which is of that nature is again apprehended, at that time the momentariness is ascertained by the establishment of the reason.

original: de bzhin du mi 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba na bar chad pa med par yod pa nyid gsal yang 'jigs pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba na bar chad pa med par yod pa nyid gsal yang 'jigs pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Similarly, when a different non-existence arises, the existence without interruption is clearly realized as destroyed.

original: des na 'di gnyis na phan tshun ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis na phan tshun ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not mutually dependent.

original: 'di gnyis gnas par rtogs pa brjod pa na de las bzlog pas ni mi gnas par rtogs par brjod par 'gyur ba des na de la ltos te 'am zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis gnas par rtogs pa brjod pa na de las bzlog pas ni mi gnas par rtogs par brjod par 'gyur ba des na de la ltos te 'am zhes smos so //
translated: When the understanding of endurance is stated, the opposite of that is stated as the understanding of non-endurance. Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin dependence on that.‚Äù

original: gnas par rtogs pa la ni yod pa de dmigs pa gzhan 'byung ba la ltos te /
analyzed: gnas par rtogs pa la ni yod pa de dmigs pa gzhan 'byung ba la ltos te /
translated: In the understanding of endurance, existence is not the reason for the occurrence of another object of observation.

original: rgyu mtshan ma yin te mtha'i gnas skabs na yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma yin te mtha'i gnas skabs na yod pa dmigs pa yod kyang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though existence at the time of the end exists as the object of observation, there is no understanding.

original: gal te yang skyes bu dag la byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa mi 'dra ba yod la /
analyzed: gal te yang skyes bu dag la byis pa dang gzhon nu la sogs pa mi 'dra ba yod la /
translated: Moreover, even though there is a difference in persons, such as a child, a youth, and so on,

original: bum pa la sogs pa la yang gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'dra ba yod pa de ltar na yang snga ma las gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyi 'dra ba rjes su @127b 'jug la gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la yang gyo mo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su 'dra ba yod pa de ltar na yang snga ma las gcig gi rgyu mtshan gyi 'dra ba rjes su @127b 'jug la gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: and even though there is similarity in pots, and so on, in the context of shards, and so on, still, in the former, the reason for similarity is the subsequent engagement, but not in the latter.

original: 'dra ba thams cad de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba thams cad de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all similarity is not the reason for understanding in that way.

original: gang ji lta bu'i rgyu yin pa de ni rtogs pa nges pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang ji lta bu'i rgyu yin pa de ni rtogs pa nges pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is a cause in some way must be ascertained from a definite realization.

original: gal te bar dang bcas pa'i yod pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang bar med par gsal ba la yang mi 'dra bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid mi nges na rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang mi rtag par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe
analyzed: gal te bar dang bcas pa'i yod pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir dang bar med par gsal ba la yang mi 'dra bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid mi nges na rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang mi rtag par rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe
translated: If momentariness is not ascertained because a present thing that is not interrupted is not perceived and because a manifest thing that is not interrupted is not perceived as different, then the realization of impermanence would not exist even for yogins.

original: na / blo zhan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: na / blo zhan pa zhes smos so //
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúbecause of the weakness of their intellect.‚Äù

original: blo zhan pa ni rang nyid don rtogs pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: blo zhan pa ni rang nyid don rtogs pa'i mthu med do //
translated: The weak intellect is not capable of realizing the meaning by itself.

original: tshu rol mthong ba'i don gyi phan pa la ltos pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i don gyi phan pa la ltos pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the mere perception of the present, the realization of the meaning is dependent on the benefit of the meaning.

original: don rnams la rang dbang du dpyod pa rnal 'byor ba rnams ni don gyi rgyu mtha' dag la snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i skad cig rnams cig car rtogs pa na tshu rol mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa la sogs pa dus gcig tu yod pa dag
analyzed: don rnams la rang dbang du dpyod pa rnal 'byor ba rnams ni don gyi rgyu mtha' dag la snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i skad cig rnams cig car rtogs pa na tshu rol mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa la sogs pa dus gcig tu yod pa dag
translated: Yogins, who are free to analyze the meaning, realize all the causes of the meaning simultaneously in the moments that occur before and after.

original: phan tshun tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar skad cig nyid du mi rtogs /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad par rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar skad cig nyid du mi rtogs /
translated: Because they are understood as different from each other, how could they not be understood as momentary?

original: yang na phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan de ltar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan de ltar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the external objective cause is taught in this way.

original: yid kyi 'khrul pa ni nges par phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi 'khrul pa ni nges par phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Mental error certainly does not arise from an external objective cause,

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the appearance of two moons.

original: des na yid nyams pa med par thag pa la yang sbrul du 'khrul pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na yid nyams pa med par thag pa la yang sbrul du 'khrul pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that a rope is erroneously perceived as a snake without the impairment of the mind.

original: de na blo zhan pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de na blo zhan pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: There, the phrase ‚Äúimpaired mind‚Äù is explained in order to teach the internal objective cause.

original: 'khor ba nyid kyis bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i phyir rtag pa'i bag chags kyis nyams bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid kyis bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i phyir rtag pa'i bag chags kyis nyams bar byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Because of cyclic existence itself, there is the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúimpaired by the latent impressions of the view of the transitory collection‚Äù is taught.

original: 'o na phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan bstan pas don ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan bstan pas don ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is asked what is the point of teaching the external objective cause,

original: nyams su myong ba de ltar rig par byed pa yin na de yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de ltar rig par byed pa yin na de yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because if it is said that it is known in that way through experience, then that also would not exist.

original: skad cig ma tha ma ni gang gi de ma thag pa kho nar dngos po'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ste de mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma ni gang gi de ma thag pa kho nar dngos po'i rang bzhin mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ste de mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The last moment is that which immediately precedes the non-perception of the nature of the entity; because it is ascertained by those who see it.

original: de'i tshe ni mi 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po gzhan med pa dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni mi 'dra ba nyid kyi dngos po gzhan med pa dmigs pa yin te /
translated: At that time, the non-perception of another entity which is different is perceived,

original: thams cad nye bar len pa can med pa'i 'jig pa grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de mthong yang nges pa med pa gang yin pa 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin par ma zad kyi 'on kyang gzhan la yang yod do zhes @128a * //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar len pa can med pa'i 'jig pa grub pa'i phyir ro // dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de mthong yang nges pa med pa gang yin pa 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi rnam pa yin par ma zad kyi 'on kyang gzhan la yang yod do zhes @128a * //
translated: because the destruction of all that possesses appropriation is established.

original: bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa zhes smos so //
translated: This is the mode of the impermanent, but it is not only that; in order to show that it also exists in another, he says: the capacity to produce an effect.

original: rgyu mthong yang ma mthong par gyur ba gang yin pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ni rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthong yang ma mthong par gyur ba gang yin pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ni rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The capacity to produce an effect is not different from the cause, even though the cause is seen and becomes unseen.

original: 'di ni de ltar mthong yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar mthong yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Although it is seen in this way, it is not ascertained as the nature of the cause itself.

original: 'on kyang de yod na 'bras bu dmigs pa kho na las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod na 'bras bu dmigs pa kho na las so //
translated: However, when it exists, it is only due to the observation of the effect.

original: des na 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma dmigs na rgyu rtogs su zin kyang rtogs pa po'i rgyur rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma dmigs na rgyu rtogs su zin kyang rtogs pa po'i rgyur rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the cause is ascertained as the entity of the capacity to produce the effect, if the effect is not observed, even though the cause is ascertained, the observer does not ascertain it as the cause. However, it is only due to seeing the effect.

original: de bzhin du mi rtog pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin yang mtha'i skad cig mthong ba nyid na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtog pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin yang mtha'i skad cig mthong ba nyid na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, even though non-conceptuality is the nature of entities, it is realized only when the final moment is seen.üîΩTherefore, even though non-conceptuality is not realized, it is reasonable that it is the nature of the object.

original: des na mi rtog pa nyid de rtogs pa ma rtogs kyang don gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho nar rigs so// de ltar ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ma gyur na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid las tha dad paüîΩkho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mi rtog pa nyid de rtogs pa ma rtogs kyang don gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho nar rigs so// de ltar ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ma gyur na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid las tha dad paüîΩkho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-conceptuality were not impermanent, then it would be completely different from impermanence.

original: rgyu mtshan gang rtsa bar gyur pas dngos po 'di de'i ngo bo ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan de ston te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang rtsa bar gyur pas dngos po 'di de'i ngo bo ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan de ston te /
translated: The reason why this thing is not of that nature is shown.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba'i 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba'i 'dod pas so //
