translated: ‚ÄúWhether it has a reason‚Äù is the assertion of those who maintain that destruction has a cause.üîΩ‚ÄúEven if it is without a reason‚Äù is the assertion that destruction is observed to occur without a cause.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'jig pa 'byung ba po nyid du dmigs te rgyu med par 'dod pa nyid la yin gyi dngos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'jig pa 'byung ba po nyid du dmigs te rgyu med par 'dod pa nyid la yin gyi dngos pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a thing.

original: dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di la ni brgal ba 'di med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di la ni brgal ba 'di med pa kho na'o //
translated: This is because there is no such thing as a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa dang dngos po gzhan du gyur ba ma yin mod /üîΩ'on kyang de ni dngos po'i nges pa nyid yin bar bstan //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang dngos po gzhan du gyur ba ma yin mod / 'on kyang de ni dngos po'i nges pa nyid yin bar bstan //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a non-thing, nor is it a thing that becomes something else.‚ÄùüîΩHowever, it is shown that it is the very nature of a thing.

original: dngos po ni khyad par nyid kyi sgo nas bstan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni khyad par nyid kyi sgo nas bstan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: A thing is taught by way of its distinctive characteristic.

original: dper na de yod pa nyid kyis ba glang ngo snyam du rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ba lang nyid la sogs pas bstan pa de bzhin du phan tshun med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nges pa yang gcig la gcig med pas bsnyad pa yin
analyzed: dper na de yod pa nyid kyis ba glang ngo snyam du rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ba lang nyid la sogs pas bstan pa de bzhin du phan tshun med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nges pa yang gcig la gcig med pas bsnyad pa yin
translated: In the same way, ascertainment by means of mutual exclusion is also taught by the absence of one in the other.

original: la dus nges pa ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yin te /
analyzed: la dus nges pa ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yin te /
translated: Ascertainment of time is nonexistence prior to and nonexistence after.

original: des na don gzhan nyid yin mod /
analyzed: des na don gzhan nyid yin mod /
translated: Therefore, it is definitely a different object.

original: ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: de lta na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is stated.

original: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na dngos po de dang ldan par te mi rtag par mi @128b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na dngos po de dang ldan par te mi rtag par mi @128b 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence is different, then that thing would not possess impermanence and would not be impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhen mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is not necessary.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir don de nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir don de nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nonexistence called ascertainment exists, then that object would not be ascertained.

original: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa khyad par yin yang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa khyad par yin yang /
translated: Even though ascertainment is the identity of a nonentity,

original: de'i dngos po gzhan dang 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: de'i dngos po gzhan dang 'brel ba'am /
translated: it is related to another entity.

original: dus gzhan khyab pa'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan khyab pa'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the other, which is all-pervasive, does not change into something else.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid kyis nges pa yin no zhen /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid kyis nges pa yin no zhen /
translated: If it is ascertained by the mere possession of that,

original: bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad zin to //
translated: it has already been explained.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni gzhan yod kyang de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni gzhan yod kyang de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that sort does not change into something else even when the other exists.

original: 'on te dngos po gzhan la sogs pa dang ma 'brel ba 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po med pa gzhan gyis ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gzhan la sogs pa dang ma 'brel ba 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po med pa gzhan gyis ci yang byar med do //
translated: But if it is the nature of this which is not related to the other, etc., then the non-existence of the other does not do anything at all.

original: 'di'i de la nye bar sbyor ba na ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di'i de la nye bar sbyor ba na ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: When it is applied to that, it is just this:

original: de yod na dngos po nges pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na dngos po nges pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: if it exists, it is the very ascertainment of the thing.

original: de lta na yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod na de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod na de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi ;
translated: Even so, if its own nature exists, it would be like that, so by its own nature, the non-existence of the thing is not applied to the non-existence of the thing.

original: 'on kyang nus pa nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa nyid kyis yin no //
translated: But it is by its capacity.

original: des na de'i na de'i rgyu nyid de lta bu sgrub par nus par brtags te khyad par gzhan dor ba kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: des na de'i na de'i rgyu nyid de lta bu sgrub par nus par brtags te khyad par gzhan dor ba kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to consider that the cause of that is capable of establishing that sort of thing, and to reject any other distinction.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: 'on te dgos na ni dngos po de'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid la 'di phan 'dogs na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas mi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te dgos na ni dngos po de'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid la 'di phan 'dogs na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas mi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is necessary, if that thing‚Äôs definitive characteristic is assisted by that, then it is definite by its very nature, and therefore it is impermanent by the very nature of that itself. So what would another impermanence do?

original: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gzhan dang ldan pas dngos po nges pa 'dir grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gzhan dang ldan pas dngos po nges pa 'dir grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that this thing, which is definite, would be established as having a different object that has the characteristic of destruction.

original: khyad par nyid kyis de de lta bur 'grub pa la te bar mkho na dus mtshungs ba'i don la brten nas nye bar sbyor bar brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par nyid kyis de de lta bur 'grub pa la te bar mkho na dus mtshungs ba'i don la brten nas nye bar sbyor bar brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is necessary for it to be established as such by a distinction, then it should be said that it is applied in dependence on a simultaneous object.

original: des na 'dir rang gi rgyu las de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'dir rang gi rgyu las de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in this case, it is not established as such from its own cause.

original: des na rang yod pa'i dus bzhin du du gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bos 'jig pa'i rang can ma yin pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang yod pa'i dus bzhin du du gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bos 'jig pa'i rang can ma yin pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is suitable to be related to another just as it is when it exists, it is not essentially perishable. Therefore, it is not essentially unchanging.

original: de lta yin dang don gzhan dang ldan yang g-yo ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang don gzhan dang ldan yang g-yo ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be tenable that it is changing even though it has a different object.

original: des na de ltar don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pas gzhan nyid du bsgrub te //
analyzed: des na de ltar don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pas gzhan nyid du bsgrub te //
translated: Thus, if it has a different object as its reason, it is established as different because of the contradiction of its attributes.

original: rgyud don tha dad pa @129a * //üîΩnyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi phyogs la yang phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid kyis gzhan nyid du mtshungs par thal bar rtog pa bsal nas de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid skabs su byas ta /
analyzed: rgyud don tha dad pa @129a * // nyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi phyogs la yang phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba nyid kyis gzhan nyid du mtshungs par thal bar rtog pa bsal nas de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid skabs su byas ta /
translated: Since it is not tenable that it is different, it is not tenable that it is unchanging.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya bas mi 'thad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya bas mi 'thad do zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it is unchanging, it is not tenable that it is permanent.üîΩSince it is not tenable that it is permanent, it is not tenable that it is essentially one.üîΩSince it is not tenable that it is essentially one, it is not tenable that it is essentially different.üîΩSince it is not tenable that it is essentially different, it is not tenable that it is essentially both.üîΩSince it is not tenable that it is essentially both, it is not tenable that it is essentially neither.

original: de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mi rtag pa la rjes su dpag pa yang mi srid do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mi rtag pa la rjes su dpag pa yang mi srid do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is impossible to infer impermanence in that way.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos sam /üîΩgzhan de yang gzhan las 'byung ba ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur te de las byas pa skyes pa des na 'dir rjes su dpog pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos sam / gzhan de yang gzhan las 'byung ba ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'gyur te de las byas pa skyes pa des na 'dir rjes su dpog pa'am /
translated: The property of impermanenceüîΩor that which is other than that, would be the cause of the proof, because that which is produced by that is impermanent. Therefore, it would be either an inference or

original: yang na byas pas skyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin ba gcig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: yang na byas pas skyed pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin ba gcig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: the effect produced by the impermanent.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te re zhig sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan las 'byung nas gzhan nyid du ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te re zhig sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan las 'byung nas gzhan nyid du ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: First, impermanence arises from another object, as explained previously, and it abides as different.

original: rjes su dpog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa ni lhag par gyur pas 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi 'brel pa ni lhag par gyur pas 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The connection of the reason that is the means of inferring that is superior, so it is like this.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid kyang ji ltar dogs par ma byas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid sel bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga ma yin pa nyid kyang ji ltar dogs par ma byas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid sel bar byed de /
translated: How could it be doubted that it is neither a cause nor an effect?

original: gang zhig rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid 'thad pa yin no //
translated: That which is neither a cause nor an effect is unrelated, and therefore it is tenable that it is just a conceptual thought as described.

original: 'brel pa med na skabs kyi don dang 'gal ba ci zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa de la 'brel pa med pa las yod par rjes su dpag pa rtags mthong ba las de yod pa nyid du rtog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med na skabs kyi don dang 'gal ba ci zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa de la 'brel pa med pa las yod par rjes su dpag pa rtags mthong ba las de yod pa nyid du rtog pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is unrelated, what is the contradiction with the meaning of the context? If it is neither a cause nor an effect, it is unrelated. It is impossible to infer that it exists from seeing a reason for its existence.

original: de'i phyir phyogs gnyis nyid dogs par bya ba yin no //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu nyid srid pa de la re zhig rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gnyis nyid dogs par bya ba yin no // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid srid pa de la re zhig rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is to be doubted whether it is both.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is possible that it is a cause and effect, it is not a cause, because it arises later.

original: byas pa nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'i phyis rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni /
analyzed: byas pa nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa'i phyis rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid de ni /
translated: That impermanence which occurs later from another cause of the thing which is asserted to be produced

original: de'i rgyu ma yin te phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin te phyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is not its cause, because it occurs later.

original: grub pa'i don yod pa la ltos te phyis yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i don yod pa la ltos te phyis yod par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: The existence of the established object is dependent on the later existence.

original: grub zin pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po la ni rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub zin pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po la ni rgyu 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the nature of the established thing does not have any cause at all.

original: des na phyis 'byung ba ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phyis 'byung ba ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the later occurrence is not the cause.

original: ci ste yang grub pa dang rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'brel pas 'bras bu nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste yang grub pa dang rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'brel pas 'bras bu nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But if you assert that the later occurrence is the effect because it is related to the established thing,

original: rgyu grub pa nyid las 'bras bu bdag nyid thob pa'i @129b phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu grub pa nyid las 'bras bu bdag nyid thob pa'i @129b phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the effect obtains its own nature from the established cause,

original: de la yang ga las nges 'bras bu ni gdon las nges 'bras bu ni gdon rba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang ga las nges 'bras bu ni gdon las nges 'bras bu ni gdon rba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then in that case, too, there is no such certainty that ‚Äúthe effect is the later occurrence,‚Äù because there is no certainty that ‚Äúthe effect is the later occurrence.‚Äù

original: des na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir nges pa med pa 'di la rjes su dpag pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir nges pa med pa 'di la rjes su dpag pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is the effect, it is not possible to infer this non-necessity.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po grub nas phyis grub pa'i dngos po de gang las 'gyur bde las tha dad pa'i don gzhan de las 'byung na'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos po grub nas phyis grub pa'i dngos po de gang las 'gyur bde las tha dad pa'i don gzhan de las 'byung na'o //
translated: If the property of impermanence, etc. were established in the entity of being produced, etc., then what would be the point of establishing that entity later? It would arise from that which is different from it, from another object.

original: 'dis ni sngar grub par bstan pas mdo'i phyis kyi sgras rnam par bkrol te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sngar grub par bstan pas mdo'i phyis kyi sgras rnam par bkrol te /
translated: This is explained by the later words of the sutra, demonstrating that it is already established.

original: ji ltar grub zin pa'i dngos po de'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: ji ltar grub zin pa'i dngos po de'i rgyu yin /
translated: How could it be the cause of that entity which is already established?

original: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges zhes bya ba bshad pa ni 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin pas te rgyu yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar yod pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges zhes bya ba bshad pa ni 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin pas te rgyu yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar yod pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: How could it be ascertained as the effect? It has been explained that the effect is not necessarily in the cause, and that when the cause exists, the effect is not necessarily present.

original: gal te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin mod /
translated: If the effect is not necessarily in the cause, even though it is dependent,

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what is the problem?

original: bshad pa / 'bras bu de yod par te bdog par go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'bras bu de yod par te bdog par go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: The reason that ascertains the existence, that is, the presence, of that effect is itself uncertain.

original: gang gi tshe de yod pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa zhes gdon pa de'i tshe yang rgyu go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de yod pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa zhes gdon pa de'i tshe yang rgyu go bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: When you say, ‚ÄúThe reason that ascertains its existence is uncertain,‚Äù then at that time you would be saying that it does not ascertain the cause.

original: 'bras bu'i yul can nyid ni de zhes skabs su bab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yul can nyid ni de zhes skabs su bab pa nyid do //
translated: The point is that it has an effect as its object.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni yod pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni yod pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Inference understands an existent object to be inferred.

original: gang gi tshe 'di nges par rgyu yod na yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya ba la rgyu ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di nges par rgyu yod na yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu rjes su dpag par bya ba la rgyu ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: When it is ascertained that it exists when its cause exists, then the cause is not ascertained with respect to the effect that is to be inferred.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos ni gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas yod par rjes su dpag tu med de rtags yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos ni gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas yod par rjes su dpag tu med de rtags yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Because it is not so, therefore, a phenomenon that is a reason for something else definitely does not exist, and thus it cannot be inferred to exist. The existence of the reason is not established. This is the summary.

original: de ltar 'di yan chad kyis byed de /
analyzed: de ltar 'di yan chad kyis byed de /
translated: Up to this point, the three modes have been explained.

original: des na mthong ba dang med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum nyid la 'dus pa yin no zhes bsgrubs te rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig ces bya ba la sogs pas gsum po de'i bsgrub bya brjod do //
analyzed: des na mthong ba dang med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir tshul gsum nyid la 'dus pa yin no zhes bsgrubs te rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig ces bya ba la sogs pas gsum po de'i bsgrub bya brjod do //
translated: Thus, because of being seen and not being seen when the reason is absent, the three modes are included. This is the proof. The probandum of those three is stated by ‚Äúthe cause has as many natures as . . .‚Äù

original: des rgyu ma tshogs pas zhes bya ba dang mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas de las gzhan dag gtan tshigs ltar snang @130a * //
analyzed: des rgyu ma tshogs pas zhes bya ba dang mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas de las gzhan dag gtan tshigs ltar snang @130a * //
translated: By ‚Äúbecause of the non-assembly of the cause‚Äù and ‚Äúnot seeing in the discordant side,‚Äù and so on, the other fallacious reasons are stated.

original: bar bstan pa'i sgo nas mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rtsa ba can ldog pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can du bstan to //
analyzed: bar bstan pa'i sgo nas mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rtsa ba can ldog pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can du bstan to //
translated: The middle one is taught to be the root of the seen and unseen, preceded by the reversal, and having the root of the connection.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'brel la ngo bo ni rang bzhin la yin no zhes 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa nyid kyis bsgrubs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'brel la ngo bo ni rang bzhin la yin no zhes 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa nyid kyis bsgrubs so //
translated: The effect is connected to the nature of the cause, and the nature is connected to its own essence. This is established by the mere arrangement of the connection.

original: de ni mi 'khrul pa 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can yin yang tshad ma gang gis grub pa de brjod do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'khrul pa 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can yin yang tshad ma gang gis grub pa de brjod do //
translated: Even though that is the root of the connection of non-deception, by which valid cognition it is established, that is stated.

original: de re zhig bsgrub bya bstan pa'i rim pas dang po 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas te brjod pa ni 'o na gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de re zhig bsgrub bya bstan pa'i rim pas dang po 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas te brjod pa ni 'o na gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That is first stated in the order of the probandum, from the perspective of the effect reason, saying Well then, if...

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis rjes su 'gor ba dang ldog pa grub pa ni bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis rjes su 'gor ba dang ldog pa grub pa ni bsal ba yin no //
translated: The establishment of the invariable concomitance by the seen and unseen is the exclusion.

original: gal te du ba me'i 'bras bu yin pa de lta na yang de yod na me yod la me med na de med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid 'bras bur gyur pa 'di'i mi 'khrul pa ni de lta bu 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sumüîΩdang mi dmigs pa dag kho nas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te du ba me'i 'bras bu yin pa de lta na yang de yod na me yod la me med na de med do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid 'bras bur gyur pa 'di'i mi 'khrul pa ni de lta bu 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag kho nas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The nondeceptiveness of this kind of effect is understood by perception and nonapprehension that apprehend it in that way.

original: don gzhan ni 'bras bu nyid rgyu la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: don gzhan ni 'bras bu nyid rgyu la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya bar 'gyur mod /
translated: It is possible that another object is nondeceptive with respect to its cause.

original: mi 'khrul pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But that nondeceptiveness is the object of positive and negative concomitance.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ma rtogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gang gis 'grub /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ma rtogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gang gis 'grub /
translated: What other valid knowledge, apart from seeing and not seeing, can establish it?

original: 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul ba ma rtogs par ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul ba ma rtogs par ni de ltar rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad la /
translated: Without understanding that the effect is nondeceptive with respect to its cause, it is not tenable to posit it in that way.

original: tshad ma med par rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: tshad ma med par rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: And without valid knowledge, there is no understanding.

original: tshad ma yang der ci ji ltar bstan pa las gzhan med de /
analyzed: tshad ma yang der ci ji ltar bstan pa las gzhan med de /
translated: And what other valid knowledge is there apart from what is taught in that text?

original: des na mthong ba'i yul dang yul can 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i yul dang yul can 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no object seen and no subject whatsoever.

original: de yang rgyan gyi bdag nyid gang gis rtogs pa'i thabs bkag pas ji ltar 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul to zhes gzhan gyi don du ston par byed de /
analyzed: de yang rgyan gyi bdag nyid gang gis rtogs pa'i thabs bkag pas ji ltar 'bras bu rgyu la mi 'khrul to zhes gzhan gyi don du ston par byed de /
translated: Moreover, since the method of understanding the nature of the ornament is blocked, how could the effect not be mistaken with respect to the cause? Thus, he teaches for the sake of others.

original: des na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rten ma yin na ngu ba me la mi 'khrul ba 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: des na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rten ma yin na ngu ba me la mi 'khrul ba 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if seeing and not seeing are not the basis of positive and negative concomitance, then it is established that smoke is not mistaken with respect to fire.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon de rtogs na de'i rang bzhin las mi 'khrul bar rtogs par bya ba yin gyi tshad ma la ltos pa ni ma yin snyam du dgongs pas tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu nyid ston pa ni /üîΩ'di ltar zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon de rtogs na de'i rang bzhin las mi 'khrul bar rtogs par bya ba yin gyi tshad ma la ltos pa ni ma yin snyam du dgongs pas tshad mas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu nyid ston pa ni / 'di ltar zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: In order to refute this, the master thinks that if one understands that, one should understand that it is not mistaken with respect to its nature, but it is not dependent on valid cognition. Thus, he teaches that the nature of the effect that is understood by valid cognition is like this.

original: me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
analyzed: me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
translated: Thus, he teaches that the effect of fire is smoke.

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir te /
translated: Because the effect is concomitant with the property of the cause,

original: me'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it conforms with the nature of the effect of fire.

original: gang gi @130b 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug / ces bya ba la ltos pa na gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi @130b 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug / ces bya ba la ltos pa na gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de'i 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa nyid rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: If one says, What is the effect of that? one understands that it is the effect of that, and that it is the effect of the property that is the consequence.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni me la ltos nas du ba la yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni me la ltos nas du ba la yod do //
translated: The nature of the effect is that which exists in the smoke in dependence on the fire.

original: des na du ba me'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: des na du ba me'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the smoke is the effect of the fire.

original: de lta bu yin pa nyid ni tshad ma med par de ltar gzhag par mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa nye bar bkod pa kho nas 'brel ba ston pa'i tshad ma don gyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yin pa nyid ni tshad ma med par de ltar gzhag par mi nus pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa nye bar bkod pa kho nas 'brel ba ston pa'i tshad ma don gyis smos pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not possible to posit it in that way without a valid cognition, the valid cognition that reveals the relation is implied by the mere statement of the nature of the effect.

original: 'bras bu'i chos de yang gang zhe na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos de yang gang zhe na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: What is that property that is the effect? It is not the nature of the effect itself,

original: ngo bo med pa'i don la de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i don la de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable for a nonexistent object.

original: 'jim gong la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jim gong la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is the nature of the clay lump, etc.,

original: de ngi ltar ngo bo yin pa dang / ji ltar byed pa'i yul yin pa de ltar ni 'bras bu ma yin la ji ltar 'bras bu yin pa de ltar ni ngo bo dang byed pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de ngi ltar ngo bo yin pa dang / ji ltar byed pa'i yul yin pa de ltar ni 'bras bu ma yin la ji ltar 'bras bu yin pa de ltar ni ngo bo dang byed pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is the nature of the effect, and just as it is the object of activity, it is not the cause. Just as it is the cause, it is not the nature of the effect, nor is it the object of activity.

original: des na 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not the cause.

original: byed pa dang ma 'brel pa ni 'bras bu byed pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur la byed pa po ma yin yang dngos po byed pa gzhan dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa dang ma 'brel pa ni 'bras bu byed pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur la byed pa po ma yin yang dngos po byed pa gzhan dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not related to activity, it is not the object of activity of the effect. Even if it is not the agent, the entity is not related to another activity.

original: des nas 'bras bu byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu dang rgyu dag la bya ba 'grub bo zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des nas 'bras bu byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu dang rgyu dag la bya ba 'grub bo zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is the cause, the activity is established in the effect and the cause.

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu la ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu la ma yin no //
translated: But the cause is not in the effect.

original: 'brel pa med par ni yul dang yul can 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni yul dang yul can 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Without a relation, there is no object and subject at all.

original: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pas de dang 'brel pa nyid kyis byed pa po rnams byed pa po nyid yin 'bras bu yang byed pa po nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am 'phrod pa 'du ba yin pas de dang 'brel pa nyid kyis byed pa po rnams byed pa po nyid yin 'bras bu yang byed pa po nyid dam /
translated: Since the cause and effect are related to each other, the agents are agents by virtue of that relationship.

original: yang na ni byed pa po'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni byed pa po'i yul yang ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu la byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, since the effect is not the domain of the agent, the cause does not act on the effect.

original: byed pa nyid las de skye ba'i phyir de la de byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa nyid las de skye ba'i phyir de la de byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the effect is produced from the action itself, therefore it is the agent,

original: gal te byed pas ma reg pa'i lus can nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te byed pas ma reg pa'i lus can nyid yin na ni /
translated: if the body is not touched by the action,

original: byed pa yod na 'byung ba nyid yin pas de las skyes par brjod pa rgyu yod na 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa yod na 'byung ba nyid yin pas de las skyes par brjod pa rgyu yod na 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it is produced when the action exists, it is called produced from that. When the cause exists, it is called produced.

original: de ste reg na reg pa ji lta bu 'brel pa'o //üîΩbyed pa po yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu byed pa po ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ste reg na reg pa ji lta bu 'brel pa'o // byed pa po yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu byed pa po ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is touched, how is it touched? It is related.üîΩSince the agent is just that, the effect is not not the agent.

original: des na bya ba nyid yin gyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bya ba nyid yin gyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the action itself, not the effect.

original: des nas mtha' dag pa rtogs pa'i yan lag tu nye bar brtag pa bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bas rgyu @131a * //
analyzed: des nas mtha' dag pa rtogs pa'i yan lag tu nye bar brtag pa bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bas rgyu @131a * //
translated: Then, in order to understand the whole, one should examine the agent, action, etc.

original: 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba'i sgras yid bslus pa ni dngos po'i chos yongs su ma shes pas lhung tshabs chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba'i sgras yid bslus pa ni dngos po'i chos yongs su ma shes pas lhung tshabs chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the one who is deceived by the words ‚Äúthe cause produces the effect‚Äù falls into a great abyss because of not understanding the nature of entities.

original: byed pa yang 'bras bu ma yin pa rgyu dang 'pril  pa yin te mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa yang 'bras bu ma yin pa rgyu dang 'pril  pa yin te mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is not the effect because it is not produced.

original: byed pa'i yul ma yin par yang 'bras bu ma yin te des na snga mas thug pa med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i yul ma yin par yang 'bras bu ma yin te des na snga mas thug pa med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The effect is not the object of the cause because it is not produced. Thus, the fallacy of infinite regress is expressed by the former.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i chos ni sngon med pa phyis rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i skye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i chos ni sngon med pa phyis rang gi ngo bo yod pa'i skye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the effect is the arising of that which did not exist before and later exists in its own nature.

original: de ni rtag tu grub pa'i rang bzhin la med do /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu grub pa'i rang bzhin la med do /
translated: That does not exist for a permanent nature.

original: gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists eternally.

original: rtag par med pa nyid la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag par med pa nyid la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it exist for the impermanent,

original: dngos po med pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of one taste with nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa'i phyir med pa nyid phyis yod pa ni de las skyes so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa'i phyir med pa nyid phyis yod pa ni de las skyes so zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist in its own nature, it is said that later, when it exists, it is produced from that.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'dis rgyu med par ni mi 'thad pa des na dngos po nus pa yod pa las skyes pa'i ngo bor 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'dis rgyu med par ni mi 'thad pa des na dngos po nus pa yod pa las skyes pa'i ngo bor 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it is without a cause, as will be explained, you should assert that things are produced from an existent nature that has potential.

original: des na nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de yod pa'i phyir sngar med pa'i 'bras bu yang yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: des na nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de yod pa'i phyir sngar med pa'i 'bras bu yang yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, since that thing that has the nature of potential exists, it is also a previously nonexistent effect, and thus it is the entity of cause and effect.

original: des na nus pa yang don gyis go ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ngo po 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na nus pa yang don gyis go ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ngo po 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Thus potential is not to be understood through implication and so on, but rather it is this very nature.

original: skye ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Production is also like that.

original: des na bde bar gshegs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mu stegs gzhan dag las khyad par med de /
analyzed: des na bde bar gshegs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mu stegs gzhan dag las khyad par med de /
translated: Therefore the entity of cause and effect of the TathƒÅgatas is not different from the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'on kyang 'dir nye bar mkho ba med cing tshad ma dang mi ldan pa'i lhag pa brtags pa gang yin pa de bsal nas khas blangs pas yongs su dag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir nye bar mkho ba med cing tshad ma dang mi ldan pa'i lhag pa brtags pa gang yin pa de bsal nas khas blangs pas yongs su dag par byed pa yin no //
translated: But here, we are not concerned with that. We are concerned with the refutation of the superimpositions of those who are not authoritative, and we are concerned with the purification of the assertion of the existence of external things.

original: phyi rol gyi don smra ba'i khas blangs pa de ni de tsam nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don smra ba'i khas blangs pa de ni de tsam nyid do //
translated: The assertion of the proponents of external objects is just that.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul du 'gyur bar nus pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga ltar yang khas blang bar nus te bden pa gnyis kyi nad du 'du par rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yul du 'gyur bar nus pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga ltar yang khas blang bar nus te bden pa gnyis kyi nad du 'du par rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The assertion of the proponents of consciousness is that the object is capable of appearing to a nonerroneous consciousness.

original: gal te rnam pa de lta bu gnod pa med na ni phyi'i dngos po don dam pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa de lta bu gnod pa med na ni phyi'i dngos po don dam pa kho na'o //
translated: If such an object is not refuted, then external things are ultimately existent.

original: de ste gnod pa yod pa nyid de 'o na kyang rang gi ngo bor med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bor yod pas kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: de ste gnod pa yod pa nyid de 'o na kyang rang gi ngo bor med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ngo bor yod pas kun rdzob yin no //
translated: If it is refuted, then since it does not exist in its own nature, it exists in the nature of another, and so it is conventional.üîΩIf such an object is not refuted, then external things are ultimately existent.

original: rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pas ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa kho na ste brtags pa ni @131b gtan med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pas ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa kho na ste brtags pa ni @131b gtan med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not existent in either the ultimate or the conventional, and it is only non-existent, because the imagined is utterly non-existent.

original: med pa snang ba ni sel bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: med pa snang ba ni sel bar 'gyur ro /
translated: The appearance of the non-existent is eliminated.

original: yod pa de yang sngon yod pa dang sngon med pa gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan rnam par rtog pa med pa la snang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: yod pa de yang sngon yod pa dang sngon med pa gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan rnam par rtog pa med pa la snang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: And that existent is not capable of appearing in the absence of the two, the previously existent and the previously non-existent, because it is not a different conception. Therefore, as already explained, it is the relation of cause and effect.

original: de ltar 'bras bu skyes ba'i sngon rol du med pa yod pa'i rang bzhin thob pas dngos por gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu skyes ba'i sngon rol du med pa yod pa'i rang bzhin thob pas dngos por gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, prior to the arising of the effect, it does not obtain the nature of existence, and so it does not become a thing.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu sngar dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyis dngos po nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu sngar dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyis dngos po nyid du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the effect does not previously have the nature of a non-existent thing, and later becomes a thing.

original: 'bras bu ni sngar dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi gang zhig yod par 'gyur ba dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni sngar dngos po yod pa ma yin gyi gang zhig yod par 'gyur ba dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The effect is not a previously existent thing, nor is there any other so-called non-existent thing that comes into existence.

original: des na 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur /
analyzed: des na 'ga' yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir gang zhig gzhan du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is nothing at all, what is it that becomes something else?

original: dngos po med par grub na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par grub na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-existence were established, then it would.

original: de'i dus nyid na yod pa'i dngos po la sngar yang yod par the tshom za ba na 'di yod pa bkag pa kho nar zad kyi de'i gnas skabs na med pas sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus nyid na yod pa'i dngos po la sngar yang yod par the tshom za ba na 'di yod pa bkag pa kho nar zad kyi de'i gnas skabs na med pas sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If an existent thing existed at that time, then its existence would be doubted even previously, and so the existence of that thing would be refuted, but it would not be established as non-existent at that time.

original: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, how could it be the nature of non-existence?

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: We agree that it is not the nature of existence.

original: ji skad du dus gsum brtag pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du dus gsum brtag pa las /
translated: As the Examination of the Three Times says:

original: rten med pa'i don la ni rgyu ni gom pa 'dor ba med //
analyzed: rten med pa'i don la ni rgyu ni gom pa 'dor ba med //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of ‚Äòwithout a basis‚Äô is that there is no going.

original: de ltar na yang rgyu yod na //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rgyu yod na //
translated: Even so, if the cause exists,

original: sngon med dngos po yod par mthong //
analyzed: sngon med dngos po yod par mthong //
translated: then an entity that did not exist previously would be seen.

original: sngar de'i gnas skabs gang yin zhes //
analyzed: sngar de'i gnas skabs gang yin zhes //
translated: Previously, what was its condition?

original: 'di ni dngos la brten pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos la brten pa yin //
translated: This is based on an entity.

original: sngar de'i gnas skabs zhes bya 'dir //
analyzed: sngar de'i gnas skabs zhes bya 'dir //
translated: Previously, what was its condition?

original: gnyi ga 'ang med pa srid ma yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'ang med pa srid ma yin //
translated: Here, both are impossible.

original: gang zhig cha med rim med pa //
analyzed: gang zhig cha med rim med pa //
translated: That which is partless and without order

original: dngos po sngon ma byung rnams kyi //
analyzed: dngos po sngon ma byung rnams kyi //
translated: Is not an entity that previously did not occur.

original: bdag gis de nyid gsal ba gang //
analyzed: bdag gis de nyid gsal ba gang //
translated: What is the clarity of that reality?

original: 'di ni shin tu ya mtshan no //üîΩzhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu ya mtshan no // zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extremely amazing.üîΩThe effect depends on the prior existence of the entity. Because it exists, it does not have activity. Therefore, in the second moment, when it exists, it does not need a cause.

original: 'bras bu ltos pa sngar yod pa'i dngos po de yod pa'i phyir de la byed pa med bzhin pas skad cig gnyis pa na yod pa bdag nyid yod pa'i dus na rgyu yod mi dgos pa'i phyir shin tu bstan pa'i tshad mas de'i dus na yod pa dang
analyzed: 'bras bu ltos pa sngar yod pa'i dngos po de yod pa'i phyir de la byed pa med bzhin pas skad cig gnyis pa na yod pa bdag nyid yod pa'i dus na rgyu yod mi dgos pa'i phyir shin tu bstan pa'i tshad mas de'i dus na yod pa dang
translated: Because it is understood that it exists and does not exist at that time, it is extremely clear that valid knowledge teaches this.

original: med par rtogs pas rtag pa'am mi rtag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: med par rtogs pas rtag pa'am mi rtag kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is permanent or impermanent,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos por ni gnyi ga la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos por ni gnyi ga la yang khyad par med do //
translated: there is no difference between the two in terms of cause and effect being entities.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa 'di ltar khas len pa la ni gnod pa yod pa ma @132a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam pa 'di ltar khas len pa la ni gnod pa yod pa ma @132a * //
translated: In this way, the nature of things is accepted, and there is no fault,

original: yin la / mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: yin la / mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: and it is also seen.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / de yang rgyu'i byed pa las ma skyes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la dngos po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / de yang rgyu'i byed pa las ma skyes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the proponents of external objects, it is not tenable that what is accepted as an entity is not produced from the activity of a cause.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba las yang rig bzhin pa nyid rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rig pa'i dbang gis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba las yang rig bzhin pa nyid rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rig pa'i dbang gis mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the proponents of consciousness, it is not tenable that what is known is not by nature luminous, due to the power of luminosity.

original: kun rdzob tu de'i ngo bor gyur nas snang ba'i phyir de rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de'i ngo bor gyur nas snang ba'i phyir de rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent because it appears as its nature in the conventional.

original: de lta ma yin na ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas na rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ri bong gi rva dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas na rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would be similar to the horn of a rabbit, and therefore it is ascertained as being a transformation.

original: don dam par ni skye ba 'am 'gag pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni kun rdzob kho na'o zhes bya ba yang las dang de'i 'bras bu dang yang srid pa la sogs pa la skur ba'i phyirüîΩtshu rol mdzes pa dag pas kyang thub pa yin te mthong ba yang spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba 'am 'gag pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa tsam yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni kun rdzob kho na'o zhes bya ba yang las dang de'i 'bras bu dang yang srid pa la sogs pa la skur ba'i phyir tshu rol mdzes pa dag pas kyang thub pa yin te mthong ba yang spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Lokayatas are also refuted by the Muni, because they deny karma, its effects, rebirth, and so on.

original: thams cad kyang med par ni mi 'thad de rnam par shes pa yad par khas blangs pa rigs pas grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang med par ni mi 'thad de rnam par shes pa yad par khas blangs pa rigs pas grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also untenable that everything is nonexistent, because the existence of consciousness is accepted and is established by reasoning.

original: de bas na gzhan la skye ba dang rang bzhin 'jig pa zhes khas blangs pa 'di la re zhig rang gi ngo bos ni spyi khas blangs pa bzhin 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa rtag pa dang gtan med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir rigs pas 'thad pa
analyzed: de bas na gzhan la skye ba dang rang bzhin 'jig pa zhes khas blangs pa 'di la re zhig rang gi ngo bos ni spyi khas blangs pa bzhin 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa rtag pa dang gtan med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir rigs pas 'thad pa
translated: Therefore, this assertion that other things arise and that intrinsic nature is destroyed is untenable, because it is contradictory to assert that things exist by their own nature and that they are permanent or utterly nonexistent.

original: yang yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: yang yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: This is the position.

original: des na yod pa nyid skye bar ni mi 'thad la dngos po rnams la bya ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na yod pa nyid skye bar ni mi 'thad la dngos po rnams la bya ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is untenable that an existent thing arises. Also, things do not have action and so on.

original: des na sngar med pa yod pa nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar med pa yod pa nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of something prior to it is the arising of its existence.

original: de yang rgyu yod pa ma yin pas dngos po gzhan yod na 'byung ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu yod pa ma yin pas dngos po gzhan yod na 'byung ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Moreover, since its cause does not exist, the essence of a thing that occurs when another thing exists is its effect.

original: des na 'bras bu'i chos 'di nyid rang gi ngo bo rnam pa ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu'i tshad ma 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i chos 'di nyid rang gi ngo bo rnam pa ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu'i tshad ma 'phen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this phenomenon that is an effect is the evidence that projects its own nature in whatever way it is.

original: sngon med pa'i bdag nyid dngos po gzhan gyi nus pa la brten pa'i phyir de yod na yod pa nyid kyang 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i bdag nyid dngos po gzhan gyi nus pa la brten pa'i phyir de yod na yod pa nyid kyang 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Since the nonexistence of something prior to it is dependent on the power of another thing, its existence is also its effect.

original: des na gal te rgyu yod pa'i sngar med par rtogs pa de de yod par rtags na de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te rgyu yod pa'i sngar med par rtogs pa de de yod par rtags na de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one understands the nonexistence of something prior to it when its cause exists, then at that time one understands that it is its effect.

original: de med par yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin te phyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin te phyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is understood that it does not exist, because its nature is not perceived, because it exists later.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were the perception of something contradictory, then it would not exist at that time.

original: des na rang bzhin @132b mi dmigs pa las sngar med par rtogs pa rgyu yod na yod par rtogs pas na tshad mas rtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin @132b mi dmigs pa las sngar med par rtogs pa rgyu yod na yod par rtogs pas na tshad mas rtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the understanding of nonexistence prior to the nonperception of nature is the understanding of existence when the cause exists. Thus, the ascertainment of the causal and resultant entities that are understood by valid cognition is explained.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyir kyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyir kyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cause is the characteristic of that,‚Äù is the commentary.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ste mtshan nyid der gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ste mtshan nyid der gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object of perception, the characteristic that exists.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the characteristic of the object of perception.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de mi dmigs pa las me la sogs pa gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de mi dmigs pa las me la sogs pa gang dag dmigs na dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That which exists in that way is not perceived. That which is perceived when fire, etc. is perceived is its effect.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs pa dmigs pa de ni dag pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs pa dmigs pa de ni dag pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The object that is the characteristic of the object of apprehension is not apprehended. That which is apprehended is the effect of purification.

original: 'dir 'bras bu'i chos tshad mas dpag par bya ba'i rang bzhin du bstan gyi rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu'i chos tshad mas dpag par bya ba'i rang bzhin du bstan gyi rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the effect-phenomenon is taught to be the nature of the object of inference by valid cognition, but not its own nature.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pas ni yod pa nyid ma yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pas ni yod pa nyid ma yin par rtogs so //
translated: By the non-apprehension of the object that is the characteristic of the object of apprehension, one understands that it does not exist.

original: med pa ni gzhan dmigs na dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni gzhan dmigs na dmigs pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
translated: If the non-existent is apprehended by another apprehension, it exists.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang de yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang de yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: This is the nature of the effect, as has been taught.

original: ji srid rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin ma brjod pa de srid du rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji srid rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin ma brjod pa de srid du rnam pa de lta bu'i tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: As long as a nature like this is not stated, it is not possible to establish a valid cognition like that.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di bkod ce na //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'di bkod ce na //
translated: Then why is this stated?

original: mdor tshad ma brjod pas stong pa'i 'bras bu chos kyi tshad ma 'phen par byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor tshad ma brjod pas stong pa'i 'bras bu chos kyi tshad ma 'phen par byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In brief, it is taught in order to indicate the effect-phenomenon of valid cognition, which is empty of the stated valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar gzhan bstan pa'i 'bras bur rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan bstan pa'i 'bras bur rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: Thus, when the result is posited as the effect of teaching others,

original: ji ltar tshad mas gzhal bya 'phen pa de bzhin du gzhal byas kyang tshad ma 'phen to //
analyzed: ji ltar tshad mas gzhal bya 'phen pa de bzhin du gzhal byas kyang tshad ma 'phen to //
translated: just as the valid cognition impels the object of valid cognition, in the same way, the object of valid cognition also impels the valid cognition.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag de la ltos nas sngar yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'dir sngar yod pa tsam nyid ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag de la ltos nas sngar yod pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par med par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'dir sngar yod pa tsam nyid ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since the entire world exists prior to that, there is no difference. Here, mere prior existence is not the cause.

original: 'o na kyang sngar med par rtogs pa nyid kyis sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po de yod na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid de las 'byung ba yin la de yang de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na kyang sngar med par rtogs pa nyid kyis sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po de yod na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid de las 'byung ba yin la de yang de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: However, by the mere understanding of non-existence prior to that, if that non-existent thing exists, then that very existence arises from that, and that is its cause.

original: 'di ni 'dod rgyal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod rgyal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not arbitrary.

original: grub pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa dang gzhan dang bral ba 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: grub pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa dang gzhan dang bral ba 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: An established thing that possesses something and is devoid of something else would be arbitrary.

original: med pa nyid gang yin pa ni rang nyid 'dod rgyal bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba mi srid do //
analyzed: med pa nyid gang yin pa ni rang nyid 'dod rgyal bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba mi srid do //
translated: But that which is non-existent itself cannot arise arbitrarily, as it is said.

original: gal te dngos po gzhan gyis bsgrub pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan gyis bsgrub pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is established by another entity,

original: @133a * // de ltan yang yod ba mthong ba de nyid 'di'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @133a * // de ltan yang yod ba mthong ba de nyid 'di'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the seeing of existence would be the proof of that.

original: 'di ni sngar med pa dang de yod na yod par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar med pa dang de yod na yod par nges pa yin te /
translated: This is the certainty that it exists when it is present, and that it does not exist when it is absent.

original: des na 'di nyid gcig ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid gcig ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, one is the producer and the other is the produced.

original: gzhan bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la 'dod rgyal ba'i dan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzhan bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di la 'dod rgyal ba'i dan ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the use of the hypothesis of chance?

original: gal te bltar rung ba mi snang ba las 'gro ba mtha' dag mthong ba na snang ba'i phyir khyad par med pa kho na'o //üîΩma yin te me las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba thog ma nyid nas yod kyang yul de na yod pa'i du ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bltar rung ba mi snang ba las 'gro ba mtha' dag mthong ba na snang ba'i phyir khyad par med pa kho na'o // ma yin te me las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba thog ma nyid nas yod kyang yul de na yod pa'i du ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the entire world is seen when the visible is not seen, then there is no difference.üîΩNo, because the world other than fire exists from the beginning, but smoke that exists in that place is not seen.

original: ma yin te gang las mchod par du ba 'byung ba'i skad cig de la yod pa'i 'gro ba sngon nam phyis med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te gang las mchod par du ba 'byung ba'i skad cig de la yod pa'i 'gro ba sngon nam phyis med pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because the world that exists at the moment when smoke arises from fire does not exist before or after.

original: 'du byed skad cig ma rnams la dus gzhan du yod pa'i brgal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed skad cig ma rnams la dus gzhan du yod pa'i brgal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no argument that things that exist at another time are momentary.

original: lha rnams dga' bas skabs ma shes so //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' bas skabs ma shes so //
translated: The gods are delighted, but do not understand the occasion.

original: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi rang gi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'bras bu skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa skad cig snga ma snga ma dang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skad cig ma nyid kyis grub pa yin gyi
analyzed: 'di la dngos po rnams kyi rang gi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'bras bu skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa skad cig snga ma snga ma dang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ni skad cig ma nyid kyis grub pa yin gyi
translated: Here, the effect that follows the continuum of things is the second moment and so on, which are established as the entity that is produced and the producer by virtue of being momentary,

original: / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag dus gsum dang 'brel pa snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gags te phyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yin nam 'on te mi 'jig pa'i dang can nyid las yin /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag dus gsum dang 'brel pa snga ma rang gi ngang gis 'gags te phyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yin nam 'on te mi 'jig pa'i dang can nyid las yin /
translated: Do such things as pots that are related to the three times cease naturally prior to the later time or do they not cease?

original: de la skad cig mar sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pas na phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa grub pa yin gyi //
analyzed: de la skad cig mar sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pas na phyi ma phyi ma skye ba'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa grub pa yin gyi //
translated: Since the valid knowledge that establishes momentariness is taught, it is established that the later moments arise because of the forward pervasion.

original: mi 'jig pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi phyi ma skye ba de yang rgyu mad pa'am rjes su 'gro bzhin ba la mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu gzhan dang ldan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de lta bu'i dngos po nye bar len pa snga ma las skyes pa yin no
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi phyi ma skye ba de yang rgyu mad pa'am rjes su 'gro bzhin ba la mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu gzhan dang ldan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir de lta bu'i dngos po nye bar len pa snga ma las skyes pa yin no
translated: It is not that it does not disintegrate, but because it is untenable that the subsequent arising is a cause that is either nonexistent or possessed of another cause that is not concomitant with it, such a thing arises from the prior appropriation of the entity.

original: // rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni rgyun gzhan rtsom pa gang yin pa der yin no //
analyzed: // rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni rgyun gzhan rtsom pa gang yin pa der yin no //
translated: This analysis is in terms of the creation of another continuum.

original: gal te rgyun gyis ni gcig po 'ga' yang rtsom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyun gyis ni gcig po 'ga' yang rtsom pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is a continuum, then nothing is created as a single thing,

original: cig car med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cig car med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not exist as a single thing.

original: gcig gis brtsam bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig gis brtsam bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: If it is a single thing, then it is not created,

original: rim gyis du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rim gyis du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not multiple in a sequential manner.üîΩThis is true, but a pot and so on is manifestly established from whatever moment of the continuum of its cause, such as a potter, is about to disintegrate.

original: bden te rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyun rang gi rgyun gyi skad cig gang dang gang nye bar 'jig pa de las bum pa la sogs pa de bzhin du mngon par @133b 'grub pa de'i phyir 'jim ba dang 'khor lo dang dbyu gu dang rdza mkhan la sogs
analyzed: bden te rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyun rang gi rgyun gyi skad cig gang dang gang nye bar 'jig pa de las bum pa la sogs pa de bzhin du mngon par @133b 'grub pa de'i phyir 'jim ba dang 'khor lo dang dbyu gu dang rdza mkhan la sogs
translated: Therefore, a pot and so on is manifestly established from whatever moment of the continuum of its cause, such as clay, wheel,üîΩstick, potter, and so on, is about to disintegrate.

original: pa'i rgyun rnams rgyu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i rgyun rnams rgyu nyid du brjod do //
translated: The continuum of the effect is called the cause.

original: bum pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun 'phen par byed pa brtson par byed pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag ni rgyun de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun 'phen par byed pa brtson par byed pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag ni rgyun de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The potter, etc., are the projecting cause of the continuum of the pot, etc., because they are the active cause. Therefore, they are the reason for that continuum.

original: 'ga' zhig ni rgyun 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed nus pa ma yin pa dag ste dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang 'bar ba la sogs pa la dbang po dang bud shing la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni rgyun 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed nus pa ma yin pa dag ste dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang 'bar ba la sogs pa la dbang po dang bud shing la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: Some are not able to produce the effect that projects the continuum, like the sense-faculties and fuel, etc., in regard to the sense-consciousnesses and burning, etc.

original: rgyu de'i byed pa rgyun chad kyang 'bras bu rjes su 'jug pas bum pa la sogs pa ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad kyi bar du gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i byed pa rgyun chad kyang 'bras bu rjes su 'jug pas bum pa la sogs pa ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad kyi bar du gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even when the activity of that cause is interrupted, the effect continues, it would follow that it would endure until it meets the cause of destruction, like a pot, etc.

original: des na ji ltar mi la sogs pa dag nye bar gyur na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig so sor nges pa la mi ltos par du ba rtsom par nges pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te de las gzhan ba'i 'gro ba dag kyang
analyzed: des na ji ltar mi la sogs pa dag nye bar gyur na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig so sor nges pa la mi ltos par du ba rtsom par nges pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te de las gzhan ba'i 'gro ba dag kyang
translated: Therefore, just as smoke is definitely produced from fire, because it definitely occurs when a person and so on are nearby, without depending on the ascertainment of each moment, in the same way, if other migrations

original: yi na ni me yod pa'i sngon rol du yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: yi na ni me yod pa'i sngon rol du yang 'gyur ba'i phyir mi mtshungs so //
translated: existed, then smoke would exist prior to fire, and so it is not similar.

original: skad cig gis bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas mi 'grub pas na de 'dir dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gis bya ba ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas mi 'grub pas na de 'dir dbang du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The activity of an instant is not established by perception and nonperception, and so that is not what is being considered here.

original: ji ltar dbang du byas pa la ni khyad par yod ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang du byas pa la ni khyad par yod ba kho na'o //
translated: But when it is considered, there is a difference.

original: 'dis ni dngos po gzhan gyi rgyu las skyes pa nyid kyang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po gzhan gyi rgyu las skyes pa nyid kyang spangs pa yin te /
translated: This also rejects the claim that it is produced from a cause that is a different substantial entity,

original: me nye ba'i sngon rol du yang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me nye ba'i sngon rol du yang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be perceived prior to the presence of fire.

original: me la sogs pa dang dus mtshungs pa na yod pa'i dngos po gzhan rgyu yin na ni lhan cig byed pa bzhin du de dag mtshungs par rgyu yin pa nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po gzhan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang dus mtshungs pa na yod pa'i dngos po gzhan rgyu yin na ni lhan cig byed pa bzhin du de dag mtshungs par rgyu yin pa nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po gzhan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If another entity that exists at the same time as fire were the cause, then, like the cooperating causes, it would be a cause in the same way as fire, and it would not be a different entity.

original: 'dis ni me dang dus mtshungs par yod pa'i mi snang ba'i don rgyu yin pa nyid kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni me dang dus mtshungs par yod pa'i mi snang ba'i don rgyu yin pa nyid kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also eliminates the view that an invisible object that exists at the same time as fire is the cause,

original: de yod na yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its existence or nonexistence makes no difference to the existence or nonexistence of smoke.

original: ci dus mtshungs par yod pa rnam bsdoms te rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: ci dus mtshungs par yod pa rnam bsdoms te rgyu yin nam /
translated: Do all those that exist at the same time as fire combine to be the cause?üîΩOr is it that one of them is the cause? The following passage shows the meaning of this question:

original: 'on te gcig 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'i don 'di la nges par byed pa ston pa ni de las gcig med na yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gcig 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'i don 'di la nges par byed pa ston pa ni de las gcig med na yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If one of them is absent, smoke does not arise.

original: 'on te yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am /
translated: Or does it come from another place?

original: yod kyang sgrib pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi dbang gis ma dmigs pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: yod kyang sgrib pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi dbang gis ma dmigs pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: Or is it that, although it exists, it is not perceived because of other conditions, such as an obstruction?

original: de ni ma yin @134a * //
analyzed: de ni ma yin @134a * //
translated: That is not so.

original: te ; yul gzhan nas rim gyis 'ongs pa yul de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yul de dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol du de'i thon kor gyi yul gzhan dag dang 'brel pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: te ; yul gzhan nas rim gyis 'ongs pa yul de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yul de dang 'brel pa'i sngon rol du de'i thon kor gyi yul gzhan dag dang 'brel pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not the case that the existence of the object, which has the characteristic of being perceived, is not perceived, when it is related to a certain place, having come there gradually from another place, prior to its relation to that place.

original: yod pa nyid rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi dbang gis ma dmigs pa gang yin ba de la ni rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid rgyu mtshan gzhan gyi dbang gis ma dmigs pa gang yin ba de la ni rgyu 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that existence, which is not perceived because of the dependence on another cause, does not have any cause at all.

original: med pa nyid yod pa skyes par brjod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa nyid yod pa skyes par brjod pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not said that nonexistence is produced from existence.

original: de yang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa kho nas yin no //
analyzed: de yang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa kho nas yin no //
translated: And that is only the nonperception of what is perceptible.

original: de 'dra ba las ni 'dir grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba las ni 'dir grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been shown that it is not established here from such a cause.

original: gal te du ba yod kyang mthu dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba las de'i dus su byin gyis brlabs pa dang bral bas dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te du ba yod kyang mthu dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba las de'i dus su byin gyis brlabs pa dang bral bas dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that even though the smoke exists, it is not seen because it is empowered by the power of the blessing, and that it is perceived at that time because it is free from the blessing,

original: brjod pa 'di ni shin tu chung ste der me yang mthu dang ldan pas rnam par 'gyur ba skyed pa'i dbang pos dmigs pa yin gyi me nyid ni ma yin par 'gyur ba des na rgyu yin par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di ni shin tu chung ste der me yang mthu dang ldan pas rnam par 'gyur ba skyed pa'i dbang pos dmigs pa yin gyi me nyid ni ma yin par 'gyur ba des na rgyu yin par ga la 'gyur //
translated: This statement is very weak, because there the fire is perceived by the sense faculty that generates the transformation, and it is not the fire itself. Therefore, how could it be the cause?

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not because there is no harm,

original: mi dmigs pa la yang gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la yang gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then there is no harm even in non-apprehension.

original: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not so because inference does not depend on harm,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is because it does not depend on the object of inference.

original: 'di ni mi dmigs pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid 'phangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dmigs pa nyid la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid 'phangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because there is doubt about non-apprehension itself, so direct perception would be implied.

original: 'di skad brjod pa'i rnam par 'byed pas mi dmigs pa la de rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
