translated: Apart from the intrinsic nature of smoke, there is no so-called difference at all.

original: de yang mes bskyed pa las me ma yin pas bskyed pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang mes bskyed pa las me ma yin pas bskyed pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: And that is produced by fire, not produced by non-fire, is just different.

original: me gzhan gyis bskyed pa gzhan yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me gzhan gyis bskyed pa gzhan yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Like that produced by another fire is another.

original: des na ldog pa nyams pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na ldog pa nyams pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because the exclusion is lost, that which becomes non-cause is not produced from another.

original: de lta na 'o na 'dir mdo sde pa la khar chad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'dir mdo sde pa la khar chad pa ci yang med do //
translated: If so, then there is no fault at all for the SautrƒÅntika here.

original: 'di ltar re zhig skye ba med par smra ba ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig skye ba med par smra ba ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the proponent of non-arising is clear.

original: 'di phyi rol gyi don la dpyod pa 'gyod pa ni 'jig rten gyi blo 'ba' zhig gis yin no //
analyzed: 'di phyi rol gyi don la dpyod pa 'gyod pa ni 'jig rten gyi blo 'ba' zhig gis yin no //
translated: This analysis of external objects is only with worldly cognition.

original: de la gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs mi 'khrul par ma grub na ma grub la rag mod /
analyzed: de la gal te 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs mi 'khrul par ma grub na ma grub la rag mod /
translated: If you say that the reason of effect is not established as nonerroneous, then it is not established.

original: don dam pa'i tshul gyis dbang du byas na ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gcig pur zad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul gyis dbang du byas na ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gcig pur zad do //
translated: But if you take the ultimate mode of being into consideration, then the reason of essence alone is sufficient.

original: rang rig pa nyid mngon sum yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid mngon sum yin gyi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Self-awareness is a direct perception, but it is not produced by a sense faculty.

original: de gal te de lta na ci lan 'di kho nar bas sam zhe na /
analyzed: de gal te de lta na ci lan 'di kho nar bas sam zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIf that is so, is this the only response?,‚Äù

original: 'di kho nar bas so zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: 'di kho nar bas so zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: we do not say, ‚ÄúThis is the only response.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzu bo'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzu bo'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is an honest statement.

original: gus par bya ba ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gus par bya ba ni ma yin no /
translated: It is not something to be respected.

original: bdag cag gi ltar na ni nges par zung shig /
analyzed: bdag cag gi ltar na ni nges par zung shig /
translated: But according to us, you should definitely accept that

original: mi 'dra ba las ni de 'dra ba 'byung ba ma yin gyi de ni 'dra ba kho na las de dang 'dra bar 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las ni de 'dra ba 'byung ba ma yin gyi de ni 'dra ba kho na las de dang 'dra bar 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: a result that is different from its cause does not arise, but it is correct that a result that is similar to its cause arises from a cause that is similar to it.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo yod pa ni skye bar brjod do //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i dngos po gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo yod pa ni skye bar brjod do //
translated: If another thing that did not exist previously exists, it is said to be produced.

original: de la gang gi tshe du ba'i rang gi ngo bo me med kyang yod na ni de'i tshe 'di sngon ma byung ba ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe du ba'i rang gi ngo bo me med kyang yod na ni de'i tshe 'di sngon ma byung ba ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: de la 'di ni du ba gzhan skyes pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de la gal de la gal te 'di las skyes par grub na nge'i tshe 'di gzhan skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: de la 'di ni du ba gzhan skyes pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de la gal de la gal te 'di las skyes par grub na nge'i tshe 'di gzhan skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: In this regard, when it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the arising of another smoke,‚Äù if it is established that it arises from that, then at that time it would be called ‚Äúarising from another.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'di yod pas skyes pa de nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan nyid yin /üîΩgal te de yod @140b pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir med pa nyid de las 'byung ba yin na de'i tshe de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir 'di de'i tshe snga na med pa nyid ma yin pa des na skye
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di yod pas skyes pa de nyid ma grub pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan nyid yin / gal te de yod @140b pa nyid na yod pa'i phyir med pa nyid de las 'byung ba yin na de'i tshe de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba yin na ni gzhan las kyang 'byung ba'i phyir 'di de'i tshe snga na med pa nyid ma yin pa des na skye
translated: But when it is not established that it arises because it exists, then at that time how could it be different?

original: ba don med do zhes lhas byin gyi dpes bstan zin to //
analyzed: ba don med do zhes lhas byin gyi dpes bstan zin to //
translated: If it is nonexistent because it does not exist when that exists, then at that time it would be its cause. But if it arises from another, then at that time it is not nonexistent. Therefore, its arising is pointless. This has been explained by the example of Devadatta.

original: gal te sngar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di me la sogs pa nye ba'i sngon rol du de na med par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'di me la sogs pa nye ba'i sngon rol du de na med par rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not that you do not know that it does not exist there prior to fire, etc., because it did not have the characteristic of being perceived,‚Äù

original: rtogs pa bden mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan gyi tshe yang me med kyang yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa bden mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan gyi tshe yang me med kyang yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúIt is true that you know it, but even at another time, you would be mistaken, because you would accept that it exists even though fire does not exist.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba de nyid 'byung bar ni khas ma blangs kyi 'on kyang gzhan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'khrul par 'gyur ba de nyid 'byung bar ni khas ma blangs kyi 'on kyang gzhan nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe are not mistaken because we do not accept that it arises from that which is not a cause,‚Äù

original: yul dang dus tha dad pa las kyang dngos po tha dad par grub pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul dang dus tha dad pa las kyang dngos po tha dad par grub pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin 'ga' yang med pa ma yin nam /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúBut is it not the case that there is nothing that is not different by nature, because a difference in things is established even from a difference in place and time?‚Äù

original: des na byed pa gzhan tsam gyis mthar thug par brjod pa na /
analyzed: des na byed pa gzhan tsam gyis mthar thug par brjod pa na /
translated: Therefore, when you describe the cause as merely another action,

original: rgyu'i don du mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i don du mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the meaning of cause is not clear.

original: 'di ltar rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po yang rgyu'i byed pa'i spyod yul du gyur par srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po yang rgyu'i byed pa'i spyod yul du gyur par srid pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is possible that a thing that exists in a particular way is the object of the activity of a cause.

original: de skad cig gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad cig gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is different due to the division of instants.

original: des na 'di skad cig de sngar med par 'thad pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu'i byed pa srid pas na yod pa'i dngos po yang rgyu'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: des na 'di skad cig de sngar med par 'thad pa'i phyir de la yang rgyu'i byed pa srid pas na yod pa'i dngos po yang rgyu'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, since it is tenable that that which is not previously existent is an instant, it is possible that the function of a cause exists in that which is not previously existent. Therefore, an existent thing is only concomitant with a cause,

original: skad cig gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is different due to the division of instants.

original: de'i phyir du ba mtha' dag me yod pa nyid na yod pa yin na de nyid las sngon med pa yod pa 'thob par gzhung gzugs par 'thad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba mtha' dag me yod pa nyid na yod pa yin na de nyid las sngon med pa yod pa 'thob par gzhung gzugs par 'thad kyi /
translated: Therefore, if all smoke exists only when fire exists, then it is tenable to posit that which is not previously existent as existent due to that.

original: gzhan dag gzhan las kyang 'byung na ni sngar med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gzhan las kyang 'byung na ni sngar med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it arose from another, it would not be that which is not previously existent.

original: des na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is rejected that that which is similar arises from that which is dissimilar.

original: skad cig sngon med pa nyid kyis sngon med pa'i phyir rgyus byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig sngon med pa nyid kyis sngon med pa'i phyir rgyus byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not that a cause is able to produce that which is not previously existent due to the fact that it is not previously existent,

original: rigs mthun pa'i skad cig dang po la brten pa skye ba yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i skad cig dang po la brten pa skye ba yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of the first instant of a homogeneous type is also established.

original: gzhan las rnam pa thams cad du du ba mi 'byung ba ni de'i rgyun 'jug pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir de skye bar thal ba kho na 'o //
analyzed: gzhan las rnam pa thams cad du du ba mi 'byung ba ni de'i rgyun 'jug pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir de skye bar thal ba kho na 'o //
translated: But it is not the case that smoke never arises from anything else, because the continuum of that is not established.

original: du ba tsam la ltos pa'i yod pa snga na med par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba tsam la ltos pa'i yod pa snga na med par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence that depends on mere smoke is said to be prior nonexistence.

original: 'on te 'di ltar ma brten par nges pa'i du ba la ltos na sngon med pa nyid du brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar ma brten par nges pa'i du ba la ltos na sngon med pa nyid du brjod na /
translated: But if it is said that prior nonexistence depends on smoke that is ascertained without depending on that,

original: de ni skad cig la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni skad cig la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that it is momentary.

original: @141a * // gsal ba tsam la brten nas nges pa mthar phyin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @141a * // gsal ba tsam la brten nas nges pa mthar phyin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that ascertainment is completed in dependence on mere manifestation,

original: 'di ni skad cig mthar thug pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig mthar thug pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would be momentary and final.

original: skad cig ni rang bzhin nye bar len pa tsam las skye bar grub pas na rgyu gzhan don med do zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ni rang bzhin nye bar len pa tsam las skye bar grub pas na rgyu gzhan don med do zhe na /
translated: Since it is established that a moment arises from the mere appropriation of its nature, another cause is pointless.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gnyi ga yod pa ni sngon med pa'i skad cig de yod pa na skal pa mnyam pa'i skad cig snga ma nyid rgyu yin gyi dngos po gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa gnyi ga yod pa ni sngon med pa'i skad cig de yod pa na skal pa mnyam pa'i skad cig snga ma nyid rgyu yin gyi dngos po gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both similar and dissimilar things exist, because when the prior moment of the state of similarity exists, the prior moment of the state of similarity is the cause, but it is not established that another thing is the cause.

original: rgyu la rgyu'i ngo bo gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na gang gi skal ba mnyam pa 'di nyid las nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu la rgyu'i ngo bo gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na gang gi skal ba mnyam pa 'di nyid las nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur /
translated: If the cause has no other nature of cause, then how could it be ascertained that this state of similarity is the cause and not another?

original: de yod na sngon med pa'i don yod pa nyid nus pa yin gyi skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na sngon med pa'i don yod pa nyid nus pa yin gyi skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If it exists, then the existence of the prior nonexistence of the object is the capacity, but not another nature like momentariness.

original: des na 'di ni du ba gnyis la yang yod pa na du ba so sor khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ni du ba gnyis la yang yod pa na du ba so sor khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when it exists in both smokes, it does not distinguish the individual smokes.

original: des na 'di ji ltar skad cig snga ma'i rgyu can du 'gyur /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar skad cig snga ma'i rgyu can du 'gyur /
translated: How then could it be the cause of the prior moment?

original: des na gal te du ba tsam la ltos te snga na med pa nyid yin na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na gal te du ba tsam la ltos te snga na med pa nyid yin na mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, if nonexistence prior to the effect is in dependence on mere smoke, then something similar does not arise from something dissimilar.

original: de ste khyad par la brten pa yin na rgyu gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang bral na skad cig snga ma skad cig gnyis pa tsam gyi rgyur nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ste khyad par la brten pa yin na rgyu gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang bral na skad cig snga ma skad cig gnyis pa tsam gyi rgyur nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is in dependence on a particular, then, if it is devoid of following after another cause, the prior moment is not able to be the cause of the mere second moment.

original: 'o na rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the correct explanation?

original: du ba tsam la ltos te rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: du ba tsam la ltos te rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of nonexistence prior to the effect in dependence on mere smoke.

original: gzhan de ji ltar du ba yin pa de bzhin du de'i 'bras bur yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan de ji ltar du ba yin pa de bzhin du de'i 'bras bur yang ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would it not be the case that just as it is smoke, so it is its effect?

original: 'on te du ba nyid las khyad par med par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te du ba nyid las khyad par med par mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept that it is the same as smoke,

original: de'i rigs pa brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de'i rigs pa brjod dgos te /
translated: you must state the correct explanation.

original: rgyu mtshan med par ni khas blangs pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par ni khas blangs pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: You cannot establish a position without a reason.

original: 'di la yang nges pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la yang nges pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the certainty here?

original: 'di ni 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mes skyed pa'i du ba gang yin pa de ni skad cig nyid kyis log pa des na de me med pas med par 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir de las gcig med na yang med pa zhes ji skad brjod pa de ni de med
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mes skyed pa'i du ba gang yin pa de ni skad cig nyid kyis log pa des na de me med pas med par 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i phyir de las gcig med na yang med pa zhes ji skad brjod pa de ni de med
translated: Therefore, since the fire that produces smoke ceases due to momentariness, it is impossible for the smoke to be absent when the fire is absent.

original: pas med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gsal te /
analyzed: pas med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gsal te /
translated: Therefore, it is clear that the statement ‚ÄúIf one of them is absent, the other is also absent‚Äù is untenable, because the absence of one is not tenable in the absence of the other.

original: gal te du ba me las gzhan pa dag las kyang 'byung ba me med par yod par gzhan yang du ba nyid yin pas du ba snga ma bzhin gzhan las kyang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te du ba me las gzhan pa dag las kyang 'byung ba me med par yod par gzhan yang du ba nyid yin pas du ba snga ma bzhin gzhan las kyang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If smoke arose from something other than fire, it would exist without fire, and since it is smoke, it would also arise from something other than fire, just as the previous smoke did.

original: des na tha dad pa yan lag tu ma @141b byas par du ba tsam yod pa yang me med par yod na /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa yan lag tu ma @141b byas par du ba tsam yod pa yang me med par yod na /
translated: Therefore, if mere smoke exists without fire, without being a part of fire,

original: de'i yod pa snga na med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yod pa snga na med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be the case that it exists only when the other exists.

original: des na me gcig nyid las sngar ma mthong pa'i du ba dmigs pa na me med na med do zhes du ba thams cad nges par byed do //
analyzed: des na me gcig nyid las sngar ma mthong pa'i du ba dmigs pa na me med na med do zhes du ba thams cad nges par byed do //
translated: Therefore, when one observes smoke that was not seen before in the presence of fire, one ascertains that all smoke is absent when fire is absent.

original: de'i phyir mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba skye bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba skye bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that something similar arises from something dissimilar.

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Something similar arises from something similar.

original: des na de ltar du ba gzhan me ma yin pa las 'byung bar smras pa la /
analyzed: des na de ltar du ba gzhan me ma yin pa las 'byung bar smras pa la /
translated: Thus, when you say that smoke arises from fire,üîΩhow can something dissimilar arise from something similar?

original: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra ba yin zhes skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo nges par gzung ba nyid lan du btab pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra ba yin zhes skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo nges par gzung ba nyid lan du btab pa yin no //
translated: The response is that the nature of arising is ascertained.

original: sun dbyung ba gzhan dag kyang bshad pa ni mi 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩme ma yin pa las kyang du ba 'byung na me de dag gis du ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de'i nges pa gzhan la med pa'i snying po can gyis de la yod pa de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba gzhan dag kyang bshad pa ni mi 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba yin no // me ma yin pa las kyang du ba 'byung na me de dag gis du ba skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de'i nges pa gzhan la med pa'i snying po can gyis de la yod pa de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Other refutations are also explained:üîΩIf smoke arose from something that is not fire, then the power to produce smoke would not be ascertained in fire, because it would exist in that which is not fire.

original: me ma yin pa las kyang du ba skye bas de la yang nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las kyang du ba skye bas de la yang nus pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since smoke arises from that which is not fire, the power to produce smoke would be established in that which is not fire.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa ma nges pa de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba zhes 'di'i gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa ma nges pa de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dra ba las de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba zhes 'di'i gtan tshigs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because the potency is not ascertained, therefore the reason stated here is ‚Äúfrom a dissimilar cause, an effect dissimilar to it arises.‚Äù

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba 'byung na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba 'byung na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because there is no certainty, it is said ‚Äúif an effect dissimilar to it arises.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na ni rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis na mtha' dag gi sna tshogs rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis na mtha' dag gi sna tshogs rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the reason ‚Äúbecause the difference of the cause does not make a difference‚Äù would mean that all variety is causeless.

original: 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur te /
translated: The variety of the world would be causeless,

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for the difference.

original: du ba'i rang bzhin ni du ba ma yin pa las log pa yin no //
analyzed: du ba'i rang bzhin ni du ba ma yin pa las log pa yin no //
translated: The nature of smoke is the opposite of what is not smoke.

original: 'di'i tha dad pa de mes ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad pa de mes ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference of that is not made by fire,

original: me ma yin pa las kyang ldog pa de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las kyang ldog pa de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opposite of what is not fire also exists.

original: des na 'di'i du ba ma yin pa las tha dad pa 'di me'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di'i du ba ma yin pa las tha dad pa 'di me'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference of this smoke from what is not smoke is not the reason for fire.

original: des na 'thad pa rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'thad pa rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: gal te du ba de'i tha dad pa ni me ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la mes skyed pa'i tha dad pa ni me'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te du ba de'i tha dad pa ni me ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin la mes skyed pa'i tha dad pa ni me'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it that the difference of smoke from that is due to a cause that is not fire, and the difference of that which is produced by fire from fire is not due to a cause that is fire?

original: des na ji ltar rgyu med pa can nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rgyu med pa can nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How then can it be causeless?

original: 'di la du ba gzhan la yang so sor du ba nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la du ba gzhan la yang so sor du ba nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the difference of smoke from another is not due to smoke itself.

original: 'dir 'thad pa'i khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir 'thad pa'i khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference in the reason?

original: sngon med pa yod pa'i mtshan @142a * //
analyzed: sngon med pa yod pa'i mtshan @142a * //
translated: The reason is the nature of arising, which is the characteristic of existence that did not exist before.

original: nyid kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin la brten nas de dang 'dra ba las de dang 'dra bar skye bar bshad la /
analyzed: nyid kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin la brten nas de dang 'dra ba las de dang 'dra bar skye bar bshad la /
translated: On the basis of that, it is explained that something similar arises from something similar.

original: tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par bshad do //
translated: But difference is explained as the absence of invariable concomitance.

original: gal te du bas bskyed pa'i du ba yang du ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: gal te du bas bskyed pa'i du ba yang du ba kho na yin la /
translated: If the smoke that is produced by smoke is only smoke,

original: mes bskyed pa yang yin na tha dad pa rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mes bskyed pa yang yin na tha dad pa rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and it is also produced by fire, then difference is not causeless.

original: des na me ma yin pa las skyes pa la yang ci ste 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na me ma yin pa las skyes pa la yang ci ste 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, why is it not the case that smoke arises from what is not fire?

original: ma yin te rgyun nyid kyi rgyu la ltos nas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rgyun nyid kyi rgyu la ltos nas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the continuum itself is the cause, and the characteristics as explained are demonstrated in dependence on that.

original: du ba tsam gyi rgyu ni du ba'i rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba tsam gyi rgyu ni du ba'i rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of mere smoke is the cause of the continuum of smoke.

original: de lta bu'i du ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu la ni 'bras bu'i chos ji skad bshad pa las 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i du ba'i rgyun gyi rgyu la ni 'bras bu'i chos ji skad bshad pa las 'da' ba med do //
translated: The cause of the continuum of smoke in that way is not beyond the characteristics of the effect as explained.

original: skad cig ni skad cig gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ni skad cig gzhan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An instant is not the cause of another instant.

original: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu'i skyed par byed pa nyid ni me las mi ldog go //
analyzed: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu'i skyed par byed pa nyid ni me las mi ldog go //
translated: The producer of smoke that is produced by smoke is not different from fire.

original: 'di ltar re zhig du ba'i rnam pa ni mes skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig du ba'i rnam pa ni mes skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: In this way, the aspect of smoke is produced by fire alone.

original: gal te de'i dus dang yul dag tu yang 'gyur ba yin pa de lta na yang skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i dus dang yul dag tu yang 'gyur ba yin pa de lta na yang skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Even if it were to be different in terms of time and place, it would still be the producer.

original: du bas du ba skyed par byed pa na mes kyang du ba skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: du bas du ba skyed par byed pa na mes kyang du ba skyed par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: When smoke produces smoke, fire also produces smoke.

original: des na yul de dang dus der yang skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yul de dang dus der yang skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, at that place and time, it is not devoid of the power to produce.

original: gal te skad cig des bskyed par mes ma bskyed pa ma yin nam bden te /
analyzed: gal te skad cig des bskyed par mes ma bskyed pa ma yin nam bden te /
translated: If it is not produced by that moment of fire, isn‚Äôt it not produced by fire? That is true.

original: mi gzhan gyis bskyed pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mi gzhan gyis bskyed pa yang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But it is not produced by another person.

original: 'on kyang rgyun gyi rgyu du ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu las mi 'da' ba des na du ba me la mi 'khrul par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyun gyi rgyu du ba'i rnam pa'i rgyu las mi 'da' ba des na du ba me la mi 'khrul par brjod do //
translated: However, it does not go beyond being the cause of the continuum and the cause of the aspect of smoke. Therefore, it is said that smoke is not mistaken with respect to fire.

original: rgyun yun ring du gnas kyang de dang ldan pa 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can las 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun yun ring du gnas kyang de dang ldan pa 'phen par byed pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu can las 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though the continuum endures for a long time, it does not go beyond being the effect that is projected by the cause that possesses it and the cause that produces it.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni thams cad las dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni thams cad las dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Another fault is stated: Everything would be produced from everything.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: du ba nyid kyis kyang khyad par med pa'i du ba ma yin pa las kyang 'byung na ni de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa me las tha dad do cog du bskyed par byed pa la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa me ma yin pas bsgrub par bya
analyzed: du ba nyid kyis kyang khyad par med pa'i du ba ma yin pa las kyang 'byung na ni de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa me las tha dad do cog du bskyed par byed pa la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa me ma yin pas bsgrub par bya
translated: If smoke itself were to arise from non-fire, which is not different from fire, then at that time, all that is different from fire, such as a pot, would be generated by fire.

original: ba yang mes byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba yang mes byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the establishment of the object to be established by non-fire, such as the holder of water, would be done by fire.

original: gal te gang gis gdon mi za bar byed par 'gyur pa me ma yin pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa 'am me ma yin pa me'i @142b bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa nges pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis gdon mi za bar byed par 'gyur pa me ma yin pa'i bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa 'am me ma yin pa me'i @142b bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa nges pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThere is no certainty that non-fire establishes the object to be established or that non-fire establishes the object to be established by fire,‚Äù

original: med mod nges par med pa 'ga' zhig ni byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med mod nges par med pa 'ga' zhig ni byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then although there is no certainty, something that does not exist would be established.

original: 'on te 'ga' yang mi byed na ni 'o na yang gi bsgrub bya la nges pa'i dngos po rnams kyi bsgrub bya mi byed par 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' yang mi byed na ni 'o na yang gi bsgrub bya la nges pa'i dngos po rnams kyi bsgrub bya mi byed par 'grub bo //
translated: But if nothing is established, then the object to be established by the reason would not be established.

original: 'on te 'di rang gi bsgrub bya la yang rang bzhin 'di kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di rang gi bsgrub bya la yang rang bzhin 'di kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if one says, ‚ÄúThis is its nature with regard to its own object to be established,‚Äù

original: des rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be causeless.

original: des na 'di rang gi bsgrub bya sgrub pa ltar gzhan gyi bsgrub bya yang sgrub par thal bas na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di rang gi bsgrub bya sgrub pa ltar gzhan gyi bsgrub bya yang sgrub par thal bas na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as this establishes its own probandum, it would also establish the probandum of others. Thus, everything would arise from everything.

original: de lta yin dang mi 'dod pa spong bar 'dod pa dag 'dod pa nyid thob pa'i 'bras bus tha snyad byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mi 'dod pa spong bar 'dod pa dag 'dod pa nyid thob pa'i 'bras bus tha snyad byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, those who wish to abandon what is undesirable would not engage in the activity of obtaining what is desirable.

original: yang na thams cad las thams cad skye ba ma yin no //üîΩde lta na yang 'bras bu 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams las gzhan las mi skye bar ma nges pas na gang gis 'di 'dor ba dang / len pa nges pa'i yul can du nges par 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na thams cad las thams cad skye ba ma yin no // de lta na yang 'bras bu 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams las gzhan las mi skye bar ma nges pas na gang gis 'di 'dor ba dang / len pa nges pa'i yul can du nges par 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or else, everything would not arise from everything.

original: 'dod pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes ga las yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes ga las yin /
translated: Even if that were the case, since it is not ascertained that the effect of error does not arise from causes other than those, then how could one ascertain that the object of the one who rejects and accepts is the effect of what is desirable or that it is the effect of what is undesirable?

original: de lta pas na rgyu tha dad pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta pas na rgyu tha dad pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the effect is different from different causes.

original: rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa las ni 'bras bu tha dad pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: But from a non-different cause, there is a non-different effect.

original: de ltar zhar la byung ba nye bar bsdus te /
analyzed: de ltar zhar la byung ba nye bar bsdus te /
translated: Thus, having inserted a digression,

original: de bas na zhes skabs nyid du mjug sdud do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes skabs nyid du mjug sdud do //
translated: he concludes the topic:

original: du ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i don las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: du ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i don las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Smoke does not arise from a dissimilar object, because of the appearance of smoke and because of the non-existence of smoke.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to arise from a dissimilar object, it would arise without a cause.

original: 'ga' zhig yod pa dang ldan pa na sngon ma byung ba yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod pa dang ldan pa na sngon ma byung ba yod pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: When something exists, its prior non-existence does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'di don yod pa na yang yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i yod pa de sngon ma byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di don yod pa na yang yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i yod pa de sngon ma byung ba ma yin no //
translated: If it were to exist when the object exists, then its existence would not be prior non-existence.

original: gzhan las du ba gzhan 'byung ba yin yang gzhan nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las du ba gzhan 'byung ba yin yang gzhan nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Even though smoke arises from another, another is not a part,

original: gdon mi za bar yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it necessarily exists.

original: du ba nyid yod pa'i phyir na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams pa des na /
analyzed: du ba nyid yod pa'i phyir na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams pa des na /
translated: Because smoke itself exists, its prior non-existence is lost.

original: skye ba'i don 'jig par rgyu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba'i don 'jig par rgyu med pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising‚Äù is the absence of a cause for destruction.

original: me la sogs pa'i sngon rol du rtogs pa med pa'i du ba de sngon du 'gro bas rang gi ngo bo thob par rtogs pas ni don gzhan las 'byung ba sel ba'i phyir mthong ba'i rnam pa dang @143a * //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i sngon rol du rtogs pa med pa'i du ba de sngon du 'gro bas rang gi ngo bo thob par rtogs pas ni don gzhan las 'byung ba sel ba'i phyir mthong ba'i rnam pa dang @143a * //
translated: Smoke is not perceived prior to fire, etc., but it is perceived as having obtained its own nature, which is preceded by fire, etc. Therefore, since the origination from another entity is eliminated, the form that is seen

original: rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung bar grub pas 'khrul pa med par grub bo //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung bar grub pas 'khrul pa med par grub bo //
translated: and the form that is not of a homogeneous kind are established as not originating. Thus, the non-erroneous establishment is proven.

original: gal te mthong ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bur grub na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bur grub na /
translated: If the form that is seen and the form that is not of a homogeneous kind are established as not originating,

original: mi 'khrul par rtogs pa zhig na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul par rtogs pa zhig na /
translated: then there is the understanding of non-erroneous cognition.

original: 'di ni me ma yin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mtha' dag ma mthong ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni me ma yin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mtha' dag ma mthong ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible that the entire nature of non-fire is not seen.

original: ci ste lan cig nyid sngon ma byung ba yod par dmigs pas 'bras bu nyid du rtogs na de ni med de /
analyzed: ci ste lan cig nyid sngon ma byung ba yod par dmigs pas 'bras bu nyid du rtogs na de ni med de /
translated: If it is observed that the existence of something that has not occurred before is the effect, then that is not the case,

original: me ma yin pa la yang de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me ma yin pa la yang de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen in the case of non-fire as well.

original: 'on te de ltar na rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, it follows that it is causeless,

original: de gnyi gar yang du ba sngon med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyi gar yang du ba sngon med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because neither of those two is a previously nonexistent smoke.

original: shin tu gsal bar lan cig mthong ba'i 'bras bur mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar lan cig mthong ba'i 'bras bur mi 'grub ste /
translated: It is not very clear that it is the effect of that,

original: rgyu med pa yin yang de'i rjes thogs su yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin yang de'i rjes thogs su yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists immediately after that even though it is causeless.

original: des na ci 'di gang las de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba de nyid las rjes thogs su byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: des na ci 'di gang las de'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba de nyid las rjes thogs su byung ba yin nam /
translated: Therefore, how is it that it is the effect of that from which it arises immediately?

original: de ste gang gis rgyu med kyang 'di'i de ma thag tu yod par 'gyur ba gzhan yang 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes the tshom za ba na /
analyzed: de ste gang gis rgyu med kyang 'di'i de ma thag tu yod par 'gyur ba gzhan yang 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes the tshom za ba na /
translated: Or, if it is not the effect of that, then it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else, because it exists immediately after that even though it is causeless.

original: gsal ba gzhan la med par dmigs pa la /üîΩltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la med par dmigs pa la / ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is observed without depending on another cause.üîΩThus, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas 'bras bu nyid du gtan la phebs pa ma yin no zhes dogs na /üîΩde lta ma yin na zhes smos te /
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas 'bras bu nyid du gtan la phebs pa ma yin no zhes dogs na / de lta ma yin na zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.üîΩTherefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else.

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, it is doubtful whether it is the effect of something else

original: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur /üîΩrgyu med pa'i don dang 'bral ba'i yod pa'am /
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur / rgyu med pa'i don dang 'bral ba'i yod pa'am /
translated: It would always exist or not exist.

original: med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi res 'ga' bar ni ma yin no//
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de ni rtag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi res 'ga' bar ni ma yin no//
translated: That which exists or does not exist without a cause would be permanent, not occasional.

original: me ma yin pa las 'byung ba rgyu med par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las 'byung ba rgyu med par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It would not be the cause of fire, because it would be without a cause, like what is not fire.

original: gang gis lan cig de ltar mthong ba yang de ltar 'gyur srid pa'i phyir me'i rgyu can du mi nges par 'gyur ba de lta na ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis lan cig de ltar mthong ba yang de ltar 'gyur srid pa'i phyir me'i rgyu can du mi nges par 'gyur ba de lta na ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were possible that what is seen in one place could exist elsewhere in the same way, then it would not be ascertained that it has fire as its cause. But that is not possible.

original: gang gis 'di 'ga' zhig gi rjes thogs su 'gyur ba rgyu med par yod pa ni sngon med par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di 'ga' zhig gi rjes thogs su 'gyur ba rgyu med par yod pa ni sngon med par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that what exists without a cause at a certain time existed previously without a cause.

original: gal te 'di'i der 'gyur na ni rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i der 'gyur na ni rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were to become that, it would be permanent.

original: yang na ni nam yang ma yin par 'gyur gyi 'di sngon med pa las me yod na 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni nam yang ma yin par 'gyur gyi 'di sngon med pa las me yod na 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, it would never be that, because it would not be tenable that it exists without a cause.

original: des na gang zhig de ltar dmigs pa de ni me'i 'bras bu @143b yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na mthong ba gzhan la ltos pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: des na gang zhig de ltar dmigs pa de ni me'i 'bras bu @143b yin pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na mthong ba gzhan la ltos pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is the effect of fire, it is seen by us, and there is no opportunity for seeing it in dependence on another.

original: yang ji ltar na rgyu med pa yin na yod pa dang med pa dag rtag pa kho nar 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rgyu med pa yin na yod pa dang med pa dag rtag pa kho nar 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Again, if it is causeless, why would existence and nonexistence be permanent?

original: rgyu med pa'i don ni gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i don ni gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcauseless‚Äù is that it does not depend on another.

original: ltos pa med pa'i yod pa dang med pa res 'ga' ba ma yin par ston pas /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i yod pa dang med pa res 'ga' ba ma yin par ston pas /
translated: Since existence and nonexistence that do not depend on another are not intermittent,

original: res 'ga' ba nyid ltos pas byas par ston pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid ltos pas byas par ston pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the statement ‚ÄúThings that are intermittent are made by dependence‚Äù is made.

original: du ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: du ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf smoke were independent of its cause‚Äù is the commentary.

original: du ba rgyu la ltos pa med pa yin na ni nam yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur te gtan du 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: du ba rgyu la ltos pa med pa yin na ni nam yang mi 'byung bar mi 'gyur te gtan du 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If smoke were independent of its cause, it would never not occur, it would occur permanently.

original: / rgyu med pa tsam kho nas ni gtan du 'byung ba ma yin pas na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: / rgyu med pa tsam kho nas ni gtan du 'byung ba ma yin pas na ni zhes smos so //
translated: Since it does not occur permanently merely due to causelessness, ‚Äúif‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te rgyu med par yod pa yin na ni gtan du yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med par yod pa yin na ni gtan du yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it existed without a cause, it would exist forever.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: dngos po de 'byung ba la thams cad du ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de 'byung ba la thams cad du ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the occurrence of that thing is never incomplete.

original: des na ji ltar yod par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gtan du de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar yod par 'dod pa'i dus bzhin du gtan du de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would always exist just as it is supposed to exist.

original: dus gzhan du yang 'di yod pa'i yul can gyi ma tshang ba ni med do //
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang 'di yod pa'i yul can gyi ma tshang ba ni med do //
translated: There is no incompleteness in the domain of its existence at another time.

original: gal te gang las de'i tshe med par 'gyur ba 'di'i ma tshang ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe yod pa'i dus bzhin du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang las de'i tshe med par 'gyur ba 'di'i ma tshang ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de'i tshe yod pa'i dus bzhin du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were some incompleteness in it at that time, from which it would not exist, then it would not occur just as it is supposed to exist at the time of its existence.

original: ji ltar ma tshang ba med ce na ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ma tshang ba med ce na ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it not incomplete? Because it is independent.

original: 'di yod pa ni yin la ltos pa yang yod pa ma yin pa des na gang gis gzhan gyi tshe ma tshang bas mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di ma tshad ba nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod pa ni yin la ltos pa yang yod pa ma yin pa des na gang gis gzhan gyi tshe ma tshang bas mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di ma tshad ba nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It exists and it is not dependent on anything else. Therefore, it is never incomplete, by which it would not occur at another time.

original: gang zhig gzhan la ltos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de'i ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan la ltos pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de'i ni /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúdependent on another‚Äù

original: ltos par bya ba yod pa ni tshang ba yin la de las bzlog pa ni bzlog par 'gyur gyi ltos pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba yod pa ni tshang ba yin la de las bzlog pa ni bzlog par 'gyur gyi ltos pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: is complete when the object of dependence exists, and it is reversed when that is reversed, but it is not independent.

original: des na de ltar rgyu med pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtag tu yod par brjod nas rtag tu med par bshad pa ni yang na ni 'dod pa'i dus de'i tshe yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ltar rgyu med pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro // rtag tu yod par brjod nas rtag tu med par bshad pa ni yang na ni 'dod pa'i dus de'i tshe yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in that way, because of being independent without a cause,üîΩhaving been described as permanent existence, it is explained as permanent non-existence.

original: dus gzhan du na re zhig 'byung ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du na re zhig 'byung ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If it were to arise at the time of desire, it would not arise at all at another time.

original: 'dod pa'i dus su yang med par thal ba'i phyir ni rtag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dus su yang med par thal ba'i phyir ni rtag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the consequence of non-existence at the time of desire, it would be permanent non-existence.

original: med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ni med pa'i dus dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ni med pa'i dus dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the reason for non-existence is ‚Äúbecause there is no difference from the time of non-existence.‚Äù

original: dus gang du dngos po'i rgyu yod pa der de @144a * //
analyzed: dus gang du dngos po'i rgyu yod pa der de @144a * //
translated: At whatever time the cause of an existent thing exists,

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir dus gzhan du mi 'byung ba yin na rgyu med pa la ni yod pa'i dus su rgyu med la med pa'i dus su yang med pa'i phyir na thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir dus gzhan du mi 'byung ba yin na rgyu med pa la ni yod pa'i dus su rgyu med la med pa'i dus su yang med pa'i phyir na thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not occur at another time because it changes, then since it does not exist when it exists, and it does not exist when it does not exist, it is nonexistent.

original: des na 'di ji ltar med pa'i dus su mi 'byung ba de bzhin du yod pa'i dus su yang mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar med pa'i dus su mi 'byung ba de bzhin du yod pa'i dus su yang mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, just as it does not occur when it does not exist, it would not exist when it exists.

original: de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi tshe yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyi tshe yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, it would occur at another time in the same way.

original: des na rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it would always exist or never exist.

original: gal te rgyu dang ldan par thal ba'i phyir rgyu med pa dus la yang ltos pa med pa ma yin nam de ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dus kyi khyad par gyis khyad par med pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par brjod ce na
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang ldan par thal ba'i phyir rgyu med pa dus la yang ltos pa med pa ma yin nam de ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag dus kyi khyad par gyis khyad par med pas rtag tu yod pa'am med par brjod ce na
translated: But if it is not independent of time because it follows that it has a cause, then how can you say that it always exists or never exists, since existence and nonexistence are not distinguished by time?

original: / dus chos dang ldan pas rang nyid kyis bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / dus chos dang ldan pas rang nyid kyis bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Time is not taught by itself as possessing attributes.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a metaphor.

original: des na des nye bar mtshon pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa nying khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na des nye bar mtshon pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa nying khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the entity and non-entity illustrated by that are not distinguished.

original: rgyu med pa 'di la ni ltos par bya ba'i rgyu med pa nges na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa 'di la ni ltos par bya ba'i rgyu med pa nges na /
translated: If this causelessness is ascertained as having no cause to depend on,

original: da ltar bzhin thams cad du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar bzhin thams cad du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then everything would be just as it is now,

original: yang na sngon bzhin nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na sngon bzhin nam yang ma yin no //
translated: or else it would never be as it was before.

original: gal te rgyu dang ldan pa dag ni de yod na rang gi ngo bo 'thob la /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang ldan pa dag ni de yod na rang gi ngo bo 'thob la /
translated: If things that have a cause obtain their own nature when that exists,

original: de med na ma yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid de /
analyzed: de med na ma yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid de /
translated: and do not when it does not, then they are occasional.

original: res 'ga' kho na rgyu byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' kho na rgyu byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sometimes the cause exists.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ltos pa med pa res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ltos pa med pa res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, the proof of non-occasionality would not be without dependence.

original: des na rgyu med pa rgyu res 'ga' ba nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na rgyu med pa rgyu res 'ga' ba nyid kyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, causelessness is not like that due to the occasional nature of the cause.

original: de ltar na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rgyu med pa yin pa de bzhin du res 'ga' ba yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rgyu med pa yin pa de bzhin du res 'ga' ba yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, just as its own nature is causeless, so too it would be occasional.

original: 'di res 'ga' ba nyid kyi rigs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di res 'ga' ba nyid kyi rigs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What kind of reasoning is this, that it is sometimes the case?

original: rang gi ngo bo la yang brgal zhing rtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la yang brgal zhing rtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: The objection and the demonstration of the same error apply to the intrinsic reality of things as well.

original: de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa med pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis ni mi 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa med pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis ni mi 'thad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that it is not tenable because of the absence of a positing agent.

original: de ltar na rtog ge'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de ltar na rtog ge'i spyod yul du mi 'gyur gyi //
translated: In that case, it would not be the domain of rational inquiry.

original: de tsam gyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not the case that it does not exist merely because of that.

original: ltos pa res 'ga' ba'i sgrub byed du smras pa 'di res 'ga' ba'i khyab byar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ltos pa res 'ga' ba'i sgrub byed du smras pa 'di res 'ga' ba'i khyab byar 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that the argument for the occasional is that it is dependent, then the pervasion would be that whatever is occasional is dependent.

original: khyab par bya ba med pas ni khyab par byed pa med pa ma yin no zhe na brjod pa /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba med pas ni khyab par byed pa med pa ma yin no zhe na brjod pa /
translated: But if there is no pervasion, then there is no pervasion.

original: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: dngos po ltos pa'i de yod na rang gi ngo bo yod pa la ltos pa'i don lhag pa gzhan ni med @144b do //
analyzed: dngos po ltos pa'i de yod na rang gi ngo bo yod pa la ltos pa'i don lhag pa gzhan ni med @144b do //
translated: If a thing exists in dependence on something else, it does not have a different meaning that exists in dependence on its intrinsic reality.

original: des na rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di mi ltos so zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar rang nyid ma byung ba 'ga' zhig yod na /
analyzed: des na rgyu med pa'i phyir 'di mi ltos so zhes bya ba ni gal te sngar rang nyid ma byung ba 'ga' zhig yod na /
translated: Therefore, if it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not depend because it has no cause,‚Äù if something did not previously exist, it would not exist later.

original: rang gi ngo bo byung ba ma yin na de lta na 'di ltos pa med par 'thad pa yin no //üîΩde yang gal te rtag tu yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo byung ba ma yin na de lta na 'di ltos pa med par 'thad pa yin no // de yang gal te rtag tu yod pa nyid dam /
translated: If it does not arise from itself, then it is tenable that it does not depend on another.üîΩMoreover, it would be tenable that it is permanent or

original: yang na nam yang ma yin pa de ltar 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na nam yang ma yin pa de ltar 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: that it never exists.

original: gang gi tshe res 'ga' 'byung ba de'i tshe gal te sngon med pa dngos po gzhan gyis 'gyur bar byas pas dngos po de nyid 'di'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe res 'ga' 'byung ba de'i tshe gal te sngon med pa dngos po gzhan gyis 'gyur bar byas pas dngos po de nyid 'di'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it sometimes arises, then if it is transformed by a previously non-existent other thing, that very thing is its cause, and so it is not causeless.

original: des na de tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin pas de rgyur gyur pas dngos po gzhan las yod par srid pa sel to //
analyzed: des na de tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu yin pas de rgyur gyur pas dngos po gzhan las yod par srid pa sel to //
translated: Therefore, since it is a nature that is just that, it is a cause. Since it becomes a cause, it refutes the possibility that it exists from another.

original: de las grub pas yod pa de gal te gzhan las kyang 'byung ba'i ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las grub pas yod pa de gal te gzhan las kyang 'byung ba'i ni rgyu med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which is established from that also arises from another, it would be causeless.

original: das na mi 'byung ba kho na 'am /
analyzed: das na mi 'byung ba kho na 'am /
translated: Therefore, it would not arise at all,

original: yang na gtan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gtan du 'gyur te /
translated: or it would be permanent.

original: de lta yin na 'di de lta bu yin par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di de lta bu yin par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would be evident that it is just that.

original: gal gi tshe dngos po gzhan nye ba na 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i tshe yang yul dang dus gang du 'byung ba'i yul dang dus de rgyu can du 'gyur ro //üîΩrgyu med pa'i res 'ga' ba'i dngos po yang rgyu med pa yin no zhes smras pas ni /
analyzed: gal gi tshe dngos po gzhan nye ba na 'byung ba ma yin pa de'i tshe yang yul dang dus gang du 'byung ba'i yul dang dus de rgyu can du 'gyur ro // rgyu med pa'i res 'ga' ba'i dngos po yang rgyu med pa yin no zhes smras pas ni /
translated: But if it does not occur when another entity is nearby, then the place and time of its occurrence would be its cause.üîΩAnd if you say that the occasional entity without a cause is without a cause,

original: rgyu med par rgyu dang ldan pa yin na zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par rgyu dang ldan pa yin na zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would have to say that it is without a cause even though it has a cause.

original: 'di ltar sngon med pa de gang yod na 'byung ba de nyid 'di sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon med pa de gang yod na 'byung ba de nyid 'di sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: For if it did not exist previously, then that very thing which exists when it occurs would be its cause.

original: don gyi nus pa ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //üîΩgal te don de med par sngar yang yod na de lta na de na de'i rgyu can ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa ni de las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan zin to // gal te don de med par sngar yang yod na de lta na de na de'i rgyu can ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: For the capacity of an object is not something other than that.üîΩBut if it existed previously even without the object, then in that case it would not have a cause.

original: sngar gyi dngos po'am sngar gyi dus kyang 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ches snga par 'gyur bas rtag tu yod bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sngar gyi dngos po'am sngar gyi dus kyang 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ches snga par 'gyur bas rtag tu yod bar 'gyur ro /
translated: And if the previous entity or the previous time were not its cause, then it would be even more previous, and so it would always exist.

original: de bzhin du gal te yod na yang ma byung na de bzhin du snga ma snga ma'i don kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te yod na yang ma byung na de bzhin du snga ma snga ma'i don kyang /
translated: So too, if it exists, but does not arise, then the meaning of the previous statement is that

original: 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not the cause of that.

original: rtag tu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag tu med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is always nonexistent.

original: gal te nus pa dang bral ba na gang gi tshe de yod pa ma yod pa de'i tshe ji ltar de tsam kho nas nge'i rgyu can yin /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dang bral ba na gang gi tshe de yod pa ma yod pa de'i tshe ji ltar de tsam kho nas nge'i rgyu can yin /
translated: If it is devoid of potentiality, then when it does not exist, how can it be the cause of that?

original: de'i nus pa ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i nus pa ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: Its potentiality is just this:

original: 'di dang po med pa nyid las de nye bas yod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di dang po med pa nyid las de nye bas yod pa gang yin pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
translated: it is that which is the cause of the existence of that which previously did not exist.

original: rgyu med pa yang yod na yod pa ma bkag pas nus pa ni 'di kho na'o zhes brjod par mi nus ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang yod na yod pa ma bkag pas nus pa ni 'di kho na'o zhes brjod par mi nus ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it exists without a cause, since its existence is not refuted, can‚Äôt you say that its potentiality is just this?

original: ji ltar yod pa ma @145a * //üîΩbkag /'di ltar de yod pa sngar yang yod pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma @145a * // bkag /'di ltar de yod pa sngar yang yod pa'am /
translated: How is its existence not refuted?

original: de yod kyang med na ni de'i rgyu can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang med na ni de'i rgyu can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, but does not exist when that exists, then it is not the cause of that.

original: sngar yang yod pa na yod pas sam /
analyzed: sngar yang yod pa na yod pas sam /
translated: If it existed previously, then it would exist when that exists.

original: med pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad las 'das pa'i yod pa dang med pa ni rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad las 'das pa'i yod pa dang med pa ni rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of non-existence, existence that transcends all entities would entail eternalism.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ltos pa med pa ni rtag tu yod pa'am med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ltos pa med pa ni rtag tu yod pa'am med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, an entity that is independent would always exist or would be non-existent.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis de dag res 'ga' bar 'thad pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis de dag res 'ga' bar 'thad pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of dependence, it is tenable that they are sometimes existent and sometimes non-existent‚Äù is as follows:

original: dngos po ltos pa rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ltos pa rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEntities that are dependent‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ltos pa med pas thams cad las 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di res 'ga' yod pa dang med pa dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ltos pa med pas thams cad las 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di res 'ga' yod pa dang med pa dag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Because they are independent, they are not to be transcended by all, and therefore they are not sometimes existent and sometimes non-existent.

original: res 'ga' bar ni ltos pa nyid kyis 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: res 'ga' bar ni ltos pa nyid kyis 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that they are sometimes existent and sometimes non-existent because of dependence.

original: gang zhig dngos po gzhan yod na ni yod pa'i phyir ltos pa yod pa de ni res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po gzhan yod na ni yod pa'i phyir ltos pa yod pa de ni res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: That which is dependent because it exists when another entity exists is sometimes existent and sometimes non-existent.

original: gang zhig dngos po gang yod pa'i dus dang med pa'i dus gang yin ba de dag na dngos po de 'byung ba yod pa de'i yul can gyi rung ba dang mi rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po gang yod pa'i dus dang med pa'i dus gang yin ba de dag na dngos po de 'byung ba yod pa de'i yul can gyi rung ba dang mi rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the time when a thing exists and the time when it does not exist are the domain of the suitability and unsuitability of the existence of the arising of that thing.üîΩWhen the suitability of the arising of that thing exists, that is the time when it exists. When that is reversed, that is the time when it is unsuitable. At that time, it is the time when it exists, and not at another time.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po de'i 'byung bar rung ba dang ldan pa ni de yod pa'i dus yin la de las zlog pa dang ldan pa ni mi rung ba'i dus yin pa de'i tshe 'di ni yod pa'i dus yin la gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes resüîΩ'ga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po de'i 'byung bar rung ba dang ldan pa ni de yod pa'i dus yin la de las zlog pa dang ldan pa ni mi rung ba'i dus yin pa de'i tshe 'di ni yod pa'i dus yin la gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes res 'ga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it would be possible to say, ‚ÄúThis is the time when it exists, and not another time.‚Äù

original: dngos po rang nyid ni ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rang nyid ni ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: A thing itself does not depend on anything at all,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: 'on kyang de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nye bar na 'di rang gi rgyus mgul nas drangs pa nyid kyis yod par byed par zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nye bar na 'di rang gi rgyus mgul nas drangs pa nyid kyis yod par byed par zad do //
translated: However, when the cause that produces it is present, it is simply made to exist by its own cause, as if pulled by the neck.

original: des na 'di gang gi tshe rgyu yod pa de'i tshe 'byung la gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'di gang gi tshe rgyu yod pa de'i tshe 'byung la gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir res 'ga' ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since it occurs when its cause exists and does not occur when its cause does not exist, it is intermittent.

original: rung ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag gis ni dus kyi rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid bstan te //
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag gis ni dus kyi rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid bstan te //
translated: The possession and non-possession of a suitable entity indicate the suitability and unsuitability of time.

original: yang na dus nyid rang gi chos kyis de skad bstan te rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dus nyid rang gi chos kyis de skad bstan te rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, time itself is indicated by its own attribute, because it is taught as a principle.

original: gal te de yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag ni de'i yul can gyi rung ba dang ldan pa ma yin na de'i tshe yod pa dang med pa'i yul dang dus dag na de dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag tu nges pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te de yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag ni de'i yul can gyi rung ba dang ldan pa ma yin na de'i tshe yod pa dang med pa'i yul dang dus dag na de dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag tu nges pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the times of existence and non-existence are not suitable for the possessor of that, then it is not tenable that existence and non-existence are ascertained as possessing and not possessing that at those times.

original: gtan tshigs brjod pas khyad par bshad pa ni rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid 'dra ba can dag @145b la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pas khyad par bshad pa ni rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid 'dra ba can dag @145b la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the distinction by stating the reason is: for those that have similar suitability and unsuitability.

original: rung ba dang mi rung ba'i dngos po ni rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: rung ba dang mi rung ba'i dngos po ni rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid kyis khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that the proper and improper things are distinguished by their own proper and improper natures.

original: dngos po rung ba nyid de yang don de la rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po rung ba nyid de yang don de la rgyu nyid do //
translated: And that proper nature of a thing is the cause of that object.

original: des na de ltar dngos po ltos pa rnams res 'ga' bar 'gyur te zhes skabs brtsams te /
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po ltos pa rnams res 'ga' bar 'gyur te zhes skabs brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, things that are dependent are occasional.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i rung ba nyid yod pa dang med pa dag gis dus nges pa dang ldan par brjod do //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i rung ba nyid yod pa dang med pa dag gis dus nges pa dang ldan par brjod do //
translated: He begins the topic with this. He says that they have a definite time by the existence and nonexistence of the proper nature that is asserted as the cause.

original: de lta na yang res 'ga' ba nyid ltos pas byas par brjod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang res 'ga' ba nyid ltos pas byas par brjod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even so, how can it be said that occasionalness is made by dependence?

original: de'i phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
analyzed: rung ba dang mi rung ba nyid ji skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
translated: because of the reason that proper and improper natures are as explained.

original: de yod pa na med pa'i phyir yul dang dus 'ga' zhig spangs nas de yod pa na yod pa'i phyir yul dang dus gzhan dag na yod pa'i dngos po ni de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa na med pa'i phyir yul dang dus 'ga' zhig spangs nas de yod pa na yod pa'i phyir yul dang dus gzhan dag na yod pa'i dngos po ni de dag la ltos pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because when it exists, it does not exist, and because when it exists, it exists, having excluded some place and time, therefore, things that exist in other places and times are said to be ‚Äúassociated with dependence.‚Äù

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gzhan na med pa'i don 'ga' zhig yod na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ltos par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gzhan na med pa'i don 'ga' zhig yod na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ltos par brjod do //
translated: This is what is being said: if the existence of some object that does not exist elsewhere exists, then that very existence is said to be dependent.

original: 'ga' zhig yod na yod pa de yang yod par 'dod pa tsam la ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod na yod pa de yang yod par 'dod pa tsam la ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That existence that exists when something exists does not exist merely because it is asserted to exist.

original: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag na rung ba dang mi rung ba dag las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag na rung ba dang mi rung ba dag las so //
translated: Rather, it exists because of what is possible and impossible in the times of existence and nonexistence.

original: des na de'i dbang gis de ltar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ni de la ltos pa dang bcas par brjod do //
analyzed: des na de'i dbang gis de ltar 'gyur ba'i dngos po ni de la ltos pa dang bcas par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, things that exist in that way by the power of that are said to be ‚Äúassociated with dependence.‚Äù

original: des na ltos pa dang bcas pa res 'ga' gnas pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba yin no //
analyzed: des na ltos pa dang bcas pa res 'ga' gnas pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because of being dependent, they are sometimes present and sometimes not.

original: de ltar gang gis ltos par 'gyur ba de bstan nas 'di'i rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa res 'ga' ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de nye bar 'god pa ni /üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gis ltos par 'gyur ba de bstan nas 'di'i rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa res 'ga' ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de nye bar 'god pa ni / 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, having shown that it is dependent in that way, he now presents the nature of that which is the nature of the occasional, ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig spangs nas gzhan na yod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid ltos pa yin bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig spangs nas gzhan na yod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid ltos pa yin bar brjod do //
translated: That which is said to be ‚Äúexisting in another place after abandoning some place‚Äù is said to be dependent.

original: thams cad du gtan yod pa'am med pa la ni ltos pa'i don mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du gtan yod pa'am med pa la ni ltos pa'i don mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for the meaning of ‚Äúdependent‚Äù to be everywhere, either as existent or as nonexistent.

original: gang zhig gang spangs pa gang na yod pa de ni de la mi ltos na der nges pa ni srid do zhes bshad pa ni de dag gis byas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang spangs pa gang na yod pa de ni de la mi ltos na der nges pa ni srid do zhes bshad pa ni de dag gis byas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
